Little expensive but good food and drinks
Absolutely delicious! Very nice stuff and so so child friendly. We loved everything about about the place and will definitely be back.

We tasted some of traditional and national plates in vegan version that we enjoyed a lot. We tasted vegan momo, peanut sadeko (cold salad with peanut) and khalija set (rice flakes with vegetables and pickeld veggies). They also have a vegan cake on the menu! The personeel is very informed about veganism. The place is on a terrace in mandala street that is a pedonal street in Kathmandu. There are also two cats, very cute that just want to be petted.
Very tasty! Try nepalian starters!
One of the few restaurants in Thamel where they seem happy to adjust to wishes. The atmosphere is so good and the stuff is very helpful and so understanding. Highly recommend!
Took a friend for dinner here and this place is so wholesome. The owners were kind and hospitable folks. The food was great. My personal favorite was the slice of cashew vegan cake.
The food was really good and super fresh. Price is reasonable. Atmosphere was very cute and staff were attentive and friendly.

We visited the restaurant in the evening and enjoyed a nice view, a pleasant green atmosphere, and tasty meals. The service was great, and the staff were friendly and welcoming.

It's located on the 3rd floor, which keeps you away from the hectic street below and gives you the chance to spend a calm evening -- chatting with friends and enjoying good food.
Amazing chill place, enjoyed guacamole salad and mango lassi, must visit

We absolutely loved the food and atmosphere here! We even went back multiple times. If you're looking for a cozy spot to relax, I recommend visiting in the afternoon and enjoying the sunset. And for all you cat lovers out there, there are two adorable cats here who love to snuggle up right next to you.

Delicious food, incredible ambience, and excellent service highly recommend for anyone visiting Kathmandu and looking for a healthy delicious authentic cuisine to enjoy for a really good price. Roshan did a great job!

I came to this place several times, both before and after my trek, and it was the first spot I wanted to eat at when I got back.

I've tried the pesto pasta, various salads, and juices, and everything was absolutely delicious. The food tastes fresh, and you can tell they put care into the presentation also.

The space is super comfortable, all open with cozy chairs and couches. There's also the cutest cat that hangs around, which adds to the charm. The staff are really friendly, and honestly, I love everything about this place. Definitely my favorite spot in town!

Very good chilled spot. Goats cheese and beetroot salad was a bit light on goats cheese for my taste, but very fresh and tasty. That's definitely a starter rather than a main, btw. 3rd floor rooftop location means you're away from the bustle of Thamel. No music when I was there (mid afternoon), so perfect spot for reading. Nice decor, comfy sofas, loads of plants, and a super friendly, gorgeous white cat which curled up on my lap as soon as we met. Would recommend!
Very good!
Good food and reasonable prices. However, no view. We expected to see the street from above, but it was blocked by trees and buildings. Friendly and helpful staff.
Excellent customer service

Me and my partner contracted gastroenteritis after eating here after lunch on May 18th 2025.
I suspect it was the chicken balls from the chicken platter. I tasted they were old chicken but assumed they'd be safe, they weren't   
As customers, we prefer fresh food and are happy to pay the price to get it. It appears forest and plate were cutting corners in this regard.
I had high expectations for this restaurant, i ate here twice, and both meals were sadly disappointing. The food lacked originality and punch. Can't remember tasting herbs or spices
Very fresh and delicious food. The service is also very good. Like the place, one of the better resto's in Thamel.
Excellent salads and pasta with an amazing ambience at the rooftop. Highly recommend the forest salad!
Nice place at Thamel

We started with their cheese balls--so good! We got a table right away, drinks came fast, and the food was both quick and delicious. Definitely end with the vegan cashew dessert, it's a winner!

We were excited to have a salad post trek and Forest & Plate did not disappoint! Such nice options, and so tasty, and really generous portions! The simple dressing was delicious too. And who knew...you can get a Long Island Iced Tea (as my husband did) or other fun and strong cocktails as well as nice fresh juices. You do have to be committed to haul yourself up the stair, but once up there, it feels like you are in a tree house - such a cool atmosphere in the middle of this bustling shopping area. Definitely worth it!! The resident cat cruising around was an added bonus too!

This is an incredible place that has everything you are looking for - a wonderful location, gentle music, true atmosphere of Nepalese beauty, delicious food and perfect refreshing drinks. My favorite with ginger and mint, and the most delicious vegan momo I've ever tasted.
And of course a great people! The staff and owners greet you with a kind sincere look and friendly conversation.
This place has a real soul and you definitely want to come back here again and again. Thank you very much and definitely hope to see you next time.
Roof top resturant with a charming atmosphere and good food ans drinks. They are 2 cats that live there to witch is allways a plus

This place is absolutely INCREDIBLE. I was only in Kathmandu for two days prior to a trek but couldn't resist coming here three times. The salads are out of this world and the prices are so realistic. I leave here feeling so healthy. Highly highly recommend!!

Took a group of 10 and had the most wonderful experience. Great food, great atmosphere and service. Cool location in Thamel.

Food here is very clean, greens and veggies sourced locally and washed with purified water. Staff is warm and inviting and it is open air on the top floor, with a neat look down on mandala street. Do yourself a favor and stop in for a nice treat or dinner.

Many juices and drinks on menu as well as a great bar for the harder varieties.

Found down a quaint street off a main road, this place is up 3 flights of stairs, very unassuming but once inside is like a magical rainforest cafe. The food was exceptional, as was the service. The salads were clean and delicious and the pasta was also fresh and healthy. 100% recommend if you are looking for fresh options.
Thank you ! It was delicious

I've been in Nepal for several weeks now and keep coming back to this amazing place for fresh salads and clean nourishing food. Everything I've tried on the menu is delicious! Very lovely staff and a cute resident cat that loves to wander past! Highly recommend
qvmh khrvnh bbynyyn, n`ym nqy t`ymmmmm
Blooming marvellous. Very helpful staff. Great menu. Nice prices. What is there not to like about this place.

I passed by this vegetarian restaurant, it looked nice, and it turns out they have amazing food!
I ordered an avocado salad, I almost finished it, even though I was a small eater!

And the restaurant was partial outdoor seating with a plenty of plants inside which was super relaxing

Dining area is so comfortable, nice fresh air, on the rooftop, very cosy outdoor spacious seating space - nice casual ambiance and welcoming atmosphere

Service is patient and friendly and welcoming, and they also have cute cats around too

Open kitchen can see everything being cooked , made to order, food is served Nice and warm - absolutely delicious!!

Level 4 have to walk up stairs , a bit hard to find at first

Known for their salad bar with pasta options but I opted for some of their Nepalese options
#Aalu Tama Rs 235
#Vegetarian Momo Rs 290
#Cashew Cake Rs 390

First time trying Aalu Tama-- Predominantly sour soup with a kick of hot spice, very comforting perfect for the warm weather, With beans, potatoes, bamboo shoots and lots of spices, loaded with flavour!!

I saw the other customers get a green veggie pasta which looked so creamy and delicious so might have to try that next time.

Momos were good , filling was quite spicy, well seasoned, the wrapper was nice and thin but held together nicely

Cashew cake was sensational, so creamy and smooth- was nutty and velvety like silken tofu texture and the base was so firm, warm, crunchy and nutty with dried fruits, like a granola x carrot cake mixture and had a sweetness to it which wasn't overpowering but complemented the dessert really well

Highly recommend would come back
Very good food and drinks. The service was very kind. The place is also nice except for the cat that is jumping all over the places (tables, chairs, bar counter).
Sehr gutes Essen, tolle Leute arbeiten dort, aber die Preise sind deutlich uber dem lokalen Durchschnitt!

Beautiful fresh food in an equally beautiful setting- a relaxed verdant oasis tucked away above the hustle of the city. Friendly and welcoming, we left with our bellies full and our spirits lifted. Thank you!
Fantastic spot. Best dal bhat i've had during my travels in Nepal (that says a lot!). The vegan panna cotta was phenomenal!
The Guacamole salad was very tasty, fresh and filling and the staff were sweethearts
Amazing Cajun Himalayan Pasta! If you're looking for flavor, carbs, chicken, and some veggies, highly recommend this dish. Food came out fast. Service was great. Highly recommend~
Amazing food at a very reasonable price for the high quality that you get, great service and cozy atmosphere. Highly recommend

It's a good restaurant on the fourth floor, but there's no elevator. The food is good, the staff is polite and well-mannered, and the environment is beautiful.There is a open kitchen and you can watch the food being cooked there.
Nice

Whenever I am in Kathmandu, I come here every day! I just love the ambience, friendly staff (and cats!), chilled vibe and great food made with fresh products. Always exactly what I need after a long flight or trekking. Thank you Forest & Plate for making my stay in Kathmandu :)
Great food yummy cocktails good vegetarian

Helaas ontdekte ik deze plek pas op mijn laatste dag in KTM, anders was ik zeker teruggekomen. Het eten is heerlijk en gezond. Je krijgt grote porties tegen lage prijzen en het personeel is heel vriendelijk. Daarnaast is het een leuke plek om te zitten.
Awesome fresh and different food, friendly staff and nice atmosphere

Mandala Street 3rd floor so peaceful. Ordered a salad and the waitress was very attentive and offered cashews instead of walnuts. The food and fresh juice were great. However it took so long to catch her eye (it was not busy) after the plates were cleared that we opted for the bill rather than a cake dessert. Good for our waistlines at least. Lovely place to eat a light lunch.

Tried our first dal bhat at Forest & Plate and it didn't disappoint. Food was great and the portions were plentiful. The team were also really lovely, attentive and helpful. Would also really recommend the cheese balls.

I never really bother to write reviews, but wow, I can't not mention this one. A hidden gem in Thamel.. Tastiest salads I've probably ever tried, perfect mixture of ingridients, all veggies and fruit (veggies and fruits, in Nepal!!) are so fresh and full of flavor.. Pastas, meat, veg, seafood tasting platters, cocktails.. everything I've tried so far was tasteful and just delicious. All cooked in an open kitchen, ideal hygene, nice music and light, perfect, very kind and human service.. And very affordable prices. Thank you, guys, you are great!
Amazing spot, definitely worth a visit. Amazing food and friendly staff. The cats are cute too

Best restaurant I've visited in Kathmandu/Thamel district.
Fresh ingredients used in all dishes.
Well done!

Lovely Husband and Wife with their loyal/ talented staff has been growing Forest to Plate from a sprout to beautiful blossoming maturity.
Freshest Salads and so much more are available on the consistantly, delectable menu. Generous portions presented artisticly from the Forest to Plate.
Clean, open kitchen where you can see your delicious meal being created from the comfortable seating /eating area.
A  culinary experience that will delight your taste buds. Do yourself a favor and go.
Challenging to narrow down my favorite meal, although, if you were twisting my arm I would have to say " GUACAMOLE  SALAD!!"
To day is the day to be good to yourself.
Enjoy.

Great place for Western and Nepali food.  The pasta bolognese was tremendous,  as is everything else on the menu.  It's on the top floor...look for the stairs in a corner of this very nice enclosed area/walkway for shops and little restaurants.  The staff is very attentive and nice.  Overall, a very satisfactory restaurant experience, and we had great meals 3x out of our 8 days so far in Kathmandhu.
Place doesn't have much of sitting capacity so you may need to wait. Salads are amazing and you can enjoy fresh vegetables juices along with salads

The best restaurant in Kathmandu so far! Great environment, amazing food, very friendly staff and quick serving! :)

Namasteee/Lasso, this place, far away from our homes, felt like a little piece of home. In those five months in Nepal, we visited every time we were in Thamel and didn't even have to order because they remembered all our favourite dishes. It is such a lovely ambience, delicious food, great service and super personal. We loved this place and would 1000000...x recommend it if you are in Kathmandu. It is a hidden gem and well worth a try. We miss the great salads (no chicken add chickpeas;) ) So much love to you all from Camilla and Sophia

Forrest and Plate in Kathmandu is a must-visit! Fresh and tasty salads, just a delight for any food lover.The vibrant atmosphere and attentive service make each visit exceptional. Highly recommend this gem for anyone looking for delicious, healthy dining!

Premier fois a Kathmandou... Nous n'avons pas ete decus !!!

Les plats sont excellents ! Nous n'avons choisi que dans les specialites Nepalaises et sur le conseil de la maitresse de maison.

Les cheese balls, qui en elles-memes, peuvent paraitre tres simples et sans interet, sont a tomber et nous en avons repris. Le melange de fromage merite l'attention et la curiosite de le connaitre.

Jolie presentation des plats et un raffinement qui sont un regal.

L'accueil, le service et la gentillesse des gens de cet etablissement et des Nepalais, en general, sont inestimables.

Ne ratez pas cet endroit qui en plus d'etre bon, est beau. En terrasse et au calme c'est une parenthese enchantee qui nous est offerte.

De plus, il y a 2 chats qui ne dedaigneront pas les caresses que vous leur offrirez...

Peut-etre y retournerons nous avant notre depart. Et sinon ce sera de nouveau notre premier resto lors d'un futur voyage...

Tasty Food & Great Vibe in Thamel

We stopped by Jasper Restaurant while exploring Kathmandu, and it ended up being one of our favorite meals. The place has a chilled, welcoming vibe - perfect for taking a break from the busy streets of Thamel.

I had the momos, which were fresh and juicy - honestly some of the best I've had in Nepal so far. My wife went for the Thakali chicken set, which was packed with flavor and came with all the traditional sides. My daughter  tried the classic chicken with rice - simple, but done really well and super satisfying.

The staff were friendly and made us feel at home, and we liked the option to sit outside and enjoy the evening. We decided to sit inside.
Prices were reasonable too, especially for the quality of food and the location.

If you're in Kathmandu and want something local but clean and consistent, Jasper is a solid pick. We'll definitely be back before we leave.

Lovely place in a nice garden. Delicious momos. Can definitely recommend!
They also open and still serve food when most other places are closed.

Excellent atmosphere, great food but most importantly wonderful service.
I ate here for dinner yesterday evening, the food was great. I had a burger, chicken wings and a cocktail.
What impressed me the most was the service.
I had a young man named Shiva who was waiting on my table. He noticed that I wasn't eating the wings. I really didn't like the chicken wings (too much batter & not enough chicken).
I didn't complain but Shiva came to my table to ask me if there was any issue. He took my feedback, then went back to the kitchen to speak with the Chef and then returned with something much better.
Shiva really cared about my experience and made me feel valued as a customer. Definitely I will eat here again.

Vraiment excellent ! Meilleur petit dejeuner a l'occidentale de Katmandou.

Nous etions egalement venus pendre un verre le soir, leurs cocktails sont tres bon.

We had an amazing time at 4 Stories, Thamel! The Sexy Chicken Dumplings were juicy and packed with flavor, while the Meat Lover Pizza was loaded and satisfying. The Iced Berry Latte was refreshing with a fruity twist, and the Matcha Blueberry Latte had a unique, creamy blend of matcha and sweetness. Great rooftop vibe, good service, and totally worth the visit

Se espera que la comida sea de 10, y lo supera con creces, esta todo riquisimo. Pero lo que no te esperas es un servicio como el suyo. Cada uno de los camareros y trabajadores son extremadamente hospitalarios, amables, y cuidadosos. A Hidden Gem in Thamel!

Rating: 5/5 stars

I stumbled upon the Supper Club in Thamel, Kathmandu, and I'm so glad I did! This place is a hidden gem, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Thamel's streets.

The ambiance is cozy and intimate, with dim lighting and comfortable seating. The staff are friendly and attentive, making sure you feel right at home.

But the real star of the show is the food! The portion sizes are generous, and the prices are very reasonable.

Overall, I highly recommend the Supper Club to anyone looking for a great dining experience in Thamel. It's a must-visit!

I had a fantastic experience at the Supper Club when I visited with my wife and family for late-night food and clubbing. The moment you step into the top floor of the Sher Bhawan building, you're transported to another world. The high ceilings and 80s disco theme create a unique atmosphere that sets it apart from other restaurants in Kathmandu.

The pan-Asian menu of the restaurant has a great range of selection. I particularly enjoyed the dan dan noodles, xiao long bao, and the golden garlic fried rice. As the night progressed, more people arrived for the club scene. By midnight, the place was buzzing with energy as old school disco songs filled the air. We found ourselves lost in the nostalgia, dancing and enjoying drinks well into the early hours.

One of the great things about this place is that it's open until 5 am, allowing for a full night of fun. If you need a break from dancing, you can always pop into the restaurant area for some delicious skewers.

I noticed there seemed to be more women here compared to other clubs in Thamel, which I think is due to the visible security presence throughout the venue. This created a comfortable atmosphere for everyone, and my wife and family felt at ease all night.

One other awesome thing about Supper Club is they also own a hotel - GaasBaas Co, located in the 2nd and 3rd floor of the building of this restaurant. We actually booked a room at this hotel which allowed us to enjoy our time at Supper Club to the fullest.

For anyone looking for a combination of great food and a vibrant club scene in Thamel, I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try. It's a unique spot that offers both excellent dining and a fun night out.

Wow, just had an absolutely incredible dining experience at Kathmandu Grill Restaurant, and I seriously can't recommend it enough! From the moment you step in, the ambiance is just perfect - super welcoming and cozy, making it an ideal spot whether you're out with friends, family, or even on a date.
Now, let's talk about the food. Every single dish we tried was bursting with flavor, showcasing the rich and authentic tastes of Nepalese cuisine. But if you're going, you absolutely have to try their grilled specialties. Seriously, they're masterpieces! Each bite was perfectly cooked, juicy, and seasoned to perfection. You can tell they put a lot of care into every dish.
Beyond the amazing food and atmosphere, the service was top-notch. The staff were so friendly, attentive, and really made us feel right at home. They were happy to answer our questions and offer recommendations, which really added to the whole experience.
Kathmandu Grill Restaurant isn't just a meal; it's a delightful culinary journey. Whether you're a long-time fan of Nepalese food or looking to try something new and exciting, this place is a must-visit. You'll definitely leave with a happy stomach and a big smile! Five stars all the way!

The worst dining experience during our entire 2-week trip in Nepal.

This was the last restaurant we visited before heading home, and unfortunately, it left the worst impression.

The staff member taking our order stood over us the entire time, making the process feel rushed and uncomfortable. Then it took forever just to input the order.

There was a group of local customers seated next to us who waited around 10 minutes, and no one even came to take their order -- they eventually gave up and left. That alone says a lot about the service.

Out of the four dishes we ordered, only two were okay -- nothing special. One was mediocre, and the grilled duck was downright terrible. It was extremely dry, oddly textured, and took a thousand bites to chew. Here's a photo for reference:

When we finished eating, we raised our hands and waited patiently for over five minutes, but the lazy staff intentionally ignored us. I eventually had to shout out just to get someone to bring the bill.

This was especially disappointing because we had fantastic experiences with other high-end restaurants in Nepal -- great food, attentive service, and warm hospitality. This place was the complete opposite.

Don't be fooled by the fake-looking positive reviews. Our experience was terrible, and we absolutely do not recommend this restaurant.

Rosemary Kitchen: A Hidden Gem in Kathmandu
During a recent trip to Kathmandu, I stumbled upon Rosemary Kitchen while shopping for trekking providers in the Jhyata Area. This unplanned discovery quickly became my favorite spot in the city, surpassing all expectations.

Food Quality -
The food at Rosemary Kitchen is exceptional. Their momo was the best I've ever had--flavorful, perfectly steamed, and served with a tangy sauce. The dal bhat and Nepali thali were comforting and rich in flavor, showcasing the use of fresh, local ingredients. The menu also offers international dishes, with highlights like a fresh vegetarian pasta and indulgent desserts like chocolate cake and mango sorbet.

Menu Options -
The diverse menu caters to all tastes, with options for vegetarians, vegans, and meat lovers alike. From classic Nepali comfort food to light, healthy choices and global dishes, there's something for everyone.

Ambiance -
Rosemary Kitchen boasts a cozy, welcoming atmosphere with a mix of rustic and modern decor. Whether you choose to dine indoors or on the outdoor terrace, the peaceful vibe makes it the perfect place to relax after a busy day of sightseeing or trekking.

Convenience and Location -
Conveniently located in Jhyata Area, close to trekking providers and shopping spots, it's an ideal stop for travelers. The friendly staff ensures a seamless experience, and the fast service makes it a great choice for a quick, satisfying meal.

Prices -
Despite the high-quality food and service, Rosemary Kitchen offers great value with reasonably priced dishes. Whether you're on a budget or looking to treat yourself, the pricing is affordable.

Final Thoughts -
I'm so glad I found Rosemary Kitchen by chance. It's a must-visit in Kathmandu for its delicious food, inviting atmosphere, and reasonable prices. I'll definitely be returning next time I'm in the city!

Had an amazing food experience at Mustang Thakali by State III! The Mustang Thakali Thali was packed with authentic Himalayan flavors -- wholesome, hearty, and beautifully balanced. The Kanchampa was soft and nutty, and the Mustang Aloo had that perfect kick of spice and smokiness.

The surprise star? Their fresh watermelon juice -- chilled, naturally sweet, and super refreshing. A perfect match for the meal!

If you're craving a true taste of the hills in the city, this place delivers it with warmth and simplicity.

Mustang Thakali by State III is a fantastic dining destination, offering a perfect blend of traditional flavors and modern amenities. The ambience is remarkable, with a choice of cozy indoor seating and an inviting open space setting, making it an ideal spot for any occasion.

The highlight of the menu is undoubtedly the Thakali rice set, which is a must-try. They offer this set in various options, including veg, mutton, chicken, and fish, catering to different preferences. The set itself is a delightful assortment of items, featuring rice, Himalayan bean daal, salad, yoghurt, lalmohan, papad, spinach, horseradish pickle, tomato pickle, potato fries, bitter gourd, dried spinach, and mushroom. The combination of flavors and textures is authentic and satisfying.

In addition to the Thakali set, the restaurant offers a variety of coffee options and alcoholic beverages, adding versatility to the dining experience. Payments are convenient, as they accept QR, Fonepay, cards, and cash. They even have a loyalty program for discounts, which is a nice touch. The only downside is that the prices could be slightly more affordable.

The restaurant also boasts ample parking, which is a big plus. Overall, Mustang Thakali is a great place for delicious food and a pleasant atmosphere.
Best thakali in Kathmandu

Mustang Thakali by State III offers an authentic and delightful experience of traditional Thakali cuisine. The restaurant stands out for its warm ambiance, attentive service, and flavorful dishes that capture the essence of Nepali food. The Thakali set, with its perfectly cooked lentils, tender meats, and spicy pickles, is a must-try. Whether you're looking for a hearty meal or just a taste of local culture, this spot is sure to leave a lasting impression. Highly recommended for anyone craving a genuine Nepali dining experience!

What made the experience worse was the service. The staff came across as very arrogant and unwelcoming. I honestly felt like I was bothering them just by being there, which made the whole visit quite uncomfortable.

-Texture: Lacking a good textured bun and the mushrooms were lacking the firmness.

-side dish: the nachos were the worst , no crunch bland nachos , and terrible salsa.

-customer service: we had to go and call the waiter to pick our order , we waited for about 20 mins.

The only thing decent enough is the seating.

I would never come to choose this when there are far better options near by ( examples : Zenbites, 4 stories , Godzilla sandwich) which are better priced for their quality and taste, and customer experience
Food was great! Came out quickly, one of the best burgers in Nepal!

Hands down, one of the best burgers I've ever had! Juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection -- every bite was pure satisfaction. The buns were soft, the toppings were fresh, and the fries? Crispy magic.
The vibe of the place is chill, the staff is friendly, and the service was quick.
If you're a burger lover, this place is a must-visit. 10/10 would burger again!

Nice

My favorite? Hands down the Char-Grilled Salivator -- juicy, smoky, and packed with flavor.

Highly recommend this place if you love burgers done right. Great service, great vibe, and absolutely amazing food. Don't miss the Salivator -- it lives up to its name!

Nos gusta mucho este restaurante de hamburguesas. Siempre que podemos, ordenamos en Patao y ahora hemos venido al lugar y la experiencia fue bastante buena.
Las hamburguesas estaban jugosas, con ingredientes frescos y bien combinados. Las papas fritas crujientes, con pollo, estaban bien sazonadas, fueron un buen acompanamiento.

El ambiente es agradable, con buena musica y un servicio amable. Los precios son razonables para la calidad que ofrecen.

!Recomendado si buscas una hamburguesa sabrosa en un lugar agradable, en Thamel!

From the warm welcome to the last bite, everything about our dinner was perfect. The dishes were absolute magic !! I'm still thinking about that incredible flavour. What really stood out was how the staff made us feel, attentive without being intrusive, and genuinely passionate about the food they were serving.
The space itself strikes that rare balance between elegant and comfortable.
It's rare to find a place that gets every detail right, but "Ts your palate" nails it. We left already planning our next visit - and I'd tell anyone looking for a special night out to do the same.

 (Worth every penny)

Ts your palate offers a delightful fusion of flavors, presented with creativity and finesse. The atmosphere is stylish yet comfortable, making it a great choice for both casual dining and intimate gatherings. Every dish is thoughtfully crafted, reflecting a strong passion for culinary excellence.

Easily one of the best burger spots I've been to! Juicy patties, flavorful toppings, and buns that actually hold up and the staffs are so welcoming and kind. Loved the vibes and can't wait to come back!

Absolutely amazing experience at T's Palace! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warmth and hospitality. The atmosphere is inviting, the service is top-notch, and the attention to detail is impressive. Every dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented -- you can tell a lot of care goes into everything they do. Whether you're here for a casual meal or a special occasion, T's Palace delivers excellence. Highly recommended!

Went there with a friend just to chill over a coffee and snack, but the whole experience was seriously off-putting. One of the waiters kept peeping at our table the entire time -- not in a professional way, but in a very creepy, invasive way. He kept staring at my friend and making her visibly uncomfortable. His looks and behavior came off straight-up perverted.

Even though we had already ordered, he kept coming back again and again, asking if we wanted anything else. It felt like we weren't even allowed to sit peacefully without being harassed into ordering more.

If you're a foreigner or a couple, I honestly suggest not going there. You'll likely be stared at, interrupted constantly, and made to feel unwelcome. Totally ruined the vibe. Never going back.

"I had an amazing experience at this lounge and restaurant! The ambiance was cozy and inviting, with soft lighting and comfortable seating. The staff were attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu, making excellent recommendations.
The food was incredible, with a diverse menu that catered to all tastes. I loved the creative on dishes, and the presentation was almost too beautiful to eat.
"The service was top-notch, with our server providing exceptional attention to detail. They were prompt, courteous, and went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed.
"I highly recommend this lounge and restaurant for a great dining experience. Whether you're looking for a romantic evening or a night out with friends, this place is sure to impress.

We just had dinner at Carpe Diem Lounge & Bakery and the experience was absolutely outstanding. From the very beginning, the service was impeccable warm, attentive, and genuinely thoughtful. The staff made us feel completely welcomed and cared for.
What truly surprised us was the portion sizes: very generous, beautifully presented, and incredibly tasty. Every dish we ordered exceeded our expectations in both flavor and quantity. It's rare to find a place that delivers such a perfect mix of quality, value, and top-tier service.
Without a doubt, this is a must-visit spot if you're in Kathmandu and looking for an excellent dining experience in a cozy atmosphere with exceptional hospitality. We will definitely be coming back!

There is an extra lively staff, some cute and smiling all the time, and will post a pic below. I highly recommend this place to anyone who is passing by ktm for a comfortable food plus stay. The creativity, artwork, green, and plants will steal your heart. I wish there was a dedicated co-working space, and that's all. The food is open till 10.30pm a big plus.

I have been there and have few suggestions.
These can help in customer flow If applied 

Price of Veg Unlimited =  900-1000 ( Let's Assume )
A person cannot eat that much, and 1000 is a little high for a person, so they can't come back often.

BUT ,
If - In 1000 a couple can be involved then it becomes a decent price, so Any couple can spend 900-1000 for 2 people probably on every friday Night coz 450-500 is decent price.

OR, You can just cut the price by half & Make a One time Serve on table ( One time Buffet - on table ).

This will help the same customer come back again and again ( JUST LIKE UTPALA CAFE *** - If you see , it's full of customers almost even evening - due to affordable pricing, while other such restro don't have enough Customer Flow )

Vinoliva Restaurant & Bar is an absolute gem nestled in the heart of Kathmandu. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with an inviting ambiance that sets the stage for a remarkable dining experience.

The quality of food here is truly exceptional. Each dish is crafted with care and expertise, showcasing the culinary mastery of the chefs. Whether you're craving traditional Nepali flavors or exploring international cuisines, Vinoliva has something to tantalize every palate. The freshness of ingredients and attention to detail shine through in every bite, making each dish a delightful culinary journey.

What sets Vinoliva apart is not just the delicious food, but also the warm hospitality and impeccable service. The staff members are attentive, knowledgeable, and always ready to cater to your needs, ensuring that your dining experience is nothing short of perfection.

One of the standout features of Vinoliva is its spacious and well-maintained parking facility. Finding parking in Kathmandu can often be a challenge, but Vinoliva makes it hassle-free, allowing you to focus on enjoying your meal without any worries.

Moreover, Vinoliva is truly a family-friendly establishment. The welcoming atmosphere and thoughtful amenities make it the perfect place to dine with loved ones of all ages. From high chairs for the little ones to a diverse menu that caters to various dietary preferences, Vinoliva ensures that everyone feels comfortable and satisfied.

Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner for two, a lively gathering with friends, or a memorable family outing, Vinoliva Restaurant & Bar exceeds expectations on every level. With its combination of quality food, excellent service, convenient parking, and family-friendly environment, it's no wonder that Vinoliva is a beloved dining destination in Kathmandu.

We really enjoyed dinner at the Roadhouse Cafe in Thamel, Kathmandu. We'd already been to the Roadhouse Cafe in Pokhara and had excellent pizza, so we decided to book at the Roadhouse Hotel in Kathmandu, and we can confirm tonight that we made an excellent choice. We ordered both the pulled pork pizza and the pepperoni pizza, and honestly, they were spot on. The pulled pork pizza had that perfect balance--tender, juicy pork with just the right smoky sweetness that paired beautifully with the cheese. The pepperoni pizza was exactly how it should be: crispy edges, rich flavor, and every bite packed with that satisfying punch.

On top of the food, the service really made the experience. Miss Astha went above and beyond--attentive, friendly, and professional throughout. It's rare to have such flawless service where you feel genuinely taken care of. The combination of great food and her perfect service made the whole visit memorable.

Definitely recommend, and will be back!

Recently had dinner at Yala Cafe & Coffee Shop, and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish. The cozy atmosphere and warm hospitality made it a perfect spot to unwind in the evening.

I tried their grilled chicken with sauteed vegetables and a side of mashed potatoes - it was flavorful, well-portioned, and beautifully presented. The ingredients tasted fresh, and the seasoning was just right. I also enjoyed a glass of their homemade iced tea, which was refreshing and not overly sweet.

The staff were attentive and friendly, always checking in to ensure everything was to our liking. The service was quick, but we never felt rushed.

If you're looking for a peaceful dinner spot in Kathmandu with good vibes, delicious food, and excellent service, I highly recommend Yala Cafe. Definitely coming back again!
Good food, reasonable price, good servers, good place to sit and enjoy a meal. since both me and my husband eat little portions, it's great they were okay that we shared a single thali.

What stood out was the warm and polite service. The staff were attentive, and I appreciated that they accepted Indian Rupees (INR), which made things easier for me as a traveler. The cafe has a relaxed vibe, making it a nice spot to unwind. While not the most exceptional in Thamel, it's a good place for a peaceful meal and friendly service if you're nearby.

I had a wonderful visit to Yala Cafe, a peaceful gem tucked down a quiet alley in Thamel. The charming outdoor seating area surrounded by greenery creates a lovely setting to enjoy your morning brew or a relaxed afternoon bite . The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between cozy and bright, blending traditional touches with modern flair .

The menu is thoughtfully curated--from hearty breakfasts like Eggs Benedict, country breakfasts, and pancakes, to a range of Nepali and international dishes at lunch and dinner . I especially enjoyed the Sunny Morning Power breakfast with sauteed veggies and a side of fresh juice, plus the house-made espresso using Nepali beans. The coffee was smooth and aromatic, and their teas, particularly the Ilam black and masala chai, were flavorful and comforting .

Service was friendly, attentive, and genuinely warm--staff happily recommended dishes and offered tweaks, creating a genuine hospitality vibe . I've also read that tourists appreciate not just the service but also the insight and travel tips shared by staff .

A couple of minor drawbacks: prices are slightly above average for the area, especially dinners, and it can get busy during peak hours (though the wait is worth it if you snag a seat in the courtyard). A few dishes felt just shy of perfection, but most were consistently delicious.

Overall: Yala Cafe earns a solid 4 stars for its relaxing atmosphere, fresh and varied menu, high-quality coffee and tea, and warm service. It's a must-visit whether you're grabbing breakfast, unwinding with a drink, or lounging over lunch. Minor tweaks to pricing and kitchen consistency could elevate it even further, but it's already a standout in Kathmandu's cafe scene.

The food and service here were wonderful, I had to visit twice during my few days in Nepal. The banana porridge was among my favorites...hot, creamy and full of flavor in the best way. I had a few other items from a menu including the puri and pancake with honey. I definitely ordered more than I should have on my first visit but glad I was able to enjoy all the deliciousness. The service was excellent as well. My server recognized me the second time around and he was just as wonderfully attentive as he was during my initial visit. Highly recommend!
I'd definitely recommend yala cafe to anyone looking for great food and good service.
We went for breakfast and really enjoyed the food, the excellent service and the prices are affordable. recommend yala cafe for the best breakfast or brunch in thamel.

Yala Cafe truly served one of the best breakfasts I've had in Nepal! The food was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. From the perfectly brewed coffee to the delicious local and international breakfast options, everything was on point.

The garden setting added so much to the experience--calm, peaceful, and a perfect start to the day. The staff were warm, welcoming, and attentive, making the whole visit feel special.

If you're in Nepal and looking for a place to enjoy a relaxing morning with great food and ambiance, Yala Cafe is definitely the spot. Highly recommended!

I recently visited Yala Cafe with a group of friends, and it was an amazing experience from start to finish. The staff managed a table for us so beautifully, making sure we were comfortable and well taken care of.

The garden setting was calm and peaceful, creating the perfect atmosphere for catching up and relaxing. The food was delicious, and the service was fast, friendly, and professional. Their hospitality was truly top-notch--it made us feel genuinely welcomed.

Whether you're going solo or with friends, Yala Cafe is a must-visit for anyone looking for great vibes, tasty food, and a peaceful environment highly recommended

I recently visited Yala Cafe and had such a wonderful time. The garden area is so calm and peaceful--it truly feels like a little escape from the noise of daily life. Sitting there surrounded by greenery was incredibly relaxing.

The food was just as impressive--fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Everything I tried was delicious. Whether you're looking for a quiet place to unwind or enjoy a good meal, Yala Cafe is the perfect spot. Highly recommend it!

service is good but food is totally waste of money

There's a funny little story connected to this place. I came here with my friend after a morning hike -- and while sitting down, I suddenly noticed that my foot was bleeding.
It turned out I had been bitten by a leech during the hike, and it must have fallen off on its own -- I didn't even notice it. That's probably why the bleeding started later, right there at the cafe.

My friend asked the staff if they had a first aid kit, and they immediately rushed over to help. It wasn't anything serious, just a small thing -- but their care and kindness made a big impression.
10 stars for customer service! Huge thanks to them.

Oh, and by the way -- the food is super delicious, and you can sit in a lovely open-air courtyard.

Highly recommended!

Amazing cute cafe that offers wonderful drinks and delicious meals. Came here for breakfast and had the local breakfast with a latte and it was a filling and hearty way to start the day. Great service and wonderful outdoor seating. They offer indoor as well.

What made the experience even better was the exceptional service. The staff were incredibly attentive, kind, and always made me feel welcome. It's rare to find a place where both the food and the service are this outstanding.

If you're in Kathmandu and looking for a spot that truly gets everything right, this is the place to go. I can't recommend it enough!

Located inside the Marriott , the restaurant serves mixed cuisines as well as buffet. When I had the buffet I thought it was quite average however some of the items from the ala carte are quite good. Highly recommend the thai green curry and red curry.
Tout est parfait merci a toute l'equipe
The excellent masala tea in Tamel

Gaia is a beautiful spot to enjoy breakfast, lunch, or dinner with friends and family. The food is delicious, the staff are warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere is peaceful, surrounded by greenery that makes every meal feel refreshing and special. It's the kind of place where good food meets good vibes.

One of the At Gaia Restaurant - my favorite spot in town!
I come here almost every day -- it's like family. Best lasagna and more
Whether it's a hearty meal before trekking or a relaxing dinner after a long hike, Gaia never disappoints.
Delicious food, warm vibes, and great memories always start here.
#GaiaRestaurant #TravelNepal #TrekkingEats #FoodieTravel #NepalDiaries #HimalayaVibes #WanderlustEats #TrekkingNepal #LocalFavorites #ExploreNepal #AdventureFuel #BackpackersChoice #TasteNepal #PostTrekTreat best places to be !!!

The food is superb with the best quality and quantity as well. I had a chicken biryani which was so delicious thanks to ched and our manager manoj sapkota who was very good and humble love the hospitality he showed to us thank you so much Gaia for the care.
All are perfect service
It's a nice restaurant with lovely foods. All the staffs, owners are very respectful! Must visit restaurant in Thamel

Gaia is the place to go if you want to escape the chaos of thamel, it has a lovely garden and the staff here are super welcoming. My go too here is the lasagna and for a vegetarian option the stuffed eggplant is delicious!!!
For many years Gaia has been my go to for great food, relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff. One of the best restaurants in Thamel.

I love this restaurant that one of my tour guides recommended and have had excellent food and service. They are off a side street so it's quiet and not flooded with tourists. The hummus was delicious, the Nepali set meal incredible and their lasagna incredible. And prices are local. It is certainly worth the trip here!
Peaceful and very amazing environment. Excellent . Very friendly staffs. Healthy and cosy effective food. A must go to eatery in the town
The food were absolutely great. The staff were friendly. Nice atmosphere.

Gaia Restaurant truly exceeded my expectations! The service was top-notch - server was attentive, knowledgeable, and made excellent recommendations.

The food was phenomenal - fresh, organic, and prepared with impeccable hygiene. Every bite was a delight! The menu boasted an impressive array of healthy options that didn't compromise on flavor.

The ambiance was equally impressive - warm, inviting, and perfect for a night out with friends or a romantic evening. The decor was tasteful, and the overall vibe was relaxed and sophisticated.

If you're looking for a restaurant that serves delicious, healthy food in a beautiful setting with exceptional service, look no further than Gaia!

The excellent Resturant in Kathmandu.

Delicious food, lovely ambiance, and friendly service. Really enjoyed the dinner - great taste and warm hospitality!

I have had a very good experience with Gaia Restaurant and its food. Gaia has always focused on quality and hygiene. I must have had lunch and dinner there over 100 times, sometimes with clients and sometimes with family, and we have never felt the food was unhealthy. These days, there is a lot of competition to make food taste good, but I personally prefer healthy food without preservatives.

I have seen some reviews about Gaia, but I always recommend Gaia for its healthy and hygienic food, excellent service, and amazing ambience with a beautiful garden.

A beautiful place
friendly atmosphere
Reasonable price

The vegetarian thali set at this restaurant is significantly overpriced (790 NPR) given its very poor taste. Several standard ingredients were missing, which was disappointing. We've tried many thali sets in Kathmandu, often for less than 650 NPR, and unfortunately, this one was by far the most underwhelming.

Best resturant in Kathmandu.
The food service and staff are  so good. The garden can't explan .

Very bad experience with the cafe we ordered a veg sandwich and they literally gave me bread with lettuce when we told him it doesn't look like a sandwich the guy who served replied ohh really what a pathetic answer and pathetic food.and the price of one piece of sandwich is like 870
Never ever visit the kind of place.

An extremely overpriced place and not good food. We understand a place charging high but there wasn't any value for money here and the portion sizes weren't justified. We ordered 2 sandwiches grilled chicken - was extremely dry overcooked chicken, stale bread and zero seasoning/flavour. The vegetarian sandwhich wasn't good either, the lettuce wasn't fresh, very grainy bread. Only thing worthy was the coffee which was decent. Highly evaluate before visiting this place.
I have visited Gaia several times must of the time I visited with friends and family, the foods quality is very good staff are so friendly. The place very clean.
One of the best Restaurant in Kathmandu.

Best Restaurant Thamel Kathmandu Nepal .
I have goon in Gaia several times. This  year with my best clients. Gaia's services is best and be better nice food and garden.

Wonderful Breakfast Experience at Gaia Restaurant

I visited Gaia Restaurant this morning for breakfast, and it was an excellent experience. The breakfast was delicious, and the coffee was just perfect. The garden is beautiful and full of greenery, creating a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere.

The staff were very friendly and welcoming, which made the visit even more enjoyable. I had a small meeting with my friends there, and the setting was ideal for it. Before leaving, I ordered a chicken burger and a pizza to take away for my family--I'm sure they will love it!

I highly recommend Gaia Restaurant to anyone looking for great food, a lovely environment, and warm service.
Best Restaurant in Thamail Kathmandu Nepal, Every day I am at Gaia Restaurants for Breakfasts, Lunch, or Dinner they are best one of the best Pizza, and lasagna and more,,,,
The best Breakfast in Kathmandu Lunch and Dinner too. Garden Resturant
Located in the quieter street of Thamel, the restaurant is comfy,  offers great selection of dishes, and provides good service. The food portion is very decent, and the taste is very good.
Ce que j'aime le plus c'est la facon d'etre servis. Les repas sont tres bons et le cadre aussi. Je vous conseille d'y aller pour un bon repas et un moment reposant.

Gaia Restaurant is nearby my office I ofton go their with my friends and family I like their friends and service all the members of gaia like my friends the foods are healthy and natural Pizza, Lasagna, Salad, and cakes are my favorite  the Ambience is great.
Great organic espresso, tasty organic herb salad, beautiful garden with soft music, gentle service - great pleasure
Please be careful when you are getting back your change. The cashier tried to give me Rs100 lesser. He looked very skilful and must have done this many times to tourists.

I have been several time at Gaia the garden I like very much
Foods are very healthy and natural service good,
Buena comida en un ambiente agradable
Conseille par notre hotel, nous avons vraiment tout apprecie, l'ambiance, les serveurs, le cadre et bien sur la cuisine. Tellement aime que nous y sommes retournes quatre soir !

Iconic Restaurant is located in Thamel. I've been to Gaia several times, and every time the food is excellent, and the service is fantastic. The staff are amazing. They also have a resort in Dhulikhel called Gaia Holiday Home, offering the best hospitality and stunning panoramic views.

Amazing food with good serving sizes. Fast service and good location.

I went out for dinner and drinks two days in a row here, the service is impeccable and the servers really take interest! recommend this place especially for tourists visiting kathmandu for the first time

Gaia is a lovely little oasis in chaotic Thamel. Looking for a 'safe' option after an earlier tummy upset, I had the marinated chicken fillet on roast potatoes and it was divine, along with a very refreshing lemon soda on ice. The service is also exceptional. The courtyard is very pleasant during the day and the ambience at night is also lovely, I stopped in for a drink last night. You won't regret a meal here during your stay in Kathmandu.
Super friendly and attentive staff, really nice food and atmosphere and central location in Thamel :)

Excellent food and service and very nice place. If not the best , one of the best foods we had in Nepal in 12 days . Prices  are also reasonable
Highly recommended. Thank you

Ik heb hier alleen gegeten en heb het ontzettend fijn gehad hier. Alles was top: sfeer was gezellig, eten was lekker en service was goed. Prijs kwaliteit is ook zeker oke. Ik kom hier zeker terug als ik in Nepal ben. De plek is rustig en in een steegje waar niet veel mensen of auto's langskomen. Alles was simpelweg top. Dankjewel voor deze fijne avond

We were the only customers when we arrived late afternoon so I was a bit nervous if we made a mistake coming here. But. The service was very prompt and friendly. Then our food arrived and it tasted like heavenly soul food ! We ordered the chicken breast smothered in a delicious sauce and a vegetable dish. We stuck with non alcoholic drinks. People were arriving when we were leaving. Highly recommended !
Good food, big portions of chicken sizzler. Excellent service. Nice atmosphere.

Excellent place for any meal! Everytime I go it is very relaxed. However, I am served and attended to immediately. There is a good variety of items on the menu from different cuisines. Will definitely come back during my stay in Kathmandu. Thank you!

Awesome food with good ambience and the service is very fast. Love it

Gaia Restaurant, located in the heart of Thamel, truly stands out as one of the best dining spots in the area. As someone who frequently visits various restaurants with clients for lunch or dinner, I can confidently say Gaia consistently exceeds expectations.

Most of my clients are from Europe, and they often rave about the quality of the food at Gaia. The pizza, lasagna, sizzlers, and fresh salads are always a hit. Each dish is crafted with care and bursting with flavor.

The staff is exceptionally friendly and attentive, always ensuring a pleasant dining experience. The ambiance of the restaurant adds to its charm--calm, welcoming, and perfect for both casual and formal gatherings.

Gaia has become a trusted choice for me and my clients. If you're in Thamel and looking for delicious food paired with great service, Gaia Restaurant is a must-visit!

I really like their veg chowmin!
Veg Momo also looks good and yummy!
Good location, atmosphere and service, thank you!
The place,services and talking about food is rlly delicious people are very friendly and I love this place .
Fast service
Belle ambiance. Personnel sympathique. Cuisine

Food and ambience was great. It took forever for the food to arrive though, I had to wait close to an hour. :( I guess it's because it was close to Tihar and they were short-staffed but I wish they communicated that earlier so that I could plan around it.

(Tawa chicken was criminally good)
Absolutely loved this place! We came here every day while in Thamel and had a great experience every time. Food tasted great and service was excellent.

We really enjoyed Gaia Restaurant during our Honey Moon, it is actually the only restaurant in Nepal in which we repeated, and we did it 3 times!

The food is excellent, the prices are fair and the attention is great, specially from Sanjog Puri who served us professionally, sweetly and kindly.

Hope we can come back!

We had visited the Hard Rock Cafe in Kathmandu the previous evening & had a shockingly bad experience, so the Gaia restaurant was a joy in terms of a smooth, friendly service, with excellent food & atmosphere for our party of 8, which, despite them being packed out, they provided attentive service throughout. We would all definitely recommend, and are disappointed to have only found this place on our last night in Kathmandu.

Gaia Restaurant is a hidden gem on the side of Thamel.

It offers a peaceful garden setting and serves fresh, healthy food. While orders may take a bit longer to prepare, the wait is well worth it, as the meals are packed with benefits for your health. The service is excellent, and the staff are incredibly friendly.

As someone who runs a travel company and brings customers from all over the world, I've visited Gaia many times. My clients always love the restaurant and its food. I highly recommend Gaia Restaurant!

Hidden gem in the corner with the perfect style. The food were absolutely great. The staff were friendly. Nice atmosphere.

Gaia was near our hotel so we ended up there first out of convenience. I had the chicken satay for lunch and it was great. The chicken was moist and cooked well. My partner had the chicken chilli- also very tasty. It was more like a Chinese sweet and sour than a spicy dish. We ended up eating there again for dinner the same day. I had the farm house chicken. It was nice to have a bit of comfort food during our travels. We also ordered the pork chop which was excellent. Another highlight is the environment of the restaurant. It is such a pleasant garden passion and it was full. Always a good sign when a restaurant has to turn people away.
Very  nine Restaurant in Kathmandu fresh and tasty foods and drinks ,

In our week in Kathmandu, this was the one restaurant we made it a point to visit twice. We loved the garden atmosphere, the service was fantastic, and the food was so delicious. The aloo sadeko and paneer tikka butter masala were especially good. You could tell they take the quality of their food very seriously.

Very good Restaurant in Thamail kathmandu Nepali. The ford's, Service, staffs, ambience, are very very good the garden is the best.

Cafe Mitra is truly an oasis in the heart of Kathmandu. I have been coming here for almost 10 years and each time it is better.

We ordered 3 items..the first item chips chilly was fine. Then we ordered a thai green curry which had a weird taste to it and it wasn't authentic at all, after complaining..the staff used sarcasm instead of changing it. The last time, chicken sizzler, the meat wasn't cooked properly and the gravy was not at all to the mark. The only reason was stayed was the live music playing.

Very good tasty food with great service and staff is very helpful. Good ambiance with coziness and warmth.
We tried Thukpa first time and it was very tasty, Himalayan potato was yummy too.
Tofu Choila was flavourful and interesting, very much like a paneer vegetable dish.
Great food, very quick service. Open fire makes a lot of difference on a chilly night.
A cozy restaurant nestled away from the hustle of the city. Staff is very friendly and kind. They have the best Thai Green Curry!!
Nel quartiere di Thamel. Locale carino all'aperto. Servizio buono. Cibo nepalese e indiano. Caro rispetto agli standard del luogo.

In the midst of craziness of Thamel, cafe Mitra serves a cozy, quiet and comfortable dining experience. We enjoyed salads which came with the momos and curry plates. Chicken Tikka butter masala was delicious and soup chicken momo was lovely. Momo chutney was yummy, probably the best we have come across in our whole trip in Kathmandu. However, Danish pork chop was a bit dry, paneer spinach dish was really salty for our liking, roti tasted like a pre-done doughy flat-bread, and Nepali curry was a meh. I would also not get cappuccino and masala chiya here again. They were both average at best. Overall, a good experience with the atmosphere and greens.

Vkusno . Russkoe kafe v Katmandu, zdes kakoe-tomesto vstrechi russkih turistov. Shikarnyy dal bat.

Very cute and peaceful place in the heart of busy and noisy Thamel. You instantly feel good when you inter this little oasis of a cafe. Go sit on the 2nd floor patio at the very back. Food is good ans staff is friendly/respectful. I'm sad I discovered this cafe when I was about to go back to my country.

After five nights in Kathmandu this remained one of my favorite cafes. The patio is pleasant and relaxing in the midst of Thamel activity. The service was friendly. The good was tasty and most importantly the cleanliness was excellent. Will definitely come again.
Cafe with a nice little backyard with trees. Cafe and meal are decent. Prices are on the higher side. Unclear if AC is available during hot summers. Their constant faint music is annoying though.

Restaurant located in thamel, They serve a huge n delicious portion of avocado salad, breakfast options are also quite good. One of the descent places in thamel for breakfast, lunch and dinner

Everything about the visit was great, including the tasty cuisine, attentive service, and quaint setting. "We had a great time eating at Cafe Mitra and Lounge Bar. Everything was handled really nicely from the time we arrived until we departed. I'm grateful to the group for organizing such a positive trip. We will visit soon...

The Nepali thali was excellent, as a Tamilian I enjoyed it.

Gulab Jamun was given in curd, but don't  judge the book by it's cover. It was better than Gulab Jamun in ice cream.

Walked into this place after a tatoo and piercing. We truly enjoyed the meals, best salad in Thamel, hands down! A must try, their mint lemonades are amazing!!!  Excellent service and fresh food, what else do we need?

Restaurant bar in a court in between 2 buildings of a busy commercial street in Thamel, that offers a light breeze during the hot season with some shade and a terrasse with some space dedicated as a non-smoking area.
The service is really good. Waiters are attentive and efficient, speak good English.
The menu offers a large span with some suprizing options such as salmon or ostreich. We tried the avocado salad which was really flavory and satisfying. Momos (local dumplings) are tasty and rich in local spices.
We were not sarisfied with the lassi, which were too watery (plain and mango).
--
In overall the place is in line with other comments we read and we enjoyed our meal.

We had dinner here. Ordered two of the Thai options. The food was nice, and it came out in a decent time. I wouldn't say it was authentic Thai, but it was still tasty. We sat outside in a small courtyard with trees over hanging, which was nice. There was also a large projector screen  showing the Euros Football.

Buona cucina e piatti ben presentati, Personale rilassato e non invadente.

Price is not affordable. Ambience is great.

Great ambience makes me go for a beer with Nepalese friend in the evening. It seems to be a gorgeous place to enjoy Gorkha with genuine people. It is spacious and roomy.

Amazing food, insane cheap prices and cute terrace! We came here multiple times during our stay in thamel! Coffees are delicious and super affordable :)

Really good quality food. I had the avocado and dragon fruit salad and it was very filling, healthy and delicious. The service is good, the place is very relaxing and chill. Prices are higher than average in Kathmandu, even for Thamel. It's worth it if you want salads or healthy food.

The environment of the place is incredible, Babermahal compound, but the restaurant itself is of weak game in comparison of the others in this qualitative place. The welcome and service were impeccable, although we kept seeing kitchen staff coming and going in the park...
But the big disappointment came from the food, which was as disappointing as the mediocre cocktails. The coffee service took a long time even though there were only a few customers there, as I imagine is often the case...
Only one toilet to share for everyone and no water on tap... with a view over the back yard of the kitchens in passing.
In short, a mediocre experience given the setting.

Stepping into this restaurant feels like entering a different era, with its beautiful courtyard and classical building that exude charm and elegance. The ambience is unmatched, creating a memorable dining experience. While the parking could be better managed, the overall tranquility and ambiance make up for it. The prices are on the higher side, but the experience is worth every penny for a special occasion.

I went to Mul chowk resturant with my family. Atmosphere and customer service was quite good and food was alright . However, when we received the bill I saw 13% VAT added. As I came to Nepal after half a decade I had very vague idea about if I should be paying additional VAT therefore I asked the waiter about it. Waiter seemed very confused and babbled irrational reasons for additional VAT. I was not able to see manager as waiter tried to diffuse the situation with invalid explanations. When I came home and run down through the law, I picked that no restaurants are allowed to add additional VAT(legally) and is reportable in case of non-compliance. It's disheartening to see how restaurants are going against law to make money out of their own people. Would love to see an explanation on this matter from owner and happy to be contacted .

Visited this place in the evening to try it out. It's quiet and peaceful, good for a date. Considering the pricing though, I must say that things weren't up to the mark. You can get better food for way more reasonable pricing all around Kathmandu, especially the Jhamsikhel and Thamel areas.

Bruschetta: The worst I have had in quite some time. It was literally just diced tomatoes on top of 5 small pieces of bread. I expected better.

Wine Glazed Chicken: Came with a side of mashed potatoes and sauteed vegetables. It was juicy but super bland.

Spaghetti: The spaghetti was undercooked and there was no salt. Again, tasted very bland and we weren't able to eat all of it even though both of us were super hungry.

Other aspects: The service itself was good and the staff were friendly + helpful. The toilet was super disappointing and exhibited a clear lack of regular cleaning and maintenance. Overall, if it's value for money you're looking for, this is probably not the place. The experience and especially the food was quite disappointing.
Great space for eating out in a quite location inside an old durbar. Excellent for small parties. Loved the appetizers and buffet menu. Beats banquet and party palace food anyday at a good price.

The food is decent. The hamburger I ordered is okay, but I wouldn't say it is worthy of the price. The prices at this property is a bit expensive (I can afford but I can easily find cheaper substitutes in Kathmandu). The restaurant supports QR payment, which also supports Alipay Zhi Fu Bao. However one thing I was a bit uncomfortable about was that the waiter seemed not to trust me that I had made the payment since I showed him the screen page on my phone confirming the payment was successful, then he walked to somewhere idk. And later he came back and kindly requested to take a picture of the successful payment page. I mean it is understandable to check if the payment was through, but I suppose they could do on their computer or something; this kind of gesture made me wonder if I was trusted by the people at the property.

Here's a best review for a restaurant:
"Absolutely blown away!
From the moment we stepped inside, the ambiance was enchanting. The decor was stunning, creating an intimate and sophisticated atmosphere. Our server was incredibly attentive and knowledgeable, offering excellent recommendations.
But the real star of the show was the food. Every dish was a masterpiece - beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. We started with the chilli chicken pizza, which was simply divine. For our mains, I had the rolling kebab with naan and my partner had the paneer pasandida with garlic naam. Both were cooked to perfection and incredibly flavorful.
Highly recommend!

Whether you're staying at the resort or just visiting for a meal, Regal Flavors offers an unforgettable experience. The combination of an idyllic atmosphere, exquisite food, and top-notch service makes it a great choice for anyone looking to indulge in a memorable dining experience. It's clear that the resort places a high value on both comfort and culinary excellence.

The ambience was warm and inviting. The interior featured a rustic theme with wooden tables, soft lighting, and tasteful art on the walls. The subtle background music added to the relaxed atmosphere without overpowering conversations. The seating was comfortable, and the restaurant was spotless, including the restrooms. Overall, it felt like a cozy yet upscale dining experience.
The restaurant exudes elegance with its dim lighting, soft classical music, and plush seating.The decor features a blend of modern art and vintage accents, adding a touch of sophistication.

I recently visited  Regal Flavours Restro and Bar and it exceeded all my expectations. The ambiance was warm and inviting, perfect for a cozy meal or a special occasion. The staff were attentive, friendly, and made us feel incredibly welcome.

The highlight, of course, was the food! Every dish was beautifully presented and packed with flavor. The Thali was a standou perfectly cooked and bursting with taste. Their use of fresh, high-quality ingredients was evident in every bite.

They also have vodka, whiskey and other hard alcohol, if you like.
Also buffalo meat, chicken - finally, life is full of flavors again!

After being ovo-fish-veg diet in Rishikesh, where things were pretty bland, I need to pace myself. That said, I definitely don't miss hard alcohol.

The vegetarian noodle soup Thukpa smells divine - garlic, red/spring onion, carrot, cabbage thinly sliced, yumm, and either butter or ghee.

Too bad I'm only here for one day, and on the first day, my stomach isn't ready for the meat Thukpa, which seems to be very popular here.

It's quite spicy though - red chili! Also serve condiments: pickled green chilies and a red chili paste - definitely skipping those.

The noodles themselves are nothing special most probably made of wheat, but the broth is amazing. I can only imagine how delicious the meat broth must be!

Definitely worth of try.
Excellent momos in a 'no nonsense' kind of set up!

Everyone should take a visit while at Kathmandu.

If you're in Kathmandu and you haven't tried the chili momos at Yangling Tibetan Restaurant, what are you even doing with your life? These bad boys are spicy--and I mean spicy--but in the best possible way. As someone who enjoys a good kick in the mouth, these chili momos quickly became my favorite dish during my stay. Seriously, if you like your food to bring a little (or a lot) of heat, you'll be in heaven. And the best part? They won't break the bank. The prices here are ridiculously low for the quality and flavor you get.

But it's not just the food that makes this place special. The people here are super friendly and welcoming, always ready to share a smile or have a chat. It's the kind of place where you feel like a regular, even if it's your first time. I ended up eating here multiple times during my stay in Kathmandu (who can resist those momos?), and every visit felt like a mini celebration of food, flavor, and hospitality.

So, if you're craving something flavorful, spicy, and affordable, Yangling is the place to be. Just remember: don't underestimate the chili--but hey, if you can handle the heat, you'll be rewarded with one of the best food experiences in Kathmandu.

One of the practical aspects of dining here is the availability of underground paid parking. For added convenience, guests can request a discount on parking fees by speaking in the reception.

Russian Borscht? Menu da correggere

There is no such thing as Russian borscht--there is only Ukrainian borscht. On July 1, 2022, UNESCO officially added the "Culture of Ukrainian Borscht-Making" to the List of Intangible Cultural Heritage in Need of Urgent Safeguarding.
There is no such dish as "russian borscht".  Borscht is only Ukrainian.  The taste of the dish does not resemble real borscht.

-ce indiyska strava!

Za te,shcho ne hochete viznavati,shcho borshch -ce ukrayinska nacionalna strava i pravilno pisati Ukrainian Borshch,smak v nogo nikudishniy,-stavlyu odnu zirku.
Naymit ukrayinku,nehay vas navchit variti spravzhniy UKRAYiNSKIY borshch ;)
rosiya- krayina-okupant ta vbivcya!

Borshch is a UKRAINIAN national dish!
It's the same as saying that "Dal" is an Indian dish!
Your manager was informed that this is written incorrectly, but you didn't change this name in your menu!
Due to the fact that you don't want to acknowledge that borshch is a Ukrainian national dish and that it should be correctly written as Ukrainian Borshch, and that it tastes awful, I'm giving it one star.
Hire a Ukrainian woman, let her teach you how to cook real UKRAINIAN borshch ;)
russia is an occupier and murderer country!

We went for my birthday dinner to Chimney last year. The vibe is just so immaculate there! and the food obviously was so yum that I've still not gotten over it! The staff there gave us a complimentary brownie and sang me birthday song. It's abt to be a year and i was thinking abt how special they made it last year. Thanks to the team <3

Finally, a meal worthy of more than 4 stars in Kathmandu. I have been to so many restaurants in Thamel with a 4.0 or better Google rating, but none of them deserve it. The Chimney deserves it. Lovely hotel, restaurant, food and service. Thank you! You get what you pay for, as they say

We vivisted as a big group and ordered many dishes and everytbing was good quality and we had Xabi as our waiter who was friendly and nice

During my visit to The Chimney Restaurant, nestled within the historic Lal Durbar palace at Hotel Yak & Yeti, I was thoroughly impressed by the blend of traditional and contemporary ambiance. The setting, adorned with a sixty-year-old copper chimney, creates a unique and charming atmosphere that complements the exquisite dining experience.

The food was amazing, with each dish showcasing a perfect balance of Asian and Western influences, leaving a lasting impression on my palate.

The service was impeccable, with Saurab, Abiral, Rabi, and Dipesh ensuring that every detail was attended to with care. Their warm hospitality made the evening all the more enjoyable.

The highlight of the meal was undoubtedly the Baked Alaska, which was nothing short of fantastic--perfectly executed and a delight to the senses. Overall, The Chimney Restaurant is a must-visit for anyone seeking a memorable fine-dining experience in Kathmandu.

This restaurant offers a truly exceptional dining experience. The food is top-notch, the service is impeccable (shoutout to Kamal, Sonika, Ashim, and Srijana!), and the atmosphere is simply wonderful. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable meal in Kathmandu!

One of the best fine dine experience in the country. Mr.Abiral Thapa was exceptional with the drinks preparation and allowed us with the best drinks experience. Also the continental delicacies were absolutely perfect from Mr.Rabindra, the cuisines were the best of the kind. Mr.Saurab provided us with the best service. Also Mr.Lhakpa helped us with the menu, and food selection. We have been in a few of the restaurant in Nepal and abroad but the hospitality from the YNY and the Chimney team is truly one of a Kind. I would recommend anyperson of the world to chose YNK team for the best hospitality experience in Nepal.

Very beautiful restaurant serving very tasty and beautiful dishes. The chef rajendra prepared the plates wonderfully and mahesh is a very pleasant waiter. If I had one more day in Kathmandu, I would return here without a doubt.

Really loved this fine dining experience. The menu was so good we had great difficulty deciding what to order. All dishes and drinks were exquisite!
Service by Rabi was also excellent!

The Chimney Restaurant
Chimney Restaurant:
It's expensive, the portions are fashionably small, and the food isn't the best I've ever had. HOWEVER, I still give it 5 Stars  for the gorgeous setting, the wonderful service, the overall luxurious experience. (And there's a gorgeous ballroom-style room right next to the restaurant.)

As you walk through the entrance you're greeted and guided to your table at the Chimney Restaurant. At the heart of the Chimney Restaurant is a hardworking, skilled and passionate team of chefs catering for not only the restaurant, but the whole of the complex and historical features. Rajiv has done an exceptional job of maintaining standards throughout the whole of his team alongside Sanil and Dioendra, as well as others. They clearly know what they're doing, the food was outstanding and the service team carried the passion through to the table. We had the pleasure of Saurab as our waiter as well as the help of Joseff. We experienced of multiple local Nepali dishes, vegetarian dishes and beautiful wine. Portion sizes are generous. We left very happy feeling like we walked away with an experience and intised to come again, not only for food but for a stay also.
You can also see that all the staff here enjoy providing a high end service which makes for the experience.

Thank you very much to the Chimney chef team - Shane and Freya, see you soon.
Though the food was nice but it has VERY bad service and restaurant make shady deals with local tour guide . Not recommended for large group!

Delicious food in rustic and authentic surroundings. The gentle crackling of the fire and comforting smell of smoke makes for a serene and beautiful setting for dining. The food is remarkably good, with care put into every dish. I had the prawn tempura and catfish main, both of which were surprisingly tasty despite Nepal not being known for seafood. Service is attentive yet able to give you your space at the same time.

Great portions, considering it's fine dining,
Loved the atmosphere, the Staff and the Service
Amazing place, great food and superb staff

The Chimney Restaurant is one of the oldest and most popular restaurants in Kathmandu, Nepal. It was founded in 1968 by Boris Lissanevitch, a Russian emigre who wanted to introduce Nepal to the world of fine dining. The restaurant is located in the heart of Kathmandu, in a historic building that was once part of the royal palace.

We started our dining experience with Amuse-bouche, Focaccia bread with olive and salsa dips. Super!

Items we had,
- Russian Borscht 800NPR
- Asian Tomato Salad 600NPR
- Arugula Feta Salad 700NPR
- Tom Yum Soup
- Prawn Tempura w/ Ponzu dumpling sauce 1300NPR
- Chili Caramel Salmon 2500NPR
- Lamb Chops 4500NPR
- Baked Alaska Sagarmatha 700NPR

We had a wonderful dining experience here, perfect for celebrating special occasions. Starting with the salads, both of them were fresh and our favourite pick would be the arugula feta salad, it was a little sweet and refreshing. We loved the Russian borscht made of veggies. The lamb chops and the grilled salmon were the stars of the show! Worth a visit here! The prawn was crispy and perfectly flavoured. A trio of frozen ice cream wrapped in meringue made the baked Alaska delicious! Also, the serving with fire was something unique for us!

The service here is top-notch. They are always happy to make recommendations and help you choose the perfect meal.

The atmosphere at The Chimney Restaurant is elegant and inviting. The restaurant is decorated with traditional Nepali furniture and artwork. The dining room is spacious and well-lit, and there is a large outdoor patio where you can enjoy your meal on a warm evening.
