We were looking for some authentic Nepali fare after a day of walking around Kathmandu Durbar. This place is one of the first few recommendations that came up on Google.
1. The restaurant was dead empty when we arrived and stayed that way throughout our
meal.
2. They only had set menus available. So it doesn't cater to a person like me who has a small appetite.
3. We ordered for a Non-veg set menu and everything on it was dry. The meat was also chewy. You'll see it in the pictures how my partner literally left so much meat on his plate 'cause it was so unappetizing.
4. We requested their staff for some curry/sauce to go with the meat as an exception but it was denied.
5. The food overall was really average for its price.
6. The dance performances were nice and it was comfortable to have heaters in the dining area.
The servers were really courteous and polite. Overall, we didn't really enjoy our experience much and would not recommend the place to anyone.

We hardly ever bad review anyone but 10% service charge is optional and not mandatory in Nepal, so this experience must be shared.

Would have given all 5 stars if not for the experience we had tonight.

We have visited Kathmandu numerous times and Third Eye Restaurant has always been our favorite place to eat.  In fact, this is our second time dining here this week, and we had a great meal with great service, that is, until the bill came.

When the server presented the bill that totaled at 8500 NPR, (food and drinks 7500 NPR plus 13% VAT), he "politely" said that even though the bill showed 8500 rupees, it should actually be 9000 something, as the 10% service charge was not on the bill.  He even got the nerve to show us a copy of the photo menu which has a small line written on the bottom about 10% service charge being mandatory.

When we told him that we have never been asked for a mandatory service charge in any of our visits to Third Eye Restaurant, nor the Roadhouse just across the street, nor any restaurants here in Nepal, and that we have eaten here just a few days ago and has added over 10% tips without being asked, he quickly backed off and said he was sorry and the service charge has been removed.

We have always believed that servers who did a good job should be rewarded, but trying to scam unwary customers by trying to add a so-called mandatory service charge is totally unacceptable and a disgrace to such a great restaurant.

It takes years to build a reputation but dishonesty ruined everything.

Tried Third Eye Restaurant and had a great experience. The chicken biryani was flavorful and well-cooked. Also tried roti and curry--both were equally good. Service was nice and courteous. Would recommend.

Review: Excellent Service Experience

I recently had the pleasure of experiencing outstanding service, and I couldn't be more satisfied. From the moment I arrived, the staff was warm, welcoming, and highly professional. They went above and beyond to ensure all my needs were met promptly and with a smile.

What stood out most was their attention to detail and willingness to assist with any request, no matter how small. It's rare to find such genuine hospitality these days, and it truly made my visit memorable.

Formal Complaint Regarding Catering Services of rox bar garden

am writing to express my deep disappointment regarding the catering services provided at my relative sister's recent wedding, where I was invited, in role of ( DJ ) for the event.  I unfortunately experienced a significant lack of consideration in terms of servicing meals or snacks to dj . I could see intentionally ignoring to service food for dj (me) whole event.

As you are aware, being a DJ requires continuous focus to entertain , stay in same place till program end and energy to ensure the success of the celebration. However, throughout the duration of the wedding, I was not provided with any meals or refreshments. Despite my best efforts to maintain my energy levels, the absence of sustenance greatly impacted my ability to perform optimally.

I completed my duty around 9pm because thats the time hotel staff had informed me to end it. After that I approached the kitchen area /dinner place where food is, in hopes of finally being able to enjoy a meal. To my dismay, right infront door, manager guy i guess, said that there is no food available . (Also with no alternative solutions presented ..)   i left embarrassed and went back garden to pack my stuff .   At-least should have informed food is about to close before it closing time. so that nobody left out empty stomach in wedding.

20min later - same manager guy came and said - ( khana  ubreko cha khaney vaye khanu vannalai  aako ) the way in such word .. Only if (ubreko vayera) , he came to tell me while was still packing my setup. I said i am sorry vayo hos vaney.

This experience was not only disheartening but DISREGARDED and UNDERVALUED.

I understand that organising food  services wedding is a complex task, and oversights can occur.     However, the lack of provision for essential sustenance during such an event, is unacceptable.  I believe to prioritise the well-being of all individuals involved in event.

I kindly request that you address this matter serious and take necessary steps to ensure that similar incidents are avoided in the future. Providing meals for all  including DJs, should be a fundamental aspect of event planning.

if there's rule of hotel to not provide food to dj then kindly informed dj while entertaining event, so that we will be prepared to not to starve in event and this thing would never happen .

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your prompt response and resolution.
and apology for long message.

Sincerely,
[DJ. Joslyn rai]

I went there twice and the chef ( Abhishek) made sure he served us the best veggie pizza- primavera! Last time I also had white sauce pasta and asparagus soup, which to my surprise was amazing. We went there for a birthday celebration with my family. We had an amazing time. Due to the COVID hotel itself was not fully opened and many renovation works were going on but you could still enjoy the architectural masterpiece located within the huge area. The restaurant itself was what you would expect from a 5-star hotel. Staffs were friendly and professional, food was delicious, a huge selection of beverages, and a beautiful environment to enjoy your dinner. You could see that the management took the sanitation pretty seriously to keep it safe and hygienic. I loved how you could see the chefs preparing food in the open kitchen. Moreover, the management team surprised us with a complimentary birthday cake, really appreciate that. We got lucky as well to get a 20% discount which was ongoing for a month on the occasion of the hotel's 20th anniversary.

I would recommend this place for anyone who is looking for a quick gateway to spend quality time with friends and family.
One of the best truly 7 star city resort hotel not only in Nepal but well qualified to be so in south Asia as well.

A great experience. I recommend if you are looking for a tasting menu experience in Kathmandu. It's nothing but an experience from the initial hand washing and taking your shoes off when you arrive. To the table and apron they put on you. We did the 6 course meal and it was perfect. Lovely time and I would go back again.
Beautiful setting, excellent service. The 6 - 22 course options are a great idea. I did 9 and was stuffed.  It's priced for tourists but worth it

A lovely place and certainly not to be missed if you want an authentic Nepali culinary experience. We ordered a 6-course meal and it was sumptuous, filling and exotic. Our hostess, Yuma, would explain every course to us and her team of servers served us with love and care. We were a noisy group of 11 with lots of curiosity and questions. We all came out amazed at the entire experience.

We had dinner here in a group of 11 from different part of world.
Me coming from hospitality industry,  cannot believe that a restaurant can give such a quality and service in today's time.
Team of 3 girls serving us were amazing. We were there today 16th of July at 730pm.
The restaurant is located inside Hotel Dwarika.

We had an amazing time at this Nepalese restaurant and wanted to thank the entire team for such a memorable evening. It was our first time trying authentic Nepalese cuisine, and we were absolutely blown away by the flavors and variety of the 6 dishes. Every bite was a discovery -- rich in spices, perfectly balanced, and full of heart.
The staff was warm and welcoming, happy to explain the dishes and share a bit about Nepalese food culture. The ambiance added to the experience, with a cozy atmosphere that made us feel like we were on a journey far from home.
Thank you for introducing us to such a beautiful and delicious part of your country.
Really good service with delightful servers. We had the 12 course meal which was way too much. Highly recommend this place for the best of Nepalese cuisine.
It is a culinary journey of Nepal. A dinner you won't forget.

The restaurant and environment are incredible.
We had a 6 course meal. The experience was amazing, from the service to the food quality. They always explained the dishes and always cared if anything else was necessary.
I highly recommend as an elevated Nepalese traditional experience.
Excellent Nepali Restaurant, typical local dishes and wonderful service. Expensive
Unique dining experience in Kathmandu. Loved the 6 course menu .

The environment and atmosphere are what stand out here. Very well decorated, comfortable seats, wide tables and spacious. The portion sizes are big, unless you're a very big eater, stick to the smaller number of courses.

The food was just okay, certainly not worth the price we paid. It was well presented but the taste didn't match. We had 200 npr momo better than here.

The service from staff is not consistent, we had just one that was good, a lot of them did not provide a description of the food and we had to keep asking for water.

It was my first time visiting Nepal and a friend recommended this place. It's a good place to try different Nepali dishes, although pricey. Wonderful ambiance and good service. I had a great experience dining here.

Cadre incroyable et la nourriture est bonne mais tres cher pour ce que c'est. Et c'est beaucoup trop! Finir le menu devient un supplice.

Stepping into Krishnarpan Restaurant feels like being transported to the heart of Nepal. The staff's warm welcome and the inviting atmosphere immediately sets the tone for an evening of cultural immersion.

The multi-course menu offers a variety of traditional Nepali dishes.  Each course is presented with care, showcasing the culinary diversity of Nepal.

However, while the food is diverse and well-explained, the taste is somewhat average. Some dishes shine, but others may not leave a lasting impression.

One notable downside is the price. The multi-course menu is quite expensive, which may not feel entirely justified given the average taste of the food.

A must visit place in Nepal. Located in Dwarika's hotel, which itself is built in traditional nepalese architecture. Beautiful ambiance, excellent service with Traditionally made & served authentic nepalese cuisine, in a form of 6 course nepalese style fine dining experience. A value for money, and lifetime experience to carry from Nepal.

Wow. Just wow. It's an amazing restaurant for tourists or anyone in general, but it's not about the food mostly (even though it's amazing) it's about the sense of adventure while waiting for each course. 11/10!!!

The place itself is good, but really too expensive for the offer. What you get is a good experience but it's definitely not worth the expense (we paid 95$ per person for 9 dishes each and two glasses of wine). You can eat having the same quality for one tenth of the price in many other restaurants in Kathmandu. It really seems like something thought for tourists.

Royalty treatment, would recommend it to anyone who'd like to experience it.

The cumulative amount of food you'll eat is a lot, I would advise to temper your hunger and not say yes to every refilling of food during the courses.

Very good food. It is a busy place and seems like the staff were working very hard just to take the orders and delivering orders. Felt a bit rushed and understaffed service wise.

Shoes off restaurant. Reserve a proper sit down table in advance if you are unable to sit low. Those get filled up quickly.

We weren't offered a choice of menu, only choice was a 6 course veg or non veg dinner.  If you count every item, there are 20 including tea/coffee. At the beginning of the meal, dinners are to leave something on the small plate as offering to god. Complimentary a very strong local alcohol was offered as well.
Love the hospitality with athentic nepali cuisine

Good dishes and impeccable service in a beautiful atmosphere. But the price is about 3/4 times what it would be in another restaurant. For this difference of price we would expect also really amazing dishes and it was not the case. So the bill gives a bitter taste in the end.

Wow, this is one of the best places to do a comprehensive tasting of Newari Nepali cuisine. You can opt for 6 courses up to 20 courses (I got the 16). However, it IS a LOT of food and it's basically impossible to finish the meal unless you can eat a lot. The food itself is an incredible display of all the different types of food that is served in Nepal, served in a beautiful traditional setting that's both serene/calming and stunning/decorative. Service is incredibly upscale, polite, and smart. Cost for the tasting can range from $69 (6 course) to $115 (16 course) and up per person.

Roadhouse in Jhamsikhel has been a favorite of mine since childhood, and it holds a special place in my heart. The cozy ambiance, amazing food, and welcoming vibe make it a timeless spot. Their pizzas are especially delicious, and the menu offers great variety. Whether it's for a casual meal or a special gathering, Roadhouse always delivers. Highly recommend for anyone looking for good food and a nostalgic, comforting experience!
One of the best pizza in town

Roadhouse Cafe is a top-notch dining spot known for its exceptional ambience and delicious menu. The indoor seating is beautifully designed, offering a cozy and inviting atmosphere that's perfect for any occasion. Whether you're catching up with friends or enjoying a family meal, the setting enhances the overall dining experience.

The highlight of the menu is undoubtedly their pizzas, which are baked to perfection in a traditional oven. With a variety of options to choose from, the pizzas here are a must-try for any visitor. The crispy crust, fresh toppings, and authentic flavors make them truly stand out.

In addition to pizzas, the cafe offers an array of dishes inspired by Italian, Mexican, and Mediterranean cuisines. Some highly recommended options include spaghetti, carbonara, wraps, nachos, tacos, and even momos, making the menu diverse enough to suit all tastes. For beverages, they provide a range of coffee options and fresh juices, ensuring something for everyone.

Payments are hassle-free as they accept QR, Fonepay, cards, and cash. While the parking is paid and located in front of the restaurant, it is convenient and easily accessible. Roadhouse Cafe is an excellent choice for anyone looking to enjoy flavorful dishes in a delightful setting.
Really tasty food and experience

Extremely disappointing service at Sekuwa by Kilo, Jhamsikhel.
We were greeted with a dirty table, had to clean it ourselves, and waited 5 minutes before anyone took our order. Staff refused takeaway from the lunch menu despite serving it to others minutes earlier. Water was served without glasses, no cutlery was provided, and even after repeated requests, no one cared.

My buff momo arrived after 30 minutes, but my wife's chicken momo never came--staff didn't even know what was served or pending. The manager vanished, and instead of a proper bill, we were given an amount on a calculator.

Food might matter, but hospitality matters more--and here, it's completely missing.

Still, the spacious seating, comfy couches, polite staff, and chilled ambience make it worth a visit.

I have been visiting Bagaicha since its opening in 2023 and always recommended it to family and friends for reunions. In the beginning, the cocktails were excellent, food was good, and service was acceptable for a new establishment. Unfortunately, my most recent visit was disappointing enough to make me reconsider ever going back.

We went on a Friday evening to celebrate my daughter's 2nd birthday and my in-laws' last night in Kathmandu. We had a reservation for seven adults and a child. On arrival, we were greeted warmly and given welcome drinks. Soon after, however, mistakes began piling up. Instead of a margarita cocktail, we were served a margarita pizza. The server encouraged us to keep it, and since my daughter likes pizza, we reluctantly agreed. Later, one of our appetizer orders (saphale) never arrived despite waiting for over an hour.

Our main courses were also poorly managed. The burger was served first, while the Nepali thali and tenderloin steak were delayed the longest. The steak was explained as being frozen, which should have been communicated before we ordered. When it finally came, it was overcooked and not what we had requested.

I raised these concerns with the manager, who was respectful, apologized, and agreed that we would not be charged for the pizza or missing appetizer. Unfortunately, when the bill came, our server argued in front of our guests that we had to pay for the pizza because it was consumed, directly contradicting the manager. The tone was confrontational and unprofessional, and the situation became embarrassing. A colleague eventually had to step in and apologize.

While many staff members were polite, this one interaction overshadowed the entire evening. What should have been a special family celebration turned into a frustrating experience.

Bagaicha once held great promise, but inconsistent service and poor management have eroded that. Sadly, after being a loyal customer since its opening, I will not be recommending or returning in the future

Absolutely Delightful - A Must-Visit in Kathmandu

I cannot believe I had my bestest time at Le Sherpa--what an extraordinary place tucked away in the middle of bustling Kathmandu. From the moment I walked in, the ambience captured my heart. The setting is serene and beautifully designed, with warm lights, tasteful decor, and a courtyard that brings a touch of nature to the dining experience. It's perfect for a calm, fine-dining evening.

Now let's talk about the food--absolutely divine! I had a tofu-based dish (I wish I could remember the name!) and a refreshing salad, and both were simply unforgettable. The tofu was delicate yet flavorful, paired with thoughtful sides that complemented the texture and spices. The salad was fresh, vibrant, and artfully plated, making each bite feel like a celebration of natural flavors. Every dish felt intentional and beautifully balanced.

The service was top-tier. The staff were polite, attentive, and genuinely kind--always ready to guide without being overbearing. Their attention to detail and warm approach made me feel relaxed and well cared for throughout the evening.

Le Sherpa is not just a restaurant--it's an experience. The calm, the quality, and the aesthetic appeal all come together to create something truly special.

Oopss!! Still can't get over how good everything was! This place is a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy fine dining in Kathmandu. I'll absolutely be coming back.

Service from Sugam was marvellous he is such a gentleman,professional and fun.
Looks great but pricy
The BEST dinner in Nepal! From start to finish the whole evening was exceptional, the food was fresh and full of flavour and the atmosphere was perfect. Thankyou so much for a beautiful evening!

My friends and I enjoyed a 5-course Christmas dinner here. The food was delicious and presented beautifully. Our waiter, Prajwal, was attentive and hard working. We will definitely return for more dining experiences in this gem of a restaurant.
Really good service and the ambience was the best.

Nous venons de sortir du dejeuner de Noel. C'etait delicieux, l'equipe est adorable et le service parfait. Merci beaucoup pour tout. Nous recommandons cet endroit vivement pour y passer un moment unique.
Great company, great atmosphere! Highly recommend for nice food and drinks

It's a nice modern restaurant. We had a group dinner here. I had the tofu with brown rice and a sauce. It tasted okay. It was very nice to get brown rice which seems to be rarely served in Nepal.
The salad was very good and the chocolate brownie was, too.
The food was mediocre and quite expensive  but the vibe over there is always good on a. Saturday morning

Na ja, auf nobel gemacht, aber man verlasst den Tempel hungrig fur viel Geld. Sehr steif alles, Essen schmecht ganz gut, aber eben wenig, Nachschlag gibt es nicht. Sehr sauber alles, aber noch nie so ein schlechten Kaffee getrunken, dunkles Wasser. Selbst die Krauterbutter schmeckt nach nix. Zudem habe ich das teuerste Bier in ganz Nepal hier getrunken, eine Flasche Gorkha fur sage und schreibe 7 Eur.  Das Ambiente selbst ist aber ganz nett.  Aus unserer Sicht aber eine Fehlentscheidung.
Saturday Market  visit was good
Excellent food and service
Good food `aahaar`r`ysd sa`aad brryaakaasdii

It was an amazing fine dining experience.
Starters to all course and all listed cuisine were finest.

I personally loved Mushroom Raviloi  which is also chef's recommendations.

Do try Sherpa Soup

Servers were all nice.

Entrance to the cafe and location is quite confusing. Do call and ask for directions.
Farmers market and an excellent cafe

Great spot for a comfortable, quality, and modern dining experience in Kathmandu. The beautiful porch dining space was breezy and enjoyed a nice view of a small garden courtyard. Staff were professional and timely. Food was pretty good too, though the ambiance and service were the real gems here. Surprisingly quiet with being in the heart of town. Having a few shopping spots in the same area was also a nice bonus. I recommend this place for a brunch with the wife or even the family as the kids can run around in the garden area. Enjoy!

The restaurant tries to serve fancy western kitchen but does not provide. The dishes look good and are well presented but lack taste. The lamb was announced to be braised but simply was raw. The creme brulee was not brulee at all. Again nicely presented but without taste.
Maybe try to cultivate Nepalese kitchen that is so rich instead of trying to make weak copies of western cuisine.
Trendiges cool eingerichtetes Lokal mit asiatischer Fusionkuche. Das Lokal befindet sich einem kleinen Hof mit Geschaften lokaler Kunstler und Boutiquen. Ein Highlight.
Great food and very welcoming service. I like the nature vibes
A cool hangout spot with tasty bites and a chill vibe, perfect for a group to unwind and dine.

The best food experience i've had in a while, literally wiped the plate of ravioli clean. Amazing food. Servers were the best,  efficient and attentive.
The only thing that bothered me was the sheer number of mosquitoes, i wish they could do something about it though, otherwise a perfect place.
Pricey, however.
Wonderful food and beautiful place
Overrated place
Loved the ambience, menu, and the service

Farmers market was a fresh concept, really enjoyed a variety of foods in one place.
A bit pricey though worth it.

It was hard to find the entrance of the restaurant, finally I found it, it was through the museum an Airbnb at Panipokhari.  The ambience of the restaurant looked attractive but was like sitting on a terrace. Staffs were professional, polite & attentive. Mixed mushroom with poached egg on top was delicious.  Pan seared trout fillets which came with mashed potatoes & vegs was really looked impressive  though a bit expensive but tasted excellent.  Really a great place for fine dining in Kathmandu.

such a great ambience!
tranquil!

We had spinach agnolotti and pesto farfalle. I kinda liked them - they're slightly too oily but quite interesting combination of ingredients. Portion was big, we didn't finish it and brought leftovers with us to eat while traveling around town.

Atmosphere is wonderful and the warm drinks are nice.

Don't even know what's the inside like, had to stay in the car so it didn't get locked.

Stupid question ik, everyone that comes here can afford a driver/ pathao /a family or friend that will wait outside.
Best cheese in the town! Nice vibes.

Eine Oase der Ruhe inmitten des chaotischen Stadtlebens draussen. Ausgezeichneter Service. 
Leider war das Hauptgericht, nicht das was es versprochen hatte, das Fleisch, Braised Beef, war zah, obwohl medium bestellt, und richtig warm es auch nicht, genau wie die Beilagen. Das einzige was richtig heiss war, war die Suppe, der Nachtisch hat es wieder herausgerissen  wir hatten es besser in Erinnerung, wo wir vor Jahren schon Mal da waren. Diesmal Le Sherpa war das leider nichts.
Excellent food and service. Very good value for fine dining. Best spot in Kathmandu!
Perfect for a Saturday brunch
Went to try breakfast and I was really disappointed!!! Regretted going there and won't prolly go back

32 Marriage Anniversary so we went to Le Sherpa in a cold 26 January night... devoid of any souls because of Omicron the whole place was for us. Luckily all heaters we switched on kindly and after we opened a bottle of wine we were warm and happy. The soups were amazing, prawn starters good too. The Australian lamb was delicious and the array of veggies were generous too. Loved the Mustang organic potatoes but did not like the carrots which were big and not organic at all. Le Sherpa runs the Farmers Market every Saturday so please do give organic veggies & hike the price reasonably. Loved everything but the shaky table
"Le Sherpa Restaurant exceeded my expectations with its delightful ambiance, impeccable service, and a menu that showcases a perfect blend of flavors. A must-visit for a memorable dining experience!"
Good food and budget friendly compared to some other places in the area. Drinks were good too

chicken station has been revamped with new cabinets, rooms, and a big space. While the service was still fast, I must say that the food served wasn't as good as it used to be. I tried their platter and found that the portion size wasn't worth the price and the food was just average. Even their famous animal fries, which used to be my favorite, have been degraded in taste. Very nice place, comfy and cool. The food is very good and tasty. You can choose among different dishes. I've tried paneer, mutton, eggs and vegetables and it was all super.
You can also choose if you want a small or big size, nice

Fantastic food and drinks, stellar dining experience overall. The staff are also very helpful, and the ladyboss is around to oversee things.

They have a pretty good spread of local cuisine. I love their non-veg options, particularly their mutton dishes. Their Chicken Momo (Jhol) is amazing. Their veg options are also great.

They have both indoor and outdoor seating arrangements, so you can choose your ambience. Overall, a good place for a meal and chill.

One of the best places to have Thakali Thali around Thamel. Tried out the thali from some places around and this definitely stood out! The taste, portion size and service amazing and the staff make sure that you are having a great experience!
Exzellent service of Dhiraj. Tanks a lot!! We like to come back!

Yesterday went with family to have lunch. The service was fantastic and the food was very tasty. We had chicken and mutton thakali which was awesome.The hotel staff explained us about the food and we're very very attentive. The owner was also around with a beautiful smile. The place gives a party or festival vibe and the food adds up to have a great quality time experience. Will definitely visit again.
The thakali was the best i have ever had. Staff were really professional and friendly. The owner was also really nice. She assisted us really well. Will be coming back again.
superb

Its and amazing. Taste of food, typical local taste. Thanks for serving us.

This was our best meal so far in Kathmandu! The dishes (fully vegetarian) were beyond eccellent, the ambience tasteful and clean and the service extremely courteous. A special thanks to our host Dhiraj who took wonderful care of us. Totally recommended!!

Very bad service thank you

I had an amazing dining experience at Kho Hang Restaurant! The ambiance is cozy yet vibrant, the food is flavorful and authentic, and the service is top-notch. Every dish we tried was delicious -- from the juicy momos to the perfectly spiced thukpa, everything tasted fresh and well-prepared.

What truly made our visit special was the exceptional service. A big shoutout to Dhiraj and Rohit, who went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. They were attentive, friendly, and had great knowledge of the menu. Their warm hospitality added a personal touch that made the meal even more enjoyable.

Highly recommend Kho Hang for anyone looking for a great place to enjoy Nepali cuisine with excellent service. I'll definitely be coming back!
Warm hospitality and yummy food ..
We tried the cultural experience and the traditional thali. Everything was nice and flavorful. I commend mostly the excellent service of Dhiraj and Rohit. Thank you team!
Good ambition and good food
lugar muy rico con comida nepali de muy buena calidad, el staff muy profesional y amigable, fue un placer pasar por aca en mi estadia por katmandu
Great food! Great service by Dhiraj!

The ambience felt very comfortable with the best Thakali set i had ever in my life. The mutton bhutan was top notch. Also the customer service is so attractive specially by the staff Dhiraj Basnet. Will surely visit again.

Posetili vashe zavedenie, v celom ostalis dovolny -- eda vkusnaya, horosho poel, obstanovka priyatnaya. No hochu ostavit obratnuyu svyaz po servisu.

Za vremya prebyvaniya k nam podhodili prakticheski vse oficianty po ocheredi, s intervalom bukvalno v minutu, sprashivali, vsyo li nravitsya. Odin i tot zhe vopros zvuchal slishkom chasto. Bylo oshchushchenie, chto za nami postoyanno nablyudayut, chtoby podbezhat po pervomu dvizheniyu.

Ponimayu, chto zhelanie proyavit zabotu -- eto plyus. No v kakoy-to moment takoe vnimanie nachinaet meshat -- my prosto ne mogli spokoyno poest, potomu chto kazhdye paru minut nas perebivali voprosami ili izvineniyami, dazhe kogda prosto prinosili blyuda.

V kakoy-to moment podoshla zhenshchina (vozmozhno, administrator ili hozyayka) -- i snova s tem zhe voprosom. Potom eshchyo neskolko raz utochnyali, ne dobavit li ovoshchey.

Pozhaluysta, nemnogo menshe navyazchivosti -- eto uluchshit vpechatlenie. Uveren, chto bolshinstvo gostey budut blagodarny za vozmozhnost prosto nasladitsya edoy bez postoyannyh preryvaniy.
Comida tradicional muy sabrosa, servicio muy atento y amable (especialmente Nabin), y terraza muy agradable

Really liked the snacks and the cultural dance which takes place every evening.
Thanks to the staff Nabin for giving us good service as well.
Nabin ,shishir , dhiraj and kuber were very  kind and generous with their work and food was very good as well .
One of the best thakali in Kathmandu
It was our first time visiting, and the experience was great! Delicious food and a welcoming atmosphere -- we'll definitely be back.
Sishir is doing better service, appreciate it.
The food is awesome and the service is excellent. Naveen was wonderful and offered great service.

It was absolutely delicious, the buff oil on the rice, gave to the Dal Bath the perfect touch.  Thanks Dhiraj who was really helpfull about how the Thali works, and offering allways the extras of the Thali. I was really happy to chose this place, for sure will come back again.
Thank you for hosting us ! Everything was super amazing . Hoping to visit soon
Best thakali restaurant with the best dal bhat in town. I've been here for more than 6 times since I'm in Nepal. I got addicted to paneer

I had ordered one Chicken Thakali set and Aalu Jimbu Sukuti from Pathao where I had clearly written an instruction to add extra rice and chicke gravy but at last, I received without any extras and even the original portion was not full enough. The portion of every item was literrally as same one when we sit in their place n use to get served at first glance. Aalu Jimbu Sukuti was pathetic in taste. They charge so enough as much as of other popular Thakali places but their service was hilarious. So dissapointing. Never gonna order again from here and  recommend to others as well. Such a great experience Khohang Thakali has provided to its very new customer who could be the regular one in future.
great food, great employees and space
Food is simply awesome from all perspective...

Absolutely loved my experience at Khohang Taste of Thakali! The food was authentic and bursting with flavor, and the service was top-notch. A big shoutout to Dhiraj for being so warm, attentive, and helpful throughout the meal. Highly recommend for anyone craving delicious Nepali cuisine!
Laziz xaw
Really good thakali food.

This restaurant is a must visit whilst in Kathmandu.
The staff provide incredible service throughout, very attentive and accommodating. Our waiter (Kuber) was so friendly and polite, made the best experience even better.

Me and my partner both had the veg Thakali, they had rice, I had dhindo. The food was the best we have had travelling in Nepal and India. Dhal bat power!!! Dherai mitho.

For drinks we had the bottle of Nepali red wine (pataleban), and iced tea which both were great.

Highly recommend.

If you're looking for a delicious, authentic Dal Bhat in a cozy and quiet setting with excellent service, Kohang - Taste of Thakali is the place to go.

From the moment you arrive, you'll be welcomed with open arms. The staff are incredibly friendly and attentive, especially waiter Nabin, who made our visit extra special with his warm smile and fast, professional service.

The food is served quickly, full of flavor, and prepared with care. If Dal Bhat is what you're craving, don't think twice! Go to Kohang. You definitely won't regret it!

Had an amazing meal at Khohang Taste of Thakali in Kathmandu! The dal bhat was comforting and packed with flavor, and the buckwheat pancakes were a surprise hit -- soft, earthy, and delicious. The mutton curry was rich and perfectly spiced. The staff were warm and generous, even letting us try a few local specialties on the house. A simple, authentic experience that truly felt like home-cooked Nepali food. Thanks to Dhiraj our server for this amazing experience!
Amazing food had the best meal of the last four days . Dhiraj was an amazing host and provided excellent service which was a topping on the cake with an amazing food
A good restaurant with an amazing ambience with good food and good service from dhiraj
Good place with decent vibes. Dhiraj has been a great host.

The beat food, i could feel the taste, nutrition and prana. Ghee was abaolute delight and the service is way beyond ratings. Thank you !
Totally recommend this!

The food was great, felt like I was eating at home. Also to mention our host suman was very jolly and welcoming. Besides that I got the opportunity to meet both of the owners who turned out to be sisters. They asked us about the food and were eager for our feedback. Definitely will comeback with my family and friends.... if you have time try out their cultural program.
I have mutton leg and also chicken thakali..The test is really good and flavorful. I like mutton leg the most very tender.. will be back for sure

Khohang was recommended by our hotel as a great place to explore authentic Nepali flavors -- and it definitely offers a unique experience. The set Thakali menu is well-curated, and I really enjoyed the vegetarian thali with nettle soup and seasonal dishes. The food was nicely presented and full of traditional taste, served in beautiful brass bowls. However, portions felt a bit small, and compared to other places in Kathmandu, the price was on the higher side. Still, it's a lovely way to experience Thakali hospitality and heritage.
Fantastic restaurant, Dhiraj and Kuber are the friendliest guys youll meet with excellent customer service! The 6 course menu is the best ever, we are going to miss this lovely nepalese food!!!
This is the veg thakali i got for 600

Khohang has a very laid back vibe, amazing atmosphere to have a calm and cozy lunch.
I was looking forward to try some good Nepalese food, and this place did not disappoint. Service was excellent ! The staff here are very kind :)
Definitely would recommend !
Amazing place with great service, expect no less the food is out of this world. Definitely will recommend and come back here again.

Love everything about this place. Good food good vibes and the service is great too! Had a great experience here. Love from Malaysia
Dhiraj is competent and very professional. The owner of the place was very accommodating as well. Thali is a must try for first-timer. Mo-mo was very juicy and exploded upon biting.
Delicious Dal Bhat  craft beer and local moonshine  very nice service

Had the paneer dal bhat and it was the best dal bhat I've had. The price was super reasonable for the amount of food you get. Can pay by card! The staff is so wonderful and kind as well. A must visit in Kathmandu!

Best Nepalese dish I had in Kathmandu. Had the mix platter which is full of flavors. Enjoyed the warm service too.

We walked past this restaurant and we decided to look at the menu which was varied and well priced.
We decided to eat here and the food was fantastic with generous portions and very well presented and it didn't take long for the food to arrive.
The service from the moment we arrived until we left was impeccable and we will no doubt be back here soon.

The place was amazing. It was a cultural night and we really enjoyed the ambiance and the the foods too. The songs were also folk songs which we have heard growing up. Like: Resham Firiri, Kya Ramro Sau Bari and others too.  At last the Thakali was great too. And I also tried my first Raksi (Nepali Wine). But I didn't like it very much. Will be my first and the last.

One of the best Thakali food in Kathmandu. One of the very few place that serves sishnu ko jhol"Nettle soup". staffs and the owner are very friendly. Very attentive. I recommend this place very highly.

I had the vegetarian Thakali and it was very tasty. The cocktails were also delicious and generous. The back garden is a beautiful and quiet respite from the chaos of central Patan. Our waitress Swostika was kind and attentive.
Such a nice place to unwind, with delicious food and amazing service. Biki has been so kind and attentive. I will come back!
Very friendly and helpful. Good place to visit for a date.
Love this cafe ! Always a great experience with tasty foods specially when Biki is working .

Great ambience with great service.
Especially the guy named viki was really hospitable!!
Food and service was really good. It is a quiet place to be. Our server Bishal was friendly.
Good food and beautiful ambiance as well as cooperative staff

This place is really nice, has a great ambience and staffs are friendly and helpful. Bishal dai served us and he was really nice, helpful and friendly

The food was very good. Biki was a great server. I recommend this place.

Absolutely loved it here! Ordered the chicken burger, mushroom pasta and chicken momo, and the dishes exceeded all our expectations. Best restaurant we've eaten at in Nepal so far! Food was also very cheap, nearly half the price of other restaurants we went to and the ambience and vibe was unmatched. 10/10, would definitely recommend to everyone!
Nice ambience and good vibes in an old heritage renovated house with Garden

The ambience and atmosphere were truly impressive -- a great place to unwind and enjoy the setting. However, the food was quite disappointing. Vegetarian options were particularly underwhelming, both in variety, quality, and quantity.
Food is tasty and the price is relatively cheaper for the quality. Very peaceful and aesthetic ambience. Really a good place to hangout with friends.
Cocktails exceptional (recommend the whiskey sour), great mix of Nepali and western dishes and a beautiful garden with aesthetic architecture and lighting

I visited Patan for 2 days and it's my favourite restaurant. Food is good and wine too.

Service is not as good as the food though. One waiter was rather rude and generally, the service is slow.....so find elsewhere if you're super hungry.

I love their pasta dishes!
The atmosphere is overwhelming, loved the ambience. Service was also genuinely good. Food was also tasty enough but a bit expensive and may not be budget friendly for all. Overall a great place.

Very nice.
But they should increase their veggie options.
Anyways a good place to rest.
Un giardino nascosto tra le vie caotiche di Patan.. piatti deliziosi e ben preparati (e lo dice un'italiana) bravi!

Hospitality and ambience in this restaurant is great. The menu is a mix of continental and Nepali cuisines (bit on a expensive side) but serves its value with the taste. A great varieties of cocktails and mocktails are also worth giving a try
Super atmospheric garden between newari buildings, very friendly service by Tika and really delicious burgers! Highly recommended!
The ambience and service is really nice, but the peach iced tea was disappointing.
Really enjoyed our meal here and Tika was a lovely server.
Cafe with good ambiance in Patan with cozy seating, but the food was underwhelming. Great presentation, weak flavors, and limited options.
Great spot for a beer, in a calm and serene garden tucked away off a busy street. Came back for dinner and the veg thakali was good; portions could have been more generous but you do get refills!

Delicious food in a beautiful garden. We ate here a couple of times during our stay and everything was just right, from the friendly service to the tasty food. Our favourite was the thakali set. Yum! Sorry for no photos, but we were too busy enjoying our meal.
Ochen atmosfernoe mesto s priyatnoy energetikoy
Gatekeeping worthy.
Very nice Service by Tika. Friendly and attentive.
Il Caffe espresso e buonissimo (parola di italiana), super consigliato!

just had some drinks, definitely gonna go again to try some food

the place was so nice i could sit there the whole day, with a touch of greenery, it had so much space than we had expected, the staff were also nice.
The ambience is super good and the staffs are really humble and helpful too. I had ordered coffee and it was quite good as well
Virkelig dejlig oase med en meget charmerende have. Meget laekker mad og tak til Mandy som er den hyggeligste smilende tjener .

Outside ambiance, nothing is recommended for the restaurant.  Food does not have any salt, portion sizes are very small (one pasta is not even sufficient for kids), much higher prices compared to local places.
Wonderful place located in a heritage structure and has a garden tucked away in the back. Food was nice, service was warm and friendly.
Peaceful place, great food, very friendly staff and reasonable prices. Highly recommended.
The thing about a garden along with a cafe is very fascinating and unique in Kathmandu. Definitely visit

The ambience of the place was truly impressive, creating a wonderful atmosphere that was hard to beat. Additionally, the cleanliness was remarkable, contributing to an overall feeling of comfort. However, the highlight was unfortunately overshadowed by the food, which I found to be quite disappointing; even the Newari cuisine, which I had looked forward to, did not meet my expectations.

My penne arrabbiata was incredibly salty. The margarita pizza was flavorless. The grilled veggies and garlic spinach on the side were good, but the portion sizes were laughably small. All unforgivable at this price point. The worst meal we've had in Nepal!

vkl `l hpnym hpytsvt sbbh
l shvvh

Staff were nice. But the pasta was incredibly salty, and the spinach and vegetable sides were absolutely tiny.

The biggest disappointment though was my pizza - it had no flavour. I have no idea how the chef managed to do this, it was literally FLAVOURLESS - I have never ever experienced this before - the cheese, the tomato sauce, the base all had no taste.

If you're in the area and craving italian food, you should go to Fire & Ice. It's round the corner, it's the same price, and the taste/quality is SO MUCH BETTER!!!!!
Heel lekker gegeten. Super service!

Marco Polo Restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience with a warm ambiance and attentive service. The spuntini di polo appetizer was perfectly crispy, while the spaghetti seefood and grilled chicken souvlaki were both flavorful and beautifully presented. The volcano dessert was a delightful end to the meal. Highly recommend for anyone seeking delicious food and a welcoming atmosphere!
Delicious pizza in Kathmandu!
Great Calzone! Perfectly cooked and full of flavour

I recently ordered from Marco Polo Restaurant and had an extremely disappointing experience. I ordered the Peccato Al Fiume, and what I received was completely unacceptable. The portion size was tiny--just four slices of vegetables and a baby portion of macaroni with prawn. For the price I paid, the quantity and quality were nowhere near satisfactory.

Additionally, I ordered the Tuna Pizza, which was equally disappointing. It was completely tasteless, and to make matters worse, there was no tuna on the pizza at all. It felt like I was paying Rs. 2578 for a name rather than the actual dish.

I immediately reported this to Foodmandu, as it felt like the restaurant was blatantly overcharging and under-delivering. Marco Polo Restaurant needs to seriously improve its food quality, portion sizes, and pricing to avoid losing customers. As it stands, I won't be ordering from Marco polo restaurant again and recommened to other as well be aware this kind I'd restaurant just trying to rub the customers.
Great food. Amazing service. Highly recommend this place!!!

Europeans please do not be fooled by the reviews like I was  . This is the worst Italian restaurant in Asia I have ever been to ( the staff are lovely and the restaurant is pretty ) but the cheese ! It's an Italian restaurant and you serve me yak butter instead of feta cheese ? This was really shocking and gross because the quantity of butter was super fatty ( and I love butter but even I can't eat straight butter especially when I ordered feta and they just layer the pizza with butter instead ) . They also didn't put Parmesan in my pasta and charged me for the imported good without telling me until I questioned it because there was no cheese on my pasta instead. This  was disappointing as I came there for the cheese . I was gutted as I was so excited for cheese and believed the good reviews . I don't expect the same standards as Europe but butter instead of cheese ? And no Parmesan? You are NOT an Italian you are a  wood fire pizza with no passable cheese just rename yourself please or import the cheese and charge extra .

On my stay in Kathmandu i eat here three times. Located in the mall, the food is delicious,

The staff are very professional and prompt with your orders. I especially the two  ladies, I really appreciated the service they provided. Im back in London Uk  now but always do think of this place and the staff 

Definitely recommend.

Forget this place. Inside the calzone I found only cheese and tomato sauce.
Poor quality and higher price for nothing

If you are looking for delicious Italian food, this could it to satisfy you. Kinna hard to find this place in the mall but once you do, you are treated to an elegant dining ambience with window-view into the kitchen.

The food was lip-licking amazing, from pizza to pasta, and leaving you wanting more! The Mediterranean (chicken souvlaki) wasn't that authentic - potato was too blend instead of the traditional butter and zesty lemon taste.

The staff was very professional and prompt with your orders. I especially appreciated the sign in the toilet (see pic!).

Definitely recommend giving this place a try for delicious Italian food.

 Since the mall doesn't have a directory, it is confusing to me to locate this place. When you enter the mall, there is a stand on your right with Marcopolo sign indicating it is on 1st floor but not clear where. So follow the set of escalators in front of the stand and then turn right from the escalator once you reach 1st floor and the restaurant is at the end. If you take the other escalator that brings you to the toilet, it's the left side hallway that brings you to the restaurant (not the long hallway on the right).

 I appreciate it is cultural to speak loudly on the phone and put the conversation on speaker. I feel the staff should be more in tune with patrons who are not mindful of using indoor voice, so other patrons trying to enjoy their dining aren't annoyed by the loud phone conversation. It's just general courtesy.
Good pasta and very friendly staff. Liked the mocktails
friendly environment .I suggest to come and enjoy the time and meal
One of the best pizza that I've ever had. Haven't tried other dishes yet. The ambience was good. The server was cute, friendly and had excellent demeanor. Definitely worth a visit.
It was so good

Hem vingut aqui seguint les ressenyes i alguns blogs que parlaven de les millors pizzes de Katmandu. Hem sortit decebuts. Les pizzes mig crues, amb poca coherencia d'ingredients o fins i tot escassos. Hem provat una calzone i la pizza Marcopolo (si un restaurant te una pizza amb el seu nom sempre esta be provar-la; segur que l'han pensat amb delicadesa). Doncs res de res, la pizza mes barata del super es mes bona. Sap greu perque l'ambient es xulo i podria ser un molt bon restaurant, pero la relacio qualitat-preu no es gens bona.
My pizza was nothing special - salami looked liked sausage. If you want real pizza you can find many way better places.

I never expected they give that kind of service it was really  good  food service staff .. also environment  ..love this place

Zamowilam na obiad pizze z owocami morza - brakowalo polowy skladnikow wymienionych w menu, w tym krewetek. Na deser zamowilam lody z bita smietana i pistacjami ale dostalam same lody. Obsluga nie informuje o braku skladnikow. Dania wybrakowane ale calkiem smaczne.
Amazing food and service
Great place to eat. I had the pasta and it was delicious. I would definitely go back and you should visit also.
Nice service, tried a Nepalitana Pizza which was quite fascinating to see.. taste was only fine tho. Overall Great

Personale attento e servizievole, ambiente gradevole pero un po' scuro.

Abbiamo anche preso il dolce, niente di sopraffino ma apprezzabile lo sforzo.

Caro per la media.
Good cheese pizza. I was skeptical at first, but it was worth eating here even if the cost is higher than other places. It is located in the mall.

Their Marcopolo pizza, chicken pesto panini sandwich with its smoky flavor, and aglio e olio pasta, which was one of the best I've had, were all delightful. The spicy mango and strawberry colada mocktails were also fantastic. Looking forward to returning to explore more dishes on their menu!
Super restaurant avec de tres bonnes pizzas au feu de bois. Un peu cher mais la qualite est la. Nous y sommes retournes 4 ou 5 fois durant notre sejour.
Lekkere risotto en cheesecake!
The Bruschetta is truly one of the best I've experienced in Nepal. Food is delicious with great service. I'll be back to try the amazing pizza!

very nice pizza!

Wonderful Service And Excellent Pizza . i came with my frn And family really delicious pizza and cheese cake , i am very  enjoyed there. Once again thank you marcopolo Resturent for your personalized Service.

Just what was needed after completing a 14 day trek to Basecamp. The pizza was amazing

A dark themed Italian restaurant that serves some amazing food and drinks. The calzone here is a must try. Likewise, would recommend requesting the paradise mocktail which I truly enjoyed. Its not on the menu yet but try asking for it. Likewise, it might be a bit expensive but definitely worth the price paid.

Unfortunately we didn't enjoy the food. The pizzas were cheese-heavy, oily and with little taste (the base tomato sauce had zero flavour?!) - we were a bit confused as it looked amazing and has great reviews. We only ate half and left the rest. We've tried a few different places in KTM and it was sadly the worst (so far). Maybe we'll give it another try one day. Staff were good, the pasta was OK.

Nestled in the vibrant Thamel district of Kathmandu, Nepal, this cozy eatery is a haven of warmth and inviting ambiance. The pizza here is a crowd-pleaser with its bubbly cheese and tangy sauce. Their Melanzane alla Parmigiana is a rich, layered delight that comforts the soul. The calzone is a pocket of culinary joy, stuffed with flavorful ingredients. For dessert, the cheesecake stands out as creamy and decadent. The mutton with rice is tender and aromatic, a must-try. Paired with a selection of fine wine, this place promises a memorable gastronomic journey.
The Italian and Mediterranean restaurant inside a slow-running mall offers impressive food. A great spot if you're craving Italian and Mediterranean cuisine.
Tres tres bon spaghetti

I enjoyed the spicy BBQ chicken pizza, penne arribiata, and creme brulee. All were very amazing dishes and would eat them all again.  The service was good but not great. The gentleman who was attending to me was very new and it showed. From my observations the rest of the service was flowing smoothly and orders were being processed efficiently. The atmosphere is of a modern italian restaurant while in a mall setting.

Fantastic service, delicious food two nights on the trot after my group finished their trek. The staff were accommodating, attended us well and service was quick. For a table of 14 that's excellent.
I look forward to seeing you again.

Great Food, I had the pesto Spaghetti.
Its a bit difficult to find, on the first floor of the mall. The Service personal was very friendly and helpful. I liked the dinning area, but it was a bit dark.
We were glad to find a good wood fired pizza and glass of wine in Kathmandu! Thanks Pravat Tamang for the great service :)
Excellent Pizza & Perfect Atmosphere

A cute little restaurant tucked away in a mall. It's on the first floor and if you can't find it, you can easily ask around. The mint lemonade was fantastic, the best I've had in Nepal. The lemon soda was pretty good too. We had the mezze platter: hummus was nice and smooth, pita great, tzatziki so-so. The tabouleh was awesomely fresh and tasty. We also had the Nepalitana pizza which was pretty good, the dough had a nice flavor. The ambience was very welcoming and charming and the service was great.
Located on floor 1 in the Chhaya Center. Great oven fired pizza. Great service.
I ordered the Bolognese pasta chicken, it was  a little bit salty for me but still delicious, as the flavouring was on point. Service and ambience was great! will come back again!

Awesome food, great service

recently had the opportunity to dine at MarcoPolo restaurant in Thamel, Kathmandu, and I must say that it was a delightful experience. From the moment I entered, I was greeted with warm hospitality and a cozy ambiance that set the tone for a pleasant evening.

The restaurant's decor was tastefully done, combining traditional and contemporary elements, creating a charming and inviting atmosphere. The seating arrangements were comfortable, and the overall layout of the restaurant provided a sense of privacy while still maintaining an open feel.
good food
Best pizza: juicy and yummy

Soooo good after trekking. We ordered a pizza, sandwhich, the antipasta platter, and some chicken kabobs because we were starving after EBC. We had Rajesh as our server and he was very attentive and awesome service!

If you are looking for a cozy Italian restaurant with authentic flavors and a friendly atmosphere, look no further than "Marco Polo " in the heart of downtown.

Walking into the restaurant, you are greeted with warm, Tuscan-style decor and a welcoming vibe. The menu offers an array of classic Italian dishes, including antipasti, pasta, amazing pizza, and meat dishes, all made with fresh, high-quality ingredients.

My personal favorites include their Margherita pizza, which is thin and crispy with a perfect amount of cheese and tomato sauce, and their homemade Carbonara , which is rich and super tasty, with fresh eggs cheese and delicious bacon.

To complement the food, the wine list is extensive and reasonably priced, offering many Italian and international options. The staff is also very knowledgeable about wine pairings and happy to assist with any questions.

Overall, "Marco Polo" is a fantastic Italian restaurant that delivers delicious food and excellent service. Whether you are looking for a romantic dinner out or a casual night with friends, this restaurant is sure to please. Highly recommended.
And btw... I'm Italian so I have pretty high standards when we talk about food ;)
Pizza and mustang aaloo are very tasty. Especially pizza was tasty in ingrdients
Awesome service & food test no word for you marcopolo
Great food and vibe, great service. High quality kitchen. Fair prices.
Best restaurant in town by a long shot!
Beautiful modern interior, good food, excellent staff
Very nice place, quit European experience, I would definitively recommend.
Great Italian food in Kathmandu Nepal,  must visit there with friends and family.

Service is very poor,  I have to remind after every 10 min. Almost after 50mins I got my Buff steam momo. I don't recommend.

Momo is super delicious, while the keema noodles is good. Parking is convenient, and the ambience is decent. It's best to visit before 8 PM, as the momo and keema noodles are often sold out by then.

It's always a crowded spot, but totally worth it.The laphing there is hands down the best I've ever had. The kima noodles are also incredibly tasty. As for the momo, the size is slightly larger than usual, and while the flavor is mild possibly because they use homemade spices. It really grows on you. You might not love it at first bite, but it's one of those things that gets better every time. I've been there more than 15 times, and I just keep going back.
The restaurant serves tasty keema noodles, but thicker noodles would make them even better. The momos are delicious and definitely worth trying. Overall, a good spot for flavorful bites!

the crowd was promising, the service was nice,the interior was wonderful but unfortunately the main element-food lacked salt n spices. We ordered Laphing & momo. Personally, I felt like the cold and hot spicy noodles at the Boudha area restaurant aren't as good as they used to be. The taste seems to have changed and doesn't have the same flavor or appeal that I enjoyed before. It's a bit disappointing compared to my earlier visits.

Don't know why such hype for this place but really don't live up to the  expectations. The food was an absolute delight! Every bite was bursting with flavor, perfectly balanced spices, and fresh ingredients. From the aroma to the presentation, everything felt thoughtfully prepared. The service was warm and welcoming, making the whole experience even better.

Whether you're a foodie or just hungry, this place is worth every visit. Highly recommended!
Best momo in boudha
Amazing drinks and service by the staff especially Moe & Netra. They were diligent and made drinks meticulously.

I had such a great time at this bar! The atmosphere was lively yet welcoming, and the service was outstanding. Our bartender, Mo, really made the experience special. If you're looking for a spot with great drinks and even better service, definitely ask for Mo -- he'll take care of you!

It's one of the cocktail bar in Kathmandu. They serve various types of cocktails, it is must go place for cocktail lovers . But for me who prefer beer it's not the place to be. As they have not much choice of it . But the ambience and food are perfect. Overall a cool place to spend with the mates with various cocktails.
Had higher expectations for the cocktails. They were just good enough. Asked the bartender for a umami taste cocktail, he made me one off the menu that was VERY good
Such a pretty place and the food was soo goodd!!! Beautiful ambience and perfect service!!!

absolutely worth it.
Totally diffent vibe from Thamel street but still chillin'
Decent cocktail and servie +ambiance. Y'all should try mona's choice
Great cocktails. Innovative and passionate team!
Nice bar, good drinks, efficient price, staffs were friendly and comfortable, will come back for sure.

One of the best cocktails bar in this town
Staffs are realy friendly.
Everyone need to try customized drinks of bartenders and negroni sour
And I want to recommend to everyone please don't missed to try buff slider

At first the ambiance was too too too good and I like the plantation of that place and there was too many signatures cocktail of their bar but I like the negroni sour that was the recommendation of bartender and it was well balanced and the shrimp skewers was also good with my drinks 
Thanks for the good recommendation of drinks as well as food too

Amazing cocktail and amazing staffs! Bartender Suwarna made me a special cocktail that I'd like and it was one of the best cocktails I ever had. Deserves more people visiting and trying their special cocktail and atmosphere is great too! Will come back 100%. What a jem in Nepal bar scene!

As a Londoner, I'm so sad that my favourite cocktail bar is all the way in KTM  Every drink was a hit thanks to the staff's spot-on recommendations. Rovin dai and his team were wonderful hosts - trust them to help you find your new favourite drink!
Very nice bar, very creative cocktails. Worth the visit!!!
A friend brought me here and I can say the ambiance is really good especially if you prefer personal conversations- without a loud music. They have good cocktails!

The atmosphere  I walked into was like nowhere, the ambience, music, bar. I was approached, served and the cocktails was of absolute brilliance. I'd like to Thank Suwarnam the bar manager and Netraw the bartender for a fantastic service and cocktails. Just amazing

Just had 3 yummy cocktails at this bar! The staff were well informed on the menu and were helpful and friendly. The drinks were of very generous size and well worth the cost! I'd happily return and recommend this place to anyone interested in well executed cocktails!

Best bar in Kathmandu. All time favorite Eastside

Bitters and Co. is an absolute gem. The ambiance is immaculate, effortlessly setting the mood for a memorable evening. Their drinks are nothing short of spectacular, crafted with precision and bursting with flavor. The staff are exceptionally well-trained, striking the perfect balance between professionalism and warmth. Highly recommended!

The ambience here is just amazing! The cocktails,food everything is outstanding! Staffs here are well behaved and perfectly dressed! Honourable mention:- Sauron Basnet add some extra spice to our visit to bitters & co. Thank you saurav for your great hospitality! Keep up the good work

If you're looking for a top-notch cocktail experience, Bitters & Co. is an absolute must-visit. From the moment you step inside, the ambiance sets the perfect mood--dim lighting, plush seating, and a relaxed yet sophisticated vibe. The bartenders here are true artists; they know their craft and are always willing to suggest something new based on your taste preferences.

What really sets Bitters & Co. apart is the attention to detail. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always making you feel right at home, whether you're a regular or a first-time guest. There's also a curated selection of small plates, perfect for pairing with your drinks.

Overall, it's the kind of place where you can easily spend hours unwinding with friends or enjoying a quiet evening solo. Highly recommend checking it out if you're in town!

Always looking forward to a great time at Bitters & Co.

We went there last week with friends where there was Nepalese renowned band 'The Elements', and the funny thing is we were the only customer there then we requested to play their song out of their respect.  But unfortunately we didn't know they don't care about Nepalese aritst and their creation. They don't respect Nepalese artists then we knew. We have been to many bars and places they respect customer choices depending on their own policies. This is one of the worst places where I have been and regret being there. Nothing good at all. Bitters and Co is my favorite bar in Kathmandu! Amazing cocktails, cozy vibes. Don't miss the Goal Digger -- it's perfection in a glass. Plus, Doja the cat makes every visit unforgettable! Highly recommended!

One of the worst place I've ever been. They don't inspire Nepalese artist even the artist is there. They don't respect Nepalese artist, they just care about money. As heard it's empty almost every day and even today Place was entirely empty we were the only customer there but they failed so bad with their customer service. It's dead no vibe at all.  Never go there.
Always a great time at Bitters & Co with Rabin & Mona. One of the best bars in K- town. Buff sliders are just so delicious

Went here based on the reviews. However I was not sure as some seemed to be fake. Went anyways. What we liked are the drinks. They were really good, but pricey. Nothing for a local Newari. The food was rather cheap but good. We liked the bread with cheese and the loaded fries. The service was attentive. What we did not like that you can smoke anywhere and that the ac is blowing the smoke through the room.

Great service,yummy food and cocktails .
If you're unsure in ordering, let the bartender know your preferences and them do their magic for ya.

This was my second time visiting Bitters & Co, and once again I was thoroughly impressed. My brother first introduced me to this place and from the service to the drink everything was spot-on. I decided to stick with the same drink I had the first time a Negroni sour and it was just as fantastic as I remembered. Overall a great experience and I have my brother to thank for bringing me back to this gem!

A fantastic cocktail bar with a ceiling as high as 2 floors, and with a tree bang in the centre of the bar.
Whether the bar was constructed around the tree or they decided to grow one in the middle of the bar is something I don't know, but it really added to the aesthetic.
The drinks were fantastic
The food portions were good too. The mozzarella sticks I wouldn't order again. The gochujang fries were great.
A must visit when in the city

Bitters & Co. is an absolute masterpiece of a cocktail bar.   No need for a menu--just share your mood, and the bartenders will craft a custom drink like magic. It's like they have a drink menu for your soul!

The vibe is effortlessly cool, perfect year-round, and the hosts? They're the kind of amazing that makes you want to stay for "just one more" (and you probably will!).

Every sip, every visit, every moment here is an experience worth savoring! Thank you!

I arrived late on a Monday night.  The hospitality the staff and manager showed was amazing.  The bartender created specialty cocktails based on what I said I liked, which were a take on a negroni and a (lavender) martini.  The interior is gorgeous, with date night vibes.  A must-go if you are in Lazimpat (excuse the spelling!)
Best venue in Kathmandu for cocktails. Staff were kind, friendly and professional.Beautiful ambience and amazing decoration.

Amazing cocktails
Music soo good

Worst Service Ever. We waited 1 whole hour to get one drink and even when that wasn't done, we ordered shots instead. But even that took almost an hour so we just had to cancel the whole order. There were barely any people inside the bar and still the service was so slow. Truly disappointed by a bar that is supposed to be one of the best in KTM. Would give 0 stars if possible.

What a lovely cocktail bar! Delicious cocktails and yummy snacks. Service was excellent, with great recommendations. The highlight for me though was a super friendly cat, Doja, who came and cuddled and hung out with me the whole time, eventually going to sleep curdled up against me.

Bitters & Co is a gem for espresso martini enthusiasts, serving what could easily be the best in town. Their commitment to quality is evident as they use 100% organic coffee from Nuwa Estate, ensuring each sip is as pure as it is delightful. The international coffee delegation left impressed, a testament to Bitters&Co's exceptional offerings. If you're seeking a top-notch coffee cocktail experience, this is the place to be!

Excellent service from the head mixologist, they really took a good care of us. Try their negroni, sour or regular, and for sure you'll really enjoy it. Extensive menu with various liquor base. I was gifted with this trip by a local guy, having his local honey shop nearby.
I bought mad honey, produced himselsoap infused essential oils. He gifted me lip balm. We had this awesome magic talk about business, life, family. He speaks perfect English. Asked to call him Everest. We couldn't stop talking so he invited me to the bar, it was very close.

We talked by midnight.

If you look for a perfect european minimalist style - this is it. For Ukrainians, if you like Loggerhead you would like this one also. Price is good for the level of this bar.

P.S. they have a cat living there. I miss my cat so much, it was please to talk to this One, asked to say hi to my old friend.

Sandhar is known for its jhol, so what's the point if you can't even give your customers a decent amount when they request it? After today, I'm not going back. This was the worst experience.

The food tastes amazing, especially the buff momo--fast, flavorful, and in high demand. The goat momo is pricier and takes longer, but absolutely worth it. Their jhol is out of this world.

However, the place gets very crowded. Even with many staff, it's chaotic during peak hours. We couldn't find a seat. The coupon system makes it feel disorganized--it's not first-come, first-served.

People still go for the experience, and the food lives up to the hype.
It's all about franchises but in other locations it may be good

The restaurant cafe de patan was really nice the staffs and the service were really good the food was amazing and especially the manager Mr Nischal Shakya ji he is really just bravo

During my visit to Nepal in early 2025, I stopped by Cafe de Patan, a small family-run restaurant in the heart of Patan's old city. The atmosphere was quiet and authentic, surrounded by the rich cultural heritage of the area.

The family running the cafe was warm and welcoming. I tried Chatamari for the first time--simple, traditional, and full of local flavor. Sitting on the rooftop afterward, I enjoyed a peaceful view of Patan's historic skyline.

This cafe isn't fancy, but it carries a quiet charm that reflects the soul of the city. A lovely place to pause and feel connected.

The view is excellent over the city. The service is good but the food is average. The coffee is not that great for Nepal.

Music was too loud and heavy on the bass. Who plays that kind of music in the morning? Felt like I was being repeatedly kicked in the ears.
Great Experience
Good food Good Ambience..near Patan Durbar square..ginger buff the must try dish here..

One of best places in Patan to try authentic Newari food. The place was chosen by my colleague to introduce local food to a group of our clients this morning and I should say that was a great decision. The servers were also really hospitable and accommodating. Definitely recommend.
Food was good and ajay vaiko service was osm ..we'd love to visit again ..thankyou ajay!!

The staff were incredibly warm, attentive, and genuinely welcoming, making the whole experience feel personal and relaxed. The attached cafe also served delicious food and coffee, making it a great spot to unwind.

If you're looking for a quiet, authentic, and beautifully maintained place to stay in Patan, I highly recommend Cafe de Patan. I'll definitely return!
I went three times and probably I will go again. Delicious food, beautiful courtyard, kind people.
The food was okay. Tried their buff choila; the meat was very hard. The Chinese Chopsuey had no flavour. The Fish Sizzler was salty.
Ordered full breakfast. The juice is also taste cheap and the salad the cucumber was so bad that my mouth taste gone whole wrong.

A pleasant location, but the service is subpar. The server wasn't attentive, had to ask for the same thing multiple times, yet he kept on forgetting. And once the food was brought, that was it, no check backs, nothing. We said we'd order mains as we only ordered sides but there was no one to be seen.
And the food was utterly awful, we ordered cheeseballs, it was fine but it came with a mayo, which wasn't best of quality. And the boneless chicken chilly was shameful, it was undercooked, batter was burnt, and not even mixed with the chilly sauce, it actually didn't have any chilly sauce. Didn't even ordered mains after that. And even the coke came in a plastic glass.
The food was quite ok (good momo, fine pancake dishes, ppor chicken drumsticks), service is a bit slow,but friendly.
good place good food

Cafe de Patan is a charming restaurant located close to the heart of Patan Durbar Square (Yela Lyaku). The ambience is a perfect blend of traditional Newa culture and modern dining setup, making it a unique spot for both locals and visitors. The restaurant beautifully incorporates Newa architecture, with intricate woodwork and heritage-inspired decor, giving you the feeling of being immersed in history while enjoying a great meal.

The food here is authentic and fantastic, with a variety of traditional Newa dishes that you shouldn't miss. Some of the highlights include the cone pizza, buff and chicken ginger with baji set, and the Newa platter, which offers a delightful mix of flavors. Other must-try items include momo, soups, burgers, bara (woo), and chattamari, all prepared with great attention to taste and authenticity. They also have a good selection of coffee and alcoholic beverages, making it a great place for a relaxed meal or an evening hangout.

If you're looking for a place to experience traditional Newa cuisine, Cafe de Patan is the place to be. For two-wheelers, parking is convenient, but if you're driving a four-wheeler, you'll need to park at the Durbar Square parking lot. Payments are easy with QR and card payment options available. Highly recommended for anyone wanting to enjoy great food in a cultural setting!
Quiet place, quick service and good ambience
Great milk coffee, attentive service, and nice ambiance.

Saw a rat popping out of our table cushion and ran on the floor.
Wifi does not operate in certain areas of the cafe
Food is unnecessarily expensive
The waiter with glasses on has no hospitality manners zero interest in explaining delicacies
The food is extraordinary, fresh and delicious. Friendly staff and pleasant vibes.

Recently I went with my family, orderd fried buff momo, chicken momo fries and some fresh drinks. Everything was fine but the fried buff momo was kind a sour(amilo). Quiet place with great food and excellent customer service.

Well, you'll get parking space if you get there. I had pizza, which was visually impaired appealing too and also the taste was good.

Cafe de Patan is perfectly situated, just a short walk to Patan Durbar Square and nearby shops. The diverse menu offers a wide selection of Newari and Italian dishes, along with imported wines. Located in the centre of Mangal bazaar ,Patan ...a lovely restaurant . Can be a little crowded with the  locals  in  the evenings but in the day ;you could have the whole place for yourself . Its a pity....The  BEST location in Patan, beautiful old charming house, wonderful staff, 3rd generation family owner who proudly wants to continue running the place, good reputation and mentioned in all guide books etc etc.....
But the truth is - the place really needs a proper renovation...its old old old.
And even old would be okey if you would take care of the place.
Wash all the windows, clean and varnish all the furniture, change the old curtains to new ones, make sure the bedlinen is clean and not full of stains, make the waterheater/hot shower work please, scrub all the tiles in the bathrooms, change the carpets....take out all the dust from everywhere..These are all small things that can be made cheaply with only manpower, no need to spend tons of money.
This wonderful place needs a proper facelift, back to its past glory !!!
It got all the potential.
Owners are really really nice people with good english and communication.

We visited this place after seeing that it was quite highly rated. However, it would be an understatement to say that it didn't live up to the ratings. It was a total disaster. We ordered the vegetable sizzler, baby calzone and cold coffee. The restaurant was almost empty. The sizzler was poor, with no sauce and a very dry and tasteless veg patty. Cafes in my local area have better veg sizzlers than Places restaurant.

The waiter somehow "missed" the baby calzone order even though we had ordered only 3 items. A clear lack of training was on display. I am quite baffled as to how this restaurant is so highly rated on Google. Maybe the quality may have degraded quite a bit in a short span of time, which is quite common in Nepal and usually due to changes in the backroom staff. Avoid this place if you can.
