Zhe Li Ye Ti Gong Xi Yi Fu Wu,Xing Jie Bi Yuan Sheng Zhou Bian. Zong Er Yan Zhi,Wo Cheng Yi Tui Jian!
All the staffs are friendly and well behaved. And the service is fast .. overall I am satisfied with their service.

We were originally meant to stay at Yala Peak for 2 nights, but found ourselves returning multiple times throughout our time in Nepal and spent the best part of a week here. It was by far our favourite accommodation during our journey through India and Nepal. Above all, the staff at Yala were delightful: incredibly helpful, kind and welcoming (thank you!!!).

We stayed in three different rooms, all of which were very spacious and comfortable, with access to a balcony where we enjoyed room service dinner one evening. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were all delicious and unrivalled by anywhere else we ate in Kathmandu. We left our luggage here whilst we went trekking and then again for a few nights in Bhaktapur, which was a lifesaver.  The location is brilliant, in the heart of Thamel with a supermarket two doors down and a short walk to Durbar Square. Amazing value, 10/10.

Thank you so much to everyone at Yala for making our stay such a highlight, we were very sad to leave! - Ella and Amy
Best place to stay with your loved once

Di Dian Fei Chang Bang,Nao Zhong Qu Jing,Hen Xi Huan Lou Xia De Can Ting,Fu Wu Ren Yuan Du Mian Dai Wei Xiao,Gei Ren Hen Hao De Yin Xiang!

Lao Zhai Zhu Su De Fang Jian Kuan Chang Shu Shi,Lou Xia De Can Ting Hen Hao Chi,Gong Zuo Ren Yuan Du Hen You Shan Qin Qie,Zheng Ti CPZhi Gao!

Fang Jian Li Ce Suo Pian Lao Jiu,Shui Long Tou Chu Shui Liang Pian Xiao,Dan Yi Zhe Ge Jia Qian Lai Shuo,Zheng Ti Yi Jing Hen Bang Liao!

Good stay overall! The staff are incredibly kind and helpful. The location is perfect - right in the heart of Thamel but still quiet and peaceful. My first room had excellent WiFi but barely any hot water. After extending my stay, I was moved to another room with better hot water, though the WiFi was terrible and the bathroom flooded whenever I took a shower. The beds were comfortable in both rooms and everything was relatively clean. The restaurant is lovely and has delicious breakfast/food (though a bit pricey next to other places), and the staff there are absolutely adorable. Would stay again, especially if room conditions were more consistent.
Bardzo dobra lokalizacja. Bardzo pomocna obsluga. Na miejscu jedna z najlepiej ocenionych restauracji. Pokoje ok.

I have been here for nearly a week and I totally reccomen this place. Is in the center but still really quiet, cleand and staff is really nice, always ready to help. They also upgrade me to a better room for the same price!
We took a room for four persons, which we got at a very reasonable pricing. The room was quite spacious. The lady on the desk was quite helpful. However, the wifi could've been faster.
Everything perfect, so confortable mattress

Excellent hotel, chambre economique, spacieuse et confortable.
Une tres bonne adresse idealement placee dans thamel.
Un personnel aux petits soins, et d'excellents petits dejeuners proposes au restaurant de l'hotel.
Je recommande vivement.
Lovely hotel in the centre of thamel for a great price. Staff are very nice people

The room was lovely and affordable. The location is centrally located and the staff is very accommodating. We liked it so much that we booked one more night we needed on the way back from Pokhara. 10/10 recommend

Very nice hotel for the price! Comfy beds and nice staff.  It is in the middle of Thamel, so a short walk away from shops and Durbar square. They have a cafe that is quite expensive (touristpriced), so I'd go elsewhere for breakfast.

So nice! One of the best hotels in Nepal for the price. Staff are the friendliest people who go out of their way to help you. Location is excellent in Thamel. Pretty clean, for the price you pay it's worth it, other hotels I stayed at and payed more were on the same level or worse. Yala is great!

Warm shower 24 hour
Delicious food yummy
Comfortable beds.
Room 405 and 401 best deluxe options.
Friendly yala team
Respected owner(Sir) he has beautiful soul.
One of the best human I have ever met
I learned lot from him and sudin Sir is amazing.
All  yala peak hotel and cafe staffs are amazing
Room available 1000 INR very old room but restaurant service is also good near of main road
Ich liebe dieses Hotel, ich wurde in 15 Jahren noch nie enttauscht, danke fur alles !!!

The best hotel ever in Nepal! We spent one week in Nepal and stayed in around 5 hotels, but this one is amazing.
Staff was perfect, empathetic, attentive. They provided us good room with good view, complimentary water bottles, good laundry and smiled every time
Room was clean, hot air conditioner any time, hot water any timer. All for just 17$ per night
Amazing!

This was my first visit to KTM, and my first stay was at hotel yala peak. Though I had considered staying/ experiencing another place after coming back from pokhara; I ended up re-booking hotel yala peak again.
Lovely service, and their outdoor seating area is soaked with sunshine in the morning. I enjoyed my teas over there everyday.

Will definitely book them if and when i am back in KTM.
Best place to stay in Thamel - Nepal , great hospitality.... Budget friendly
Mycke trevligt budget hotell

I stayed at Hotel Yala Peak for a few nights before and after going on a trek. Located right in the middle of Thamel, it made it convenient when I wanted to go out to do some exploring. The room was very clean and the service was great! The workers are very helpful and friendly! I contacted the hotel manager, Durga, before heading to Nepal and he assisted me with arranging a room as well as transportation to and from the airport for the trek and when I arrived/departed. They also have laundry service for a reasonable price. I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit!

I can't emphasize enough how welcoming everyone is in the hotel and coffee. The rooms are comfy, shower has hot water, food is amazing, there is a kettle on the room although I can't find the cups . The location is really good, you are just in the middle of the mingle within walking distance to the Dunbar square, garden of dreams and many more places.

Tres bon rapport qualite-prix. Le personnel est adorable, tres souriant et toujours presents pour repondre a nos questions et demandes ! Nous y avons sejourne deux fois, une fois en arrivant au Nepal et une fois en repartant, bonne experience les deux fois!
Le seul bemol serait la proprete de la salle de bain commune parfois.

One of the best hotels to stay in Thamel, Kathmandu Nepal. The receptionists are especially helpful. The girl receptionists are one who helped us to stay there with a low budget and we got a deluxe room for 4 people. For that, everyone must stay there and enjoy their welcome. I would recommend everyone to stay there. The place is so good in town.

Booked one night on 19 Oct before we started our trek. Chose this place due to the close location to our travel agent office. Room and bathroom was average. Not the cleanest but ok for budget hotel. Wifi not strong. Nice view at rooftop and good service by front desk staff and the Cafe. Ordered breakfast early from Cafe. Stored one of our bags  at front desk and collected it after trek. Really helped a lot!

Fantastische plek. Super vriendelijk personeel, heerlijk eten en lekkere wijn. Alles voor een goede prijs. Meerdere keren terug gekomen hier en elke keer zorgde het personeel er voor dat ik weer in dezelfde kamer terecht kon. Het voelde echt als thuis komen! Schone, ruime kamer. Voor mij geen probleem dat er alleen een ventilator was, in oktober geen probleem. Klein minpuntje is dat het heel lang kan duren voordat het water warm wordt. Een verspilling van water.

I booked my stay here for a week as a solo and it was very good here in a budget friendly price, staff were there very welcoming, polite and helpful.
Rooms was good, clean and hygienic, they have all kind of rooms like from basic budget friendly to deluxe rooms. also they have their own cafe and restaurant so you can have your breakfast and delicious meals there. About location wise it was in the middle of thamel city so everything is available near by like famous visiting places, shops, airport etc.
So i will highly recommend for everyone.
Thank you 
Love from India
Room was really good... Employees are also friendly and helpful... The day we returned from Ramechepe their room was packed ... But somehow they managed to provide a room for that night...
Viimenen vaihdettiin kulmahuoneeseen, kauhea meteli kadulta
Great food and extremely friendly and helpful staff! The rooms are good budget rooms, the price for value is great! Also a plus: the rooms are very quiet at night.

Amazing stay. The staff were the best and kindest I have ever met in my travel, so incredibly helpful. Cafe downstairs was also so good and cheap, best coffee we found. Only downside is the rooms are not AC which was abit of a struggle for us but if your fine with that then defo stay here. Location is great also.

Loved staying here, the staff were so friendly and helpful! Only problem was the lack of aircon in the rooms as they can get really hot and the singular fan doesn't do much, but that was on us for not double checking. The hotel is situated in a really good location and the cafe on the ground floor serves the best coffee!! Absolutely would recommend this place, such good value for money

This hotel was super nice. Specially their receptionist and all the other staffs are really nice and well behaved. They were cooperative and wiling to help us plan our nepal trip by providing valuable information.
It was in the middle of thamel city so the location of this restaurant was top.
But the rooms are okayish and we stayed in triple bed which didn't have any ceiling fan though thamel becomes chilled in the night. Some rooms didn't have any washrooms.
Best and good service by hotel and cafe

The best hotel I can recommend in Kathmandu. Cleanliness, service, warm hospitality, breakfast, the taste of the food - everything was truly perfect. Among the staff, especially Binod Balami is an amazing person. I got sick and he even accompanied me to the hospital; I will never forget his help. He is such a clean-hearted, honest, and genuine person. In Kathmandu, you are in safe hands.

The reception staff also immediately assist with any questions you may have. I cannot thank them enough - they made me feel at home. Everyone does their job with such professionalism, congratulations to all of you.

Lastly, the location of the hotel is fantastic - within walking distance to everywhere. And once you step into the garden, you are surrounded by peace and quiet. There cannot be a better hotel in Kathmandu.
All staff are kind and respectful to everyone, a place that is visible from all sides.
Great
Best in all

This is truly a great place to stay if visiting Katmandu; the place is like a quiet oasis of calm away from the noise of the city only a short distance away. The accommodation, service and grounds are delightful as so is the cuisine. There is also plenty to see within the Hotel's splendid grounds too, including the art gallery-museum and craft workshops garden and the many decorative ornaments and sculptures.

However, venturing outside the hotel grounds although a fascinating and enlightening experience to see the many splendid shops and eateries, it  is not a healthy experience as the pollution from the never ending traffic jams of closely  packed cars, trucks and motorbikes is so intense you can feel it with every breath.

There have been many, many famous individuals stay at this hotel as you can witness on displays and the pathways around the grounds.

This place gives you different experiences while visiting Kathmandu
I highly  recommend it

Charming, Instagrammable Stay in the Heart of Thamel
I stayed at Kathmandu Guest House for just one night, but it left a great impression. Nestled right in the heart of Thamel, it's surrounded by cafes, clubs, shopping spots, and currency exchanges -- perfect for tourists looking to explore on foot.

The hotel itself is beautiful and full of character. From lush gardens to cozy corners, it's a photographer's paradise -- super Instagrammable! They even have a museum, souvenir shops, and a tea tasting corner, which was such a lovely touch.

I stayed in an Executive Suite, which was spacious, comfortable, and worth the higher price for a short stay. I noticed that the more budget-friendly rooms felt a bit too small and cramped, so I'd definitely recommend going for the higher category if comfort matters to you.

The breakfast was okay -- I had higher expectations, but it was decent for a one-night stay. The staff were helpful and check-in was smooth. The garden areas and outdoor seating really make it a great place to relax.

My room didn't have a great view, but honestly, the hotel itself is a destination -- I'd love to stay 2-3 days next time just to explore more of it.

Overall, a lovely and peaceful escape in the middle of the buzz of Thamel. Would definitely recommend it for those who want both charm and convenience!
Fast services and Good location.
Great support
naneun aju manjogseureon..  daman seoyangsig, teughi hangug taegug coegogeubhotel deunge igsughan saramegeneun gaegsilsujuneun miheub.  geureona siseolyi yeogsawa seutori, bunwigineun coego
Fiyat kondisyon ve lokasyon olaganustu

Kathmandu Guest House is a peaceful escape right in the middle of Thamel -- the courtyard and garden are beautiful, and the location is unbeatable. I stayed three times during my trip and found the Deluxe rooms to be spacious, clean, and well worth the small extra cost. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout, and the on-site spa was excellent after trekking the Manaslu Circuit.

The Standard rooms are quite basic and less clean, so I'd definitely recommend upgrading if possible. Great value for a premium experience by local standards.

Fantastic hotel experience. The hotel is very well located in the center, stepping out the gate numerous shops can be found to satisfy basic needs and shop for souvenirs. There is closed garden in the center surrounded by the hotel buildings to chill or enjoy a cup of tea, etc. The food service is excellent, there is variety for all tastes and purified water tank all over the place to keep hydrated - this is very well-thought. The staff is very kind, approachable and kindly adjusted to our special needs. Places are clean and we were very satisfied with the cleaning service provided.

It's a great place - rooms, good, service, warm purple, ambience - everything.
Being right in Thamel, one is practically in the heart of action. That might mean  nights are not absolutely silent, but only if one is super-sensitive to sound.
It has become a repeat hotel for me. I hope I come here again - once for holiday.
Super nice rooms and grounds. It doesn't feel like you're in Kathmandu at all, but the accommodations are very nice and modern.
Vu l'emplacement de l'hotel au coeur de Thamel, il y a beaucoup de bruits alentours - clubs, bars, noctambules, etc. Pas tres reposant mais c'est le coeur de Kathmandu.

Great base from which to explore Kathmandu, incredible sunset views from the 7th floor sky bar.
Good choice of food /drinks and nice breakfast with fresh omelttes and pancakes available

One of the best hotels I've stayed at in Kathmandu! The service was incredibly welcoming, and the receptionists were super nice, they even upgraded my room. Everything was very clean, and the garden was beautiful. The location was perfect since it's right in the center of Thamel, making it easy to shop around.

Best hotel
Excellent  services
Excellent Guest House in Thamel. Quiet with a beautiful garden to relax and enjoy time after trekking. The staff are very professional. We stayed now 2 times and will be back!
Excellent

*5/5 Stars*

I had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Katmandu Guest House in Nepal, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience! From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with warm hospitality that made me feel right at home.

*Hospitality: 5/5*

The staff at Katmandu Guest House were incredibly friendly and welcoming. They went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. From helping me with my luggage to providing recommendations for local attractions, they were always available to assist.

*Garden: 5/5*

The garden at Katmandu Guest House was a tranquil oasis in the heart of the city. Beautifully maintained and meticulously manicured, it was the perfect spot to relax and unwind after a long day of exploring. The garden was also a great place to meet fellow travelers and share stories of our adventures.

*Dining: 5/5*

The open-air dining area was a highlight of my stay. Gathering around the burning fire, sharing meals and stories with fellow travelers, was a truly magical experience. The food was delicious, and the staff were always happy to accommodate special requests.

*Amenities: 5/5*

I was impressed by the attention to detail when it came to the amenities provided. The room was stocked with an array of toiletries, including:

- Body scrubber
- Toothbrush
- Razors
- Shower cap
- Earbuds
- Hair comb

It was clear that the staff had thought of everything to make my stay as comfortable and convenient as possible.

*Overall: 5/5*

I would highly recommend Katmandu Guest House to anyone traveling to Nepal. The combination of warm hospitality, beautiful gardens, and thoughtful amenities made for a truly unforgettable experience. I would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend it to friends and family.

*Tips for Future Guests:*

- Be sure to take advantage of the beautiful garden and outdoor dining area.
- Don't hesitate to ask the staff for recommendations or assistance - they are always happy to help.
- Take a moment to appreciate the thoughtful amenities provided - it's clear that the staff have put a lot of thought into making your stay special.
Good location and good decent places

Our favourite hang out at the heart of Thamel is Kathmandu Guest House. Our family has been going to this hotel since a very long time and I have very fond memories of this place with my son and my husband. Although, the place changed after the April 2015 earthquake that destroyed the building but not entirely. Anyway, my son & I made new memories this time one evening  and we tried to find out our favourite corners of the hotel which by the way is unrecognisable now. It's so lovely to sit outside in the garden with a chill in the air but a big fire keeps everyone warm and fuzzy. Ayhan, for old times sake bought a book on Nepali Folk Tale. Nepal is tucked away very deeply and comfortably in our hearts and we can never get enough of Nepal.

Hier wohnten Herr Matthias Halbwidl aus Hollabrunn / Osterreichund Herr Professor Rolf Zinkernagel (Nobelpreistrager Medizin 19..) aus Zurich / Schweiz vom 5.-7. Oktober 2024. Sie waren mit dem Aufenthalt sehr zufrieden. Der Extrembergsteiger Reinhold Messner (80 J., aus Sudtirol) kommt noch jedes Jahr hierher!
Value for money!

Great location right in the centre, yet the hotel has a lovely courtyard that is an oasis. KGH arranged pick up from the airport which was very helpful because we arrived in so late. Our room was spacious and the bed very comfy. We would certainly come back. Thank you

I very much enjoyed my stay at KGH. Its long history is interesting. It was relatively quiet considering its location in the heart of Thamel. Room was clean, garden is lovely, breakfast buffet was fine. And the cat is friendly. :-) I especially appreciated the staff for storing a duffel bag for me while I was away on a trek. I will be staying there again next time in Kathmandu.

A wonderful stay at Kathmandu Guest House! The location in Thamel is perfect close to everything yet peaceful and relaxing. The gardens are beautiful, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff is incredibly warm and helpful. A perfect blend of history, comfort, and hospitality. Highly recommend for anyone visiting Kathmandu!
Great location, friendly staff and gear service
Yes I  experience very good

Ich habe das Museum of Nepali Art besucht und war zwischendurch auch im Gartenbereich und wurde auch direkt von einem Kellner angesprochen und gefragt ob ich Kaffee wolle. Der Cappuccino war exzellent (teuer, aber das war zu erwarten). Was mich storte, dass ich viermal gefragt wurde, ob ich nicht zu Mittagessen wolle. Ich finde es anstrengend, wenn ein klares Nein ignoriert wird. Ein zweites Mal nachfragen ist auch in Ordnung. Aber drei bis viermal habe ich personlich als sehr drangend empfunden...
C'etait tres bien et personnel tres a l'ecoute

Prime location, one of the oldest hotel in thamel. It has its own legency and brand. Recently new wing was added. Old buildings rooms are not that comfortable to my liking. Restaurent service is very good. My visiting guest was rejected to room which I didn't like at all.

Last night, my best friend and I decided to have dinner at Kathmandu Guest. It was cold, and we were really looking forward to a cozy, warm meal. But to say we were disappointed is an understatement,The food they served us was cold and raw  cooked. When we tried to get the staff's attention, they were too busy chatting with each other, completely ignoring the guests,They didn't even bother to ask if we wanted warm water, which is basic courtesy, especially on a cold evening. All the staff were just huddled together, gossiping, and seemed completely uninterested in actually doing their job. It felt like we were intruding on their hangout session rather than dining at a restaurant.If you can't be bothered to serve your guests properly, maybe it's time to rethink running a restaurant. Hospitality isn't just about owning a property, it's about how you treat your guests. This was the worst dining experience I've ever had, and I can confidently say I'll never go back.
Not recommending this place to anyone. Worst. Experience ever . #Worsthotel

Hotel is in the city centre Thamel, great Location, the tourist spots are located nearby to this hotel and even some at walking distance. The ambience in hotel is good with an open garden restaurant.
Rooms are clean, worth every Penny.

"I recently had the pleasure of staying at KGH, Thamel kathmandu, and I must say, my experience was wonderful! The service provided by the staff was exceptional; they were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure my stay was enjoyable. The cleanliness and comfort of the accommodations made it feel like a home away from home. I highly recommend KGH to anyone looking for a delightful getaway. Thank you.
Amazing location , fantastic service all the way through. Breakfast is amazing and all the fantastic team. Couldn't recommend them highly enough. Thank you so much

Hotel molto bello e ben tenuto, personale gentilissimo  e cordiale.
E immerso in uno splendido giardino
Ottima posizione per visitare la citta.

What a place. It was me and my friend first international trip and we are glad we chose Nepal.Coming to this place filled our heart.  The music, the staff and the location was all A1 but would like to mention Two young ladies names here who were the part of the staff at the reception Ms Abhisha and  Ms Diya Shrestha  they were generous and kind throughout.  they treated us humbly. I request the hotel staff to give them their part of appreciation. All over it was a great stay
The best place to stay in Katmandu.
jigweondeulyi cinjeolham

The hotel is in a great location, specially if you looking for lively environment. It is close to many famous clubs and pubs in a walking distance & the hotel is really spacious both indoor and outdoor.

However, the service they provide is shocking ! I as a local citizen stayed two nights in this hotel and was in complete shock how the staff behaved and the service provided. First thing first i was side by side with a foreign customer & the difference on their reciprocal was massive. When i asked them about the payment for their services in US dollars, the employee behaviour changed and stopped answering.

Heard a lot about KGH group before but was surprised with such a beautiful hotel, such a lovely ambience, such a great location could provide such a poor service.

Kathmandu Guest House was an incredible place to stay. The staff were very attentive, the room was beautiful and they even gave me a cake for my birthday without charge. I'll definitely be coming back, also because there is a beautiful garden where you can relax while also being in the heart of Kathmandu. The location is fantastic as it's in the middle of Thamel. If you're staying in Kathmandu this is the perfect place to visit

My daughter just finished a 14 day trek in nepal and booked this hotel for her last day in Katmandu, it was her birthday as well, I contacted the hotel via email and promptly received a email back from Palistha Tuladhar the front office manager , I asked him if it is possible to arrange something for my daughter for her birthday  , when she checked in to hotel they upgraded her and also arranged a birthday cake with a card wishing her a lovely birthday , I am completely amazed of the kind gesture that Palistha Tuladhar arranged on my behalf , Sir your attention to detail and kindness is without a doubt one of the best experiences that I have received from a hotel , I wish I could give more than 5 stars as you deserve it , thank you so much all the way from Australia

Soggiornare al Kathmandu Guesthouse significa fare un tuffo nella storia. E' una struttura bellissima e un hotel 4 stelle meraviglioso, le stanze sono ampie e molto ben arredate, il giardino bellissimo, ci sono numerosi servizi all'interno e la colazione a buffet e eccezionale.
Il punto di forza, per cui vale la pena spendere qualcosa di piu per gli standard nepalesi, e che trascorri la notte in un luogo storico, dove sono passati tantissimi personaggi, dai piu famosi alpinisti ai Beatles (vedi la walk of fame nel giardino).
Nel cuore di Thamel. Da non  perdere!
I was there for Tea Bar of Nepal Tea Collective, and that was brilliant. The various initiatives inside the KGH are very interesting.
Very good
The staff are very kind and handle any issues with great care. The location is in the heart of Thamel, making it easy to access restaurants and souvenir shops.

Overpriced tourist trap. No storage space whatsoever in the three-man room. Patchy and slooow internet. Not even a wall plug to plug the kettle into is provided in the room's tea making corner, which doesn't include coffee creamer which is standard even in lesser hotels. There are better options in Thamel.

KGH is in the heart of the food and shopping scene, not to mention the location of the Museum of Nepali Art (MoNA). The rooms are wonderfully appointed and the service is spot on with friendly and super helpful staff. The food is delicious no the rooftop bar is a nice spot to take in the surrounding area of Thamel. If you have the opportunity to stay here do it, you won't be disappointed.

Not a good experience.no water for some time in bathroom.very slow flow through drainage.bathroom facilities was very poor.
Staff was very helpful.breakfast excellent.
Other good hotels available in that area at this tarrif.

KGH was a great place to stay in the heart of Thamel. The rooms were clean and amenities great! Breakfast buffet served a number of items from various nationalities. The service we received was prompt and attentive. I would highly recommend KGH.
Very good rooms. Centrally located. Excellent service. Lots of food and shops options next to hotel.

I love staying at the Kathmandu Guest House when I'm in Thamel because its large garden is such an oasis from the street scene. The standard rooms are fine, but the deluxe rooms are worth the extra price if you want western quality accommodation.
Hands down to the Best Gimbap in the town . Overall the Price, the service , the food .. everything are so amazing. Do visit this beautiful cafe
Great kimbap, lovely owner. I always love visiting there.

Cafe Hessed is a charming pay-first cafe where you place your order at the counter. The menu is simple and limited, featuring a selection of gimbap, bakery items, and beverages.

We tried the Tuna and Chicken Gimbap, and both were absolutely delicious -- fresh, flavorful, and perfectly balanced. The accompanying kimchi added a delightful kick that elevated the experience even further. It's a no-fuss spot with a cozy atmosphere and satisfying food that leaves you wanting to come back for more.

Very much disappointed with timing.
They closes the cafe way early..
1. Reached at 7 PM on first try but they were closed.
2. Reached around 7 PM on second try and they were closed again. On further enquiry, they said they are open till 6:45 PM only.
3. Reached at 6:40 PM or before that on third try and they said they are closed and only take aways are available.
4. Reached at 6:30 PM on fourth try and they said they wont be serving and only take aways are available.
Though their food tastes good, they should really work on the cafe opening time

Really really pissed off
Love the kimbap here and also the muffins, the kimchi I had were nearing it's shelf life. Other than that it's always good food at a good price.
Good food and cup cakes. Also the place is good to be around if your are fan of gimbap. Worth every penny you pay for.
I one of the best place to be on rainy days.
One of the best kimbabs in the Kathmandu Valley. Very affordable price, and the service was super fast. Highly recommended for anyone who loves kimbab. The owners are also sweet and kind.

Food tastes great. Loved it.
The pricing is also pretty good.
Not unnecessarily expensive so hope they maintain the taste and price as well.
They don't provide soya sauce so that felt missing with Kimbap.
Parking not available so its road side parking.
Easy for 2 wheeler hard for 4 wheeler.
It's pay first system.
The soup they provided tastes good.
The service and ambience is okay.
Kimbap tastes great so would love to visit again soon.
Best kimbab
Best kimbab
best kimbap
Good food and pretty aesthetics inside

Muffins are really really good.....been visiting the cafe since some years and i really love the quality of the food that they provide.

Always a good time while visiting this cafe.
Best in town for gimbap. Make sure to go before 6 PM because they get sold out soon. The bakery items get sold out even faster.

Tried the chicken kimbap and iced chocolate--both were so good! The kimchi they served on the side was surprisingly tasty too. You have to order and pay first at the reception. The walls are nicely painted with minimal art, which adds a cozy touch. Service was good and quick, but the ambience was just okay--if you're someone who enjoys peace and silence, it might feel a bit noisy and echoey. Still, worth a visit for the food!

Love love love the gimbap here. An absolute favourite!!!
Also the cupcakes are yummyy. Especially the red velvet ones.
They offer limited drink options too.

I highly recommend this place for everyone. Food are fresh and healthy .

gamsahaeyo!
Great place to sip coffee and indulge cup cakes and kimbaps

Always a fan of special kimbap!!  Very quick service even in the rush hour.
Foods to drinks everything were super hygienic and delicious

The place is cozy and also has a sitting space in ground and first floor. I tried the chicken kimbab and the kimbab was so affordable and very tasty. I liked the soup and the kimchi. The menu serves for veg, chicken, tuna and others too. The lemonade was average, so I would prefer foods moreover drinks at this place.

The goto place if you want to have the best kimbap in town.

The drinks I feel are a little pricy.
Affordable kimbap and drinks

We ordered the veggie gimbap here, it's better than the other places we have been to. The service was very quick, we didn't have to wait much for our order to arrive. The quantity was worth the price.
Loved the kimbap here.. I would say a must try

Had tried red cupcake  which was very tasty( neither too sweet nor tasteless) i.e thikka in taste. Also tried Special kimbab and Tuna kimbab. Special kimbab was tasty having little bit sweet taste in it as well, Tuna kimbab has taste of fish as it would be... Trying kimbab for the first time so, I just got satisfied. Soup was very tasty for kimbab and kimchi was a bit very sour( people who love sour would love it very much). I eat average sour so I found it very much sour . This place is mostly packed and busy but they serve you in time which is very good. This place would be best for kimbab, sour lover and cake lovers.
The food is very good . I love the atmosphere, service and food good job
Best among all the other places I've tried.

I have been here more than 50 times. The staff here are so sweet. The food is 10 out of 10. Once you go here and start liking the food, there's no going back the amount of money that I spend here is insane.
Love it!
Fav place for gimbap.
Good quality and tasty gimbaps for the price point. No brainer for a quick bite

I have only tried kimbap there which i must say is better than all other places. The price is good and also the portion is bigger than at other place. Plus it is run by korean family, so it's authentic too.

My goto place when im craving some kimbap. The chicken kimbap is my favorite here. And i would say the best in town for the price as well.

I like the peach ice tea here as well.
Overall for the price this place offers you really good food.

the strong point of this cafe is that it is run by local koreans and their food is not only scrumptious but also so affordable. the ambience is also nice, a good spacious cafe with pretty wall paintings. even their special mix kimbap is only Rs. 370 which makes them wayyyy affordable than other restaurants. best place for kimbap. they also offer delicious cupcakes
one of the best kimbap i had in lalitpur. fast service and friendly owner. RECOMMEND!

You NEED to try this place--seriously, don't walk, RUN! This is hands down the best and most authentic kimbap I've ever had (and I've had plenty).

The staff is incredibly kind, service is quick, and the best part? The owner is Korean, so you know you're getting the real deal. The menu is simple--kimbaps, cupcakes, and drinks--but they also sell a container of radish kimchi for 290. Plus, they make their own kimchi!

The space is warm and welcoming, and I've already been twice--I don't plan on stopping anytime soon. It's a hidden gem in Jhamsikhel, especially popular among school kids. My only wish is for them to expand the menu a bit--maybe add kimchi fried rice, cabbage kimchi, bibimbap, tteokbokki, fish cakes, and some Korean desserts. But honestly, it's already perfect.

The kimbap portions are generous and super filling, served with a side of radish kimchi and a soul-soothing soup (not sure what kind, but it's amazing). If you love Korean food, this spot is a must-visit!
Kimbaap here is extremely fresh and delicious and the side dishes are equally good. Also, the place is clean and cozy. Definitely a must  visit if you're a kimbaap lover.

We just tried kimbap, strawberry lemonade, iced peach tea, red velvet muffin and mocha muffin here and it was worth it. The atmosphere is very good . Very much recommended for kimbap lover . Delicious kimbap and the service is also fast too.
The service was instant. Place itself was very clean and food we ordered were of good taste. I liked their cupcakes more than I thought.
I absolutely loved the tuna kimbab here. Kimbab chai no doubt its the best hereI found this red velvet cupcake abit dry.Other than that its good.
Good place for gimbap, and a little korean family runs the place and they are sweet and to the point.
If you are kimbab lover then cafe hessed is definetly the best place where you can have best gimbab. I visit there often and Tuna Kimbab is my favourate.
I've had a Veg Kimbap, it was good.
I didn't really get the hype for this place. The food were mostly bland and bakery items were overly priced.
Beautiful, cozy and clean space with good food and cakes. Friendly staff. You do have to pay while ordering at the counter. Try any gimbap, it's really good!
Simple menu and yummy kimbab in town! Radish kimchi is delicious! Muffins are delicious. They should more to the menu.
Fast service, Chicken Kimbab was good.
Gimbap is too good
Delicious cupcake, doughnuts and Kimbab
Nice place to visit.
very yummy yayy

The cafe is cute and cosy for dates, meets with friends and sometimes even alone. The Korean vibe makes it really good and the owners are very friendly. This is my go to place for chicken kimbap and their hessed special one is also unique and tasty. I love the side broth and pickled anchovies. The cupcakes are also very nice.
Yet again it was the best and most authentic chicken gimbap. Cafe hessed never fails to impress me. The new extension has made it more spacious.
Buff kimbap turned out to be as good and delicious.
I will not consider tuna kimbap as good as other ones.

out of the blue i went for their kimbap, I'm delighted i did, now i am hooked. tried all of their offerings chicken, tuna, buff and veg kimbap, all are good. they provide kimchi with it too. they have a few options of cupcakes as well and all are just wow. this place is run by koreans and they are very hospitable. this place is highly recommended even if you don't like korean food, this will change your mind.
Food was amazing. Served extremely quick, within minutes of ordering. Atmosphere is quiet and peaceful.
The best place to eat kimbab in k-town. I would recommend it if you are a Korean food enthusiast.
Best chicken kimbap I've ever had Service also pretty quick and the owners are very sweet and friendly! Love this place,food and the cozy vibes
Good ambience
Worst food. Conjusted parking space
good place
Good location but parking wasn't enough

We recently hosted our corporate event at Maxims Banquet & Events, and it was a seamless experience from start to finish. The venue offered a spacious, well-equipped hall with modern amenities, ideal for professional gatherings. The ambiance was elegant yet functional, perfect for presentations, networking, and team celebrations.

Had attended a program and the food was tasty with deep fried chicken and all. However, had to throw up at night, and throwing up is very rare to me. That's a shame and there had be concerns regarding food of this place in previous reviews, nevertheless, I got to experience it first hand yesterday!

We went for a bratabanda party and  ambience was fine but the food was ridiculous. Cheese pakauda , only the flour was deep fried we can't even smell that and paneer masala  ,whole paneer was smelling like ketchup sauce with sour taste . And every other item we're below average.Never had this kinda terrible experience with food at  partypalace .
The food was good but the place is very small. The service was average.

Ambience is good. Dinner space seems a bit bland without vibrance and needs some decor.
During my visit last time, snacks was good but in dinner, the chixken tandoori was very poorly cooked.
Please check food before being served.
Nice one
It is mostly useful for small gatherings like birthdays and small celebrations. It cannot cater to the larger population.
Good party venue
Good Place Good Food and Well trained Staff

Had wedding+reception at Maxim in March 2025 with ~200 guests.
- My point of contact was Ms Sakshi from Sales/Marketing, and my coordination with her was excellent.
- Any changes and updates I requested were noted and executed well by Maxim. Not once I had to repeat.
- Not once did I have to do any 'kach-kach' with management staff, nor the food-service workers. Things went smooth.
- The place is ideal for 200-300 guests if there's a wedding. I am not sure about more. I had ~200 guests; so it was spacious and parking was not an issue.
- The buffet lunch's taste/quality met my expectation. The snacks' exceeded my expectation. My family and guests were very happy with food.
- Restroom was clean enough. The outdoors seating area, and the halls were cleaned very well before my party.
- Not a cheap place but isn't expensive either; the price was very reasonable considering it's in Kupondole. It was value for money.
- They even refund the booking fee, in case you cancel the party due to death / 'jutho'.
- I didn't ask them for any unreasonable accomodations during the event; I kept my end of the bargain, and they kept theirs.

I had a very, very satisfactory experience at Maxim.

Note1: Have your family and relatives take away left-over buffet and snacks after the party is over.
Note2: Be mindful to tell them what you want, what your timings are.
Note3: If some of your guests arrive pretty late while you have already okay'd closing the food, or that the banquet refuses to extend the agreed-upon time, it's not the banquet's fault. So don't be pissed at staff. We should expect them to provide good service, while we should act as good customers.

We had our wedding reception at Maxims Banquet, and it was amazing. The venue was beautiful, with excellent service and a stunning atmosphere. The food was outstanding--delicious, well-presented, and enjoyed by all our guests. Overall, a memorable experience that made our day perfect. Highly recommend!

Excellent banquet service, amazing banquet staff and fantastic food!
Cleanliness of the hall and restrooms were very good. Overall a perfect place for any kinds of events and gatherings.
2
We enjoyed alot here ! Great hospitality

"I had a deeply disappointing experience at Maxims Banquet. The wedding event I attended was extended by a couple of hours, and the staff was quite unaccommodating. They began packing up the food in plastic bags while guests were still arriving to greet the couple, leaving many without a chance to eat. We thought there was the next event after our function but there was no such event after ours. I don't know why were they in such a hurry to pack food in plastic bag. This lack of consideration felt extremely rude, especially for such an important occasion. Everyone should think one before attending or doing any events here.

Poor service and Staffa  are unresponsive. The ambiance looks quite old and needs renovating. A few of the food containers were empty and asked for a refill but the staff didn't respond properly. Seemed like they didn't even bother to refill the food. Also, the  parking is very limited and parking is a bit of an issue.

Questo hotel e fantastico! Il valore aggiunto e rappresentato senza dubbio dal personale estremamente gentile e accogliente. In particolare modo le 2 ragazze della reception sono di una dolcezza disarmante, dispensano consigli utilissimi su tutto cio che puo servire e che puo essere vantaggioso agli ospiti e fanno realmente sentire accolti come mai mi ero sentito in nessun altro hotel in cui sia stato in vita mia. Kumari was an excellent hotel. A super comfortable bed, a large spread for breakfast, on a quiet street near the edge of Thamel. If you want to stay in Thamel it's an idea place to stay for a quiet night. Personally, I'm not sure I'd choose Thamel next time, but if you want Thamel it's a great spot.

We stayed at this hotel before and after a trek, and it was fantastic. The location is great, within walking distance of a bunch of Kathmandu restaurants and tourist attractions. The service was amazing and the staff were helpful and friendly. They helped arrange airport transportation and stored our luggage securely while we were trekking, among other extremely helpful services. They really went above and beyond. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Kathmandu!

This really is a gem for the price point.  I would definitely stay here again.  The facilities were fresh and clean.  The breakfast was very good and the entire staff was extremely friendly and inviting.

The location offers plenty of shopping and dining options in the immediate walking area.

Really nice place to stay excellent hospitality, food were good small but quiet place and peaceful really enjoy my visit there .
Had an incredible stay here. The location is fantastic and short walk from lots of great sights, restaurants, and bars. But above all, the service was fantastic. Can't wait to come back!

I had an excellent stay at this hotel! The property is very well-maintained, clean, and truly feels like a home away from home. The staff were incredibly polite, attentive, and always ready to help. The food was delicious, and every meal was a delight. A special mention to one of the staff members who went above and beyond by helping me purchase medicines late at night when I wasn't feeling well. Such acts of kindness make this hotel stand out! Highly recommended for a comfortable and memorable stay.

I had an absolutely wonderful stay at this hotel! From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel as though I was staying with caring friends rather than at a hotel. They were incredibly kind, attentive, and always ready to help with a smile.

The rooms were spotless, bright, and thoughtfully designed, offering both comfort and tranquility. The hotel is located on a quiet street, providing a peaceful retreat after a busy day.

Everything about my stay exceeded my expectations, and I truly felt at home here. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a warm and welcoming place to stay.

Thank you to the amazing team for making my trip so memorable--I will definitely be back!

I would say they are professional, kind and always help me a lot. I really enjoy the stay here in Kumari.

"Kind, welcoming, clean, comfortable, friendly, professionally run, and a joy to return to". All these are accurate descriptions of the Kumari Boutique Hotel in Kathmandu.
My husband first came across this hotel as we started to come out of lockdown in 2021 and has returned there ever since. I was fortunate enough to visit the Kumari Boutique Hotel twice in 2023 and then twice again in 2024.
On my first visit in October 2024, both my husband and I were ill, having picked up a virus whilst travelling in India. The wonderful owner and his staff could not have been kinder, and on the second day we asked for a Doctor to visit my husband. We are so grateful to everyone for their kindness to us as my husband was quite ill.
The rooms are kept spotlessly clean by the excellent Housekeeping Team and the food in the hotel is also very good. Breakfast at the Kumari Boutique Hotel is one of the highlights of our visits and the front of house team are extremely friendly and helpful. They make you feel like you are the only person staying in the hotel and that nothing is too much trouble.
My only concern in writing this review, is that the hotel will be fully booked next time we visit Kathmandu!

A great place to stay if you like to live close to Kathmandu square. The hospitality is superb and the service was excellent. I was traveling alone but I felt like home with the friendly staff here.
Waren zum zweiten Mal hier. Ein sehr angenehmes kleines Hotel, dass viel Wert auf Sauberkeit, Hilfsbereitschaft und guten Service legt.

Small and cosy hotel situated in a rather quiet corner of Thamel. Large, nice and clean rooms, exceptionally friendly and helpful staff and very fair prices made us come back after 2019 and again we very much enjoyed our stay.

2024 Aralik ayinda burada 6 gece kaldik.Otel unlu thamel caddesine sadece bes dakika uzaklikta.Otelin calisanlari cok kibar ve yardimsever.Odalar tertemiz ve ihtiyaciniz olan her sey var odalarda .Sabah kahvaltisi hem Avrupa hem Asya mutfagi olarak hazirlaniyor.Kahvaltida her sey gunluk ve taze.Ayni zamanda otel size gideceginiz turlar konusunda da cok yardimci oluyor .Tekrar Katmandu'ya gelsem hic dusunmem tekrar kalirim .
Great quiet location around the corner from the highlights of Thamel neighborhood. Outstanding service and very comfortable rooms. Nice breakfast. We loved our stay here and would choose it again.

Well deserved 5 stars. I stayed here for a couple nights after trekking and it was such a warm welcoming experience. Staff are friendly and literally quick to respond to any and all needs. I asked for a room with sunlight since I might be spending a lot of time resting and got a room on the 4th floor with a gorgeous view of trees and skyline. The room itself was clean, great bed, great water pressure, all needs met. The staff arranged private car transport to the airport for less than other hotels had done for me, and when they realized there was something happening in town which might cause traffic to be worse, they called to let me know so we could leave earlier. Such attention to detail and caring about their guests. Also, there's a luggage scale to weigh which is incredibly helpful. Will stay again when I return to Thamel.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Kumari and it was an absolutely fantastic experience! From the moment I arrived, the staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive, making me feel right at home. The room was spacious, clean, and well-appointed, with a comfortable bed. The hotel's location was perfect--close to major attractions like Durbar Square and Thamel, yet tucked away enough to offer a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city.

I also appreciated the thoughtful touches, such as complimentary water, and the availability of travel assistance for tours and transportation.

We recently stayed at Kumari's and we couldn't be more pleased with our experience. From the moment we arrived, the staff were incredibly warm and polite, they offered us great recommendations for local things to do around. The location of the hotel is perfect and the breakfast was delicious, I looked forward to it every morning lol. Room service was excellent and they also offer laundry services. I would highly recommend it if you're visiting Kathmandu :)
Susses kleine Familiengefuhrtes Hotel, tolles Fruhstuck und sehr nette Menschen - absolut zu empfehlen!

Stayed in a suite for 3 nights. Positives were the location, WiFi and staff members. Negatives: Breakfast was not varied or good. 3 bulky chairs in room which made the suite more crowded than anything.

Amazing! The staff are phenomenal, they helped us purchase plane tickets to get us to pokhara, we had laundry done and the rooms are very nice and clean , it's at the end of the alley so you don't hear so much of the noise from thamal! Very nice hotel and I can't wait to come back!!

Et dejligt roligt og hyggeligt hotel lige uden for Thamels kaos. Det har lyse vaerelser og en dejlig stemning. Personalet er hjaelpsomme og meget venlige. Vi vendte tilbage til hotellet flere gange mellem vores udflugter ud af Kathmandu.

Totally well-deserved 5 stars! This hotel is safely and quietly tucked away in a small alley, walking distance to everything Thamel has to offer.

Very friendly and attentive reception and operational staff who make you feel like home. Manager is always around to supervise. Rooms are spot clean and well-designed for functional use.

Highly recommended for a short stay in Kathmandu!

We stayed there for 4 nights. Starting from checkin to checkout everything was super smooth. The location was perfect, in the thamel area but in a quiet lane. The hotel staffs, all of them, are always smiling and willing to help you to the maximum extent possible. We would like to return here everytime in Kathmandu. Food in hotel is decent. Hot water available at perfect temperature. The breakfast spread was adequate.

Stayed here first two nights in Kathmandu! Can't fault it! Super friendly staff , good service 
Super buzzing markets next door , and loads of nice places to eat. Walkable to Kathmandu square but very very busy buzzing streets as so close to the market. Nice experience before my gateway to Pokhara and trekking :) 
Didn't take many photos , sorry

Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Thamel! I wish we could've stayed more nights it was so lovely. It had the whole package of great value in terms of price, cleanliness, and staff kindness. It was tucked away in Thamel, so it was peaceful, and yet close to everything. Highly recommend!

This hotel is the best in the heart of the city. The breakfast was delicious, and the room service was excellent. The hotel manager is very polite and friendly, always ready to assist guests with anything they need.

My friend and I stayed in a double twin room. It was clean comfortable and had everything we needed. The staff were so polite and kind. They helped us with all our questions, arranged a private car for the day, and explained Nepali culture. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely go back.

Truly the best hotel I have stayed at in Kathmandu, and in terms of the service, it's the best hotel I've ever stayed at. The staff go exceedingly above and beyond to accommodate, and are extraordinarily polite, gracious, and friendly in their demeanor and treatment. The rooms were cleaned frequently and throughly; the bed was so comfortable, the windows huge and the curtains black-out, greatly enhancing the quality of our sleep. The shower water had intense pressure and could run so hot it steamed the bathroom up in just a short time, while the AC blew frigid cold if we needed it too. The room service food was excellent, with a wide variety, and the included breakfast was both tasty and healthy! But again, it was the staff that made this place amazing. Just as a specific example: One gentleman here brought a heavy piece of luggage all the way down the road to where my parents were staying! That's a favor that was neither for his guest, nor his hotel, that was just him being an upstanding and hospitable person! They have hired the right people here and we are grateful! We will most certainly be back!

I only stayed here one night but we had a wonderful dinner, excellent service (so friendly!), and had our breakfast packed kindly for an early flight. The room was really clean and tidy, with all the amenities. Would certainly recommend if in Kathmandu.
Courteous staff
nice service, great view

This hotel is very comfortable with amazing staff. The rooms are well climate controlled, comfy beds, nice showers. The restaurant has delicious food at good prices. And the staff are so kind and helpful you feel like you're a treasured guest the whole time. The location at the edge of Thamel means there a little noise still, but much less than in the heart of the Thamel, and minimal street sellers. Yet it's still an easy walk to the Thamel attractions and reasonable enough for taxis to pick up and drop off for further distances. The area is clean and green, a great front porch to relax on with masala tea after a day of exploring. Highly recommend!

I truly enjoyed my stay here. I booked this room to decompress after my 50+ hour trip from the States to Kathmandu before making my way to Dhulikhel. The airport transfer that I arranged with the hotel was a breeze. It's at the very end of the street which can appear a bit scary when walking alone at night but the place itself was beautiful. Breakfast is included and the food was delicious. The room looked better in the pictures but it was still cute and cozy. The staff were friendly and helpful! Would highly recommend staying here.

We had a wonderful stay at Kumari! Our room was very clean and updated with modern amenities and the breakfast (included) was DELICIOUS. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and the location was excellent as it was quiet at night while also close (within walking distance) to Darbur Square and the royal palace (both highly recommended). It is also across from a coffee shop with really good coffee! Kumari Hotel is a small, very sweet place to stay and I can't recommend it highly enough.

Stay at Thamel Eco Resort was satisfactory. Rooms were comfortable. All staff were very welcoming and special thanks to Pradeep. The location was ideal for exploring the near by sightseeing, shops and restaurants, making it easy to get around. I would recommend this property to anyone looking for convenient and comfortable stay in Kathmandu (Thamel).

I booked a deluxe room for one night on New Year's Eve through Agoda. When we arrived at around 7 PM, the staff (possibly the owner) at the reception informed us that the hotel was fully booked.

He offered us a room in a nearby hotel they also managed, claiming it was of the same quality. However, the other hotel was clearly lower in quality, and the room was much smaller. Later, he proposed a reduced price for this inferior room, but after being misled, we no longer felt comfortable staying there.

We requested a refund, but he insisted he couldn't process it until the next morning. Despite having access to our booking details via the email from Agoda, he didn't seem to check the transaction on his side. He never apologized and even said we were the problem. After 30-40 minutes of discussion, he finally refunded our money in cash, though it was done reluctantly.

Der Standard meines Zimmers entsprach 0 Sternen. Kein Tropfen heisses oder warmes Wasser zum Duschen,  Bettwasche wurde nach dem letzten Gast nicht gewechselt, Haare und Flecken im Bett, Zimmertur zum Innenhof nicht sicher zu verriegeln, unangenehmer Geruch im Zimmer, kein Licht/Lichtschalter am Bett, sehr hellhorig. Dies alles entspricht nicht einem 3 Sterne Hotel in Kathmandu. Respektlos einem Gast ein solches Zimmer fur nicht wenig Geld zu geben obwohl es auch bessere (freie)
Zimmer im Haus gegeben hatte. Allerdings wurden ich darum betrogen. Keine Einsicht, keine Entschuldigung und kein Entgegenkommen von Seiten des Chefs. Auch meine nepalesische Trekkingagentur wurde sehr abweisend behandelt. Schade !
Kathmandu, November 2024

The room had the smell of alcohol and cigarettes. The breakfast suitable for US tourist, but they made also paratha on request for us. We got cheated in paying more for the room.

The resort is hidden behind the main street (a bit hard to find - you guys need a new sign!) I hardly feel like I'm in Kathmandu as I write this review -

Convenient shopping for gifts and necessities right outside the door.  I'm now looking for an opportunity to return - maybe become a live-in resident for a while!  Great place!

5-Star Experience at Alobar 1000 Hostel - Thamel

I had an amazing stay at Alobar 1000 Hostel in Thamel, Kathmandu, and would 100% recommend it to any traveler looking for a budget-friendly yet comfortable place with a great vibe!

From check-in to check-out, everything was perfectly on point. The staff is super friendly, helpful, and always smiling. They make you feel welcomed the moment you step in. The atmosphere here is warm, social, and filled with positive energy -- perfect for solo travelers, backpackers, or even groups.

 Clean rooms and bathrooms, hygienically maintained.
 Comfortable beds with clean linens.
 Common areas are vibrant -- perfect for relaxing, working, or meeting fellow travelers.
 The rooftop restaurant offers great food at reasonable prices with a chill ambiance and stunning views.
 Wi-Fi is strong and consistent, which is a big plus for remote workers.
 Location is prime -- right in Thamel, yet peaceful enough to enjoy a good night's sleep.

Only one minor issue -- the room had just a fan, which wasn't enough during the hotter parts of the day. A ceiling fan or better ventilation would make the room experience perfect. But honestly, with everything else being so well-managed, this was hardly a dealbreaker.

Overall, Alobar 1000 offers more than just a stay -- it offers an experience. Great people, perfect location, good food, and clean spaces. I'm truly grateful for the hospitality and the memories made here.
Ajaya was absolutely good in hosting

An Unforgettable Stay at Alobar1000 
Staying at Alobar100 was one of the most heartwarming and enriching experiences of my trip. The hostel has a relaxed, welcoming vibe that instantly makes you feel at home. It's more than just a place to sleep -- it's a community.

What truly sets Alobar100 apart are the people who run it. Every single staff member was kind, approachable, and genuinely caring. A special shoutout goes to Ajaya and Aasish -- two incredible souls who went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and memorable. Their warmth and hospitality reflect the very spirit of Alobar100.

If you're looking for a place with good energy, helpful people, and a peaceful yet social atmosphere, Alobar100 is the perfect spot. Highly recommended, and I can't wait to return.

Alobar1000 hostel was my first hostel experience and it was amazing. Those who know Kathmandu know that it is usually dusty but in Alobar they cleaned everywhere every day. The rooms, common areas, toilets were spotless. Everyone who worked there was very kind, smiling and helpful. Especially Ajaya and I are still in contact as friends. The cuisine is extremely delicious and we brought Turkish coffee from Turkiye and they even let us cook it. The memories I shared there and the friendships I made are unforgettable. Thank you very much for opening such a place. I feel very lucky to be with you there. I will definitely come again  It is a wonderful experience to have such different cultures and to be able to meet at the same point and see the valuable sharing of souls.

What an amazing hostel. Clean, well-run and super easy to book tours through. good value for money, and so easy to meet others. The staff are really friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is a nice touch and special thanks to one staff member, Ajay, a very kind person.

Plus there's free lockers to lock your gear, there's many hangout spots, cheap alcohol for a quick pre game before hitting the town, and great location in Thamel. I would stay here again!

Home away from home! 

Every time I land in Nepal, I don't check for any options, I just show up at Alobar 1000.

No booking stress, no second thoughts, because I know Alobar will always have space for me. It's not just a hostel; it's my hostel.

And it's not just about a bed or a room--it's the people.

The entire team, from the front desk to the cleaning staff to the security guard, treat me like a brother, not a guest.

The warmth, the laughs, the little moments - this place is family, and I feel it every single day I'm here.

And speaking of family, they literally include me in their celebrations, whether it's a festival, a random rooftop gathering, or just one of those spontaneous moments that makes travel unforgettable.

Alobar isn't just a place to stay. It's a feeling. A chaotic, loving, welcoming hug disguised as a hostel.

So if you're reading this and planning to visit Nepal, don't even think twice. Just come to Alobar 1000.

Experience the warmth, the people, and the magic that makes this place unforgettable.

I'll be back next year. For longer. Again.
Because some places aren't just places, they're home!
good price,good enviroment in kathmandu

One of the best hostels in Thamel! The place is exceptionally clean, with the staff cleaning the rooms, bathrooms, and toilets twice a day. The ambiance is very pleasant and quiet, making it a perfect spot to relax. It's the only hostel in Thamel with a swimming pool, though I didn't get a chance to jump in. The staff are amazing--especially the three ladies at the front desk, the night watchman, and the cocktail maker (sorry, I forgot your names!).

Overall, I'd give it an 8/10. A small suggestion for the Alobar 1000 management: consider introducing some games or evening activities in the dining area, as you have a great space that could be used to bring guests together.

Zostel is a great hostel located in the heart of Kathmandu. It's a great place to stay if you're looking for a budget-friendly option that's still clean and comfortable. The hostel has a variety of room types to choose from, including dorms and private rooms. The dorms are spacious and well-lit, and the private rooms are clean and cozy. The hostel also has a common area with a kitchen, a TV, and a games room. There's also a rooftop terrace with stunning views of the city.

The staff at Zostel are friendly and helpful. They're always happy to answer any questions you have and help you plan your trip. The hostel also offers a variety of free activities, such as yoga room on the roof.

Overall, Zostel is a great place to stay if you're looking for a budget-friendly and friendly hostel in Kathmandu.

Here are some pros and cons of Zostel Kathmandu:

Pros:

-Clean and comfortable rooms
-Friendly and helpful staff
-Free activities
-Great location

Cons:

-Can be noisy at times (neighbours)
-Some rooms are small
-No elevator

Overall, I would definitely recommend Zostel Kathmandu to anyone looking for a budget-friendly and friendly hostel in Kathmandu.

A 4-star hotel located in Thamel area of Kathmandu and is 15 mins away from Tribhuvan International Airport. It is one of the grandeur collosal hotel in Kathmandu. A welcome drink was giver before check-in. The lobby and reception desk is a bit spacious. There is a bar and above it is a portrait of the former Nepalese royal family. The rooms are small having basic amenities live TV, bathroom, double bed etc. The corridor is narrow. It has an outdoor pool, spa, conference room, travel desk, a dining area, an elevator, free WiFi etc. It also has a small fountain and a small parking space. The hotel service was good. Many local as well as foreign tourists stay at this hotel. Overall, had a pleasant and a relaxed stay at this hotel.

I've never felt so unsafe before in a hotel, and I've stayed in some one-star guesthouses and hostels and those are even better than this. At 8am in the morning, on my bed, I could hear someone with card trying to enter my room and they tried few times and even tried to push the door. As a female traveler, I always double lock my door. After 5 minutes, I went to check through the hole, and there was a man and a housekeeping lady. I opened the door and asked what's wrong. The man was just laughing nervously and said it's a mistake. I went down to the reception and the lady told me there was a misunderstanding and they thought that was a room that has checked out so they wanted to clean it. I could understand the "mistake" but surely the housekeeping team can double check with the supervisor when they realize that the door is locked from inside, instead of trying to forcefully open the door (at 8am) with the help of another man. Imagine if I haven't double locked the door, things could have gone worse. Safety has always been my main priority, and this hotel definitely doesn't seem to prioritize that. Plus, this is an old hotel, from the lift, bathroom, and towels. With the same amount of money, you could've done yourself a good favour and stayed somewhere better and safer than this hotel.

The worst hotel. We came back from a long trek only to find lukewarm water for a shower. The front desk personnel knew very well about lukewarm water and showed no emotions to our complaint.

Also, the air conditioner is set to show 23 degrees, but it is running as a slow fan only. None of the compressors in any of the rooms is functional. Try opening the window and listening to the compressor sound from any of the rooms. There is none.

The bathroom cleanliness is subpar. Overall a very bad hotel to stay.

Very old hotel, incompetent staff. Nothing works here, whether it's the door keys, phones, tv, flush doesn't work. Everything's old and smelly, roaches in rooms, nasty bathrooms. Breakfast is a joke. Only plus point is great location. Avoid!!

I stayed a total of 14 nights at this hotel and I'm really impressed with the service I received. Every morning when I went down for the buffet breakfast, which offered a variety of options, I'd be greeted with smiles by the kitchen staff. They really saw to my every need each morning. I like tea made a certain way and they made it each morning.  The management was also very friendly and attentive. I got a little sick, as many travellers to this country do, and they helped me find a remedy. My flight home was later in the evening and I got an extra late checkout upon asking. All in all, it really was the staff as a whole that made my stay memorable and I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Nepal.

We went in a group of 12 recently and 10 of them were senior citizens, everyone was amazed with the services of the hotel. The staff and the whole management was A-one. Everything was top notch. Each and every staff member were chivalrous and very respectful as well as responsive. We were provided with beautiful rooms with the pool view. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a lot of variety and on request demands were also accepted. Everything on their menu was delicious. Even the location of the hotel was very good. Everything was accessible within 200-300 meters and even some big shot places like lord of drinks was at walking distance. All 12 of us were extremely happy and satisfied with their services and we will definitely visit again. The nanee is basically a community based hotel which is opened in order to make the guest experience the newari  culture how the newari people of bhaktapur live their daily life .

Simply loved this place:

- good food
- extremely courteous staff : both the servers were very hospitable, polite and made our experience a delight
- the place was clean : spic and span: tables, cutlery, dishes, overall restaurant everything clean!
- vibe : the place has a very soothing and peaceful vibe : very zen!

Community at The Nanee is one of the youngest hotel and restaurants on the way at the narrow alley of Bhaktapur Durbar Square. It is amazingly constructed bearing in mind about the Vastu Bigyan. The art and architecture has been creatively designed by Renowned Mr Manish Lal Shrestha Ji. The local food is so satisfying and the international cuisine has maintained its standard. The staffs are welcoming wit smile and namaste. The kitchen is clean. The rooms are designed according to price and and has maintained its standard. Amenities in the rooms are nature friendly
This cozy, aesthetic spot is a peaceful retreat with authentic, flavorful food. The staff is warm and welcoming, making you feel right at home. Perfect for a relaxing meal!

We had our lunch here when walking around in Bhaktapur. The ambience, food quality and taste, service and staff - all is very good. Tried Nepali Thali Set (Veg) - all items were tasty, the best was yogurt.

Great place for a fancy lunch or dinner. We tried the traditional set and it was delicious. It is more expensive that most restaurants (we paid ~2,000 for two) but the place really worths it!
We had a wonderful experience there earlier this evening. Such a charming and attentive waiter and the food was excellent.

You made a mistake by giving me chicken instead of fish in the Nepali rice set.

I don't eat chicken. So it's okay if you replace it but i then realized none of you knew whether it was chicken or fish that you were delivering. So I asked for paneer in replacement of the fish just to be safe... then the disaster began...

You told me there was no paneer. But minutes later, it turned out that there was paneer and you came back and said it would result in an extra charge. Indeed, the paneer set would be 100NPR more. So I expected to pay 100 NPR more. And then came the worst moment -- You ended up requesting 250NPR more for the additional paneer dish. Mind you -- I didn't touch the chicken and you took it back!

It's not a lot of money, but it was your mistake! And you were asking me for more money for your mistake???? What kind of restaurant is this? Your ruin your own business.

*to respond to your reply:
1 I asked for the manager;
2 it's not that I didn't like the fish. I didn't even know if you were serving me fish. Neither did your waiters - they couldn't tell. I had a bite and It tasted awful (I eat fish almost everyday). Because I can't eat chicken and you could not confirm, I asked for paneer as a replacement. To me it was your mistake and you should have corrected it instead of imposing additional costs on me - no matter how little.
3. Yes 250NPR was nothing at all. It's the way your team managed the problem.

I recently visited Biryani Adda and tried their Chicken Dum Matka Biryani - and I must say, it was absolutely top-notch. The biryani was served in a traditional matka (clay pot), which not only enhanced the aroma but also kept the dish warm for a long time. Each spoonful had the perfect balance of spices, tender chicken, and fluffy, fragrant rice. The flavors were rich yet well-balanced, without being overly oily or heavy.

The portion size was generous, easily satisfying for a hearty appetite, and the presentation added to the overall experience. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring we were comfortable throughout our meal.

Another plus point is free parking, which is a big convenience in busy areas and makes the visit much smoother. The ambiance is casual yet pleasant, making it a great spot for both family dinners and casual meetups with friends.

I visited the Garden of Dreams with my friends for a college assignment, but unfortunately, our experience was very disappointing.

After purchasing our tickets and entering, we were excited to explore the garden and take some photos for our assignment. However, one of my friends was simply trying to change her shoes when the security guard rudely stopped her, saying we couldn't change "anything" inside--not even shoes. We even tried to convince that she'll change it outside and will return back but he rudely said "No you can't come back again". On top of that, we were also told we couldn't take photos, which didn't make sense since we saw other visitors freely taking pictures and videos.

The behavior of the security staff felt unnecessarily harsh and disrespectful. To make things worse, even the counter staff treated us poorly, giving side-eyes and acting rude for no reason. Because of this treatment, we were so upset that we decided to leave.

This experience completely ruined our impression of the Garden of Dreams. A place that is supposed to be welcoming and enjoyable instead felt uninviting and unpleasant. I would never recommend it to anyone, and I will definitely be sharing this negative experience with others.

The Garden of Dreams is truly a peaceful oasis in the middle of Kathmandu's hustle and bustle. The moment you step inside, the chaos of the city fades away and you are welcomed by calm pathways, beautiful fountains, and stunning architecture that carries a unique historical charm. The atmosphere is perfect for relaxing with friends, reading a book, or simply enjoying some quiet moments surrounded by nature. It is also a wonderful spot for photography, with its well-designed pavilions and scenic backdrops.
The cafe inside adds to the experience, offering a cozy place to sit down with a coffee or light meal while soaking in the serene environment. It feels like stepping back in time, with a touch of elegance and grace that makes you want to linger longer than planned.
The only thing that could make the experience even better would be more consistent maintenance of the garden areas. A few sections seem slightly neglected, and with just a bit more care, the place could shine even brighter.
Overall, it remains one of the best places in the city to escape the noise and enjoy tranquility--a true hidden gem worth visiting.

I visited Whoopee Land recently with high expectations, but unfortunately, the experience was far from enjoyable. The park was extremely crowded making it difficult to enjoy any of the rides or pools. Waiting times were long, and there was barely any space to relax or move around without bumping into people.

The biggest concern, however, was the **poor water quality**. Several pools looked murky and unclean, with an odd smell in some areas. It didn't feel hygienic or safe, especially for kids. Cleanliness should be a top priority in any water park, and sadly, Whoopee Land seems to fall short in this area.

Facilities like changing rooms and restrooms were also not well maintained. With the number of visitors, it felt like the staff were overwhelmed or not prepared to handle the crowd.

This place could have potential if they improved crowd management and significantly upgraded their hygiene standards. But as of now, I wouldn't recommend it unless major improvements are made.

Visited Whoopee Land recently after several years, and honestly, it was quite underwhelming. No new rides or slides have been added in the past 5-6 years, which makes the park feel outdated and repetitive.

The Jurassic Park section is in terrible condition -- most of the dinosaur props are damaged or broken, and it's clear that there has been no proper maintenance for a long time.

The food prices inside are extremely high, and the quality doesn't match the cost. On top of that, the park often gets very crowded with school trips, which makes the queues for rides and slides unbearably long.

With the high ticket price, you'd expect better upkeep and at least some new attractions. Unfortunately, it seems like the park hasn't evolved at all. Definitely not worth visiting if you've already been in the past.

We recently celebrated our post-wedding reception at Alice Reception, and we couldn't have asked for a more beautiful experience. From the moment we stepped in, we were welcomed with warmth, professionalism, and care that truly went beyond our expectations.

The venue itself was exceptionally comfortable and aesthetically pleasing--every corner felt thoughtfully designed to create a cozy yet elegant atmosphere for us and our guests. The entire team at Alice was incredibly courteous and attentive, making sure everything ran smoothly and that we felt relaxed throughout the celebration.

What truly touched our hearts was their thoughtful gesture. They surprised us with a personalized gift--a beautifully printed photo of us as a couple on a plate--and a generous gift voucher. It was an emotional and unexpected moment that made us feel truly seen and celebrated, not just as clients, but as a couple beginning a new chapter.

We're deeply grateful to Alice Reception for making our special day even more memorable. Their exceptional service, beautiful space, and heartfelt hospitality made it a perfect venue for our celebration. Highly, highly recommend for anyone planning a wedding, reception, or any special event.

With love and gratitude,
Sushma & Nimish

The food was of excellent quality, the facility was exceptionally clean, and the event was well-organized from start to finish. The staff demonstrated a high level of professionalism and were extremely helpful and attentive throughout the evening. I would highly recommend this reception hall for any special event.
