Staying at The Nanee feels like stepping back in time. The moment you step out, you are transported into centuries of rich history and heritage. The staff are extremely courteous, the rooms are comfortable, and the food is excellent. A perfect blend of old-world charm and modern comfort. Highly recommended.

Bhaktapur has centuries of art and genius and the Nanee reflects all the deep magic of Nepal, what a beautiful building filled with incredible art. What a wonderful restaurant and bar with the finest of foods. Location is ideal, the staff are pure heart. This is Nepal alive and thriving on the top of the world!
Everything was amazing. From the arrival to the departure. Thanks a lot again

We recommend this wonderful restaurant as it is a very peaceful and lovely place. It will serve you not just high quality food yet so much more. The atmosphere is unique and The waitstaff Akash, Manjila, Mr jack are all wonderfully sweet and personable. They will love to serve you and  give you an amazing experience. We recommend the pumpkin soup which is rich and fully balanced, which comes with fresh homemade bread.  We also really enjoyed Nanee style noodle soup that comes with wonderful mushrooms on top.  The chef and the kitchen staff are providing beautifully curated meals that are clean and delicious. We highly recommend you come & enjoy  for yourselves.
Tell them you heard about it from Rockstar and Echo

It is premium property in Bhaktapur durbar square. The food quality, presentation and service matches the fine dining experience. It was a surprise to see such a professional hospitality services in Bhaktapur.

What an amazing find - a friend recommended this hotel as a great base to explore Bhaktapur and we weren't disappointed! This small boutique hotel is tucked away in a courtyard very close to Bhaktapur Durbar Square (no more than 5 mins away) and we had a wonderful 2-night stay. The staff are outstanding and always responsive to any questions that you have.

While you can just spend your time enjoying the unique architecture of the hotel based on Vaastu Shastra principles (similar to Feng shui), I recommend that you consider any of the cultural experiences that the hotel provides. We thoroughly enjoyed the walking tour and the 6-course  contemporary Newari menu. All the other food in the restaurant is also delicious.

The rooms are arranged around the courtyard and quite compact given the overall footprint of the hotel. Our group stayed in a standard, Prithvi and a Nepali suite and I would say that the Prithvi room was the best overall in terms of space and amenities.

Thank you to Aditya-ji and the rest of his team for a memorable stay!

Cozy place in the middle of the city. Our host advised us to just lose our way and immerse ourselves in experiencing the narrow alleys of the old town. We simply loved our stay. They were kind enough to arrange for us some vegetarian options for breakfast and you will definitely enjoy some of the cute little surprises they've in store for you. Also the artwork and detailing at property is incredibly beautifully done and they've done a great job at connecting themselves with the community that the property is part of.

Had an amazing stay at The Nanee (06APR - 08APR)!  Excellent customer service the moment I checked into my Loft Room.  Very well designed property and room.  Enjoyed the lookout view from my private balcony.  Well layout bathroom.  Enjoyed the Morning Walk, Evening Walking Tour, local artisan home visit and great introduction to the Newari traditional breakfast.  Thank you so much to Ajay and Shailaja (the gracious owners), Aditya (the General Manager), Roshna (Receptionist), Kumar (F & B staff member) and the rest of the wonderful team at The Nanee! Your passion, dedication and commitment shows.  You showed me your lovely city making it so memorable for many years to come!
Just went for lunch there, good food, good service
Beautiful design, clean hotel, well decorated and the food was so good. I recommend it !

Enjoyed the lunch with family. They have creative food items blending the Newari culture.
Yummy.

L equipe est vraiment geniale, professionnelle et gentille avec une spontaneite. La cuisine est d'un niveau international. Le decor est soigne. Nous y reviendrons. Mention speciale pour le cocktail maison.

Outstanding hotel, extremely friendly staff, very clean, beautiful rooms, great design, the food was also great. It was the only hotel on our 2 weeks long trip through nepal that had proper bread for breakfast. We also had dinner in the hotel restaurant and we can safely say it was the best dinner we had in whole nepal. Very clean kitchen as well - you can watch the chefs through a large window. Location couldn't be better, roof top terrace was also nice

If there is one thing I would change it's just that I would have loved to have some vegan milk alternatives for the coffee in the morning eg oat milk - but as you can see from this suggestion, literally everything else was a 5/5.

A unique design, friendly service in the heart of Bhaktapur. Beds are very comfortable. Many experiences available during the stay.
I recommend to spend 3 nights to grab the essence of the Newari culture.
It was perfect.beautiful, modern room with everything you need. Lovely bed nice shower looks exactly like the pictures . Staff supervisor nice helpful. Nice restaurant with delicious food

My stay at The Nanee hotel was amazing! I stayed in the Nepali room and it was very luxurious as well as comfortable. The food at The Nanee restaurant was delicious and very professionally prepared. Loved the beautiful architecture and atmosphere, will definitely come back again!
Beautiful modern rooms but with a Newari touch and great service. Staff are kind and helpful.
Beautiful property.. staying there is an experience itself

Fantastic boutique hotel with excellent amenities, helpful staff, and delicious food. We had many moments of delight throughout the entire experience, from the warm welcome ceremony to the personalized hand-written card, as well as the thoughtfully provided in-room snacks and games. Everything felt authentic and carefully crafted to enhance our stay.

We flew to Nepal for the first time.
When we were driving from Kathmandu airport, we looked at the city around and did not expect to get such an incredible hotel! 
The hotel is hidden among buildings on a narrow street, which is not accessible by car. And this is a pleasant surprise
You walk into a fairy tale. The interior has a chic design, everything is in a modern style, very organic and clean.
The staff is very polite and friendly, taking care of the guests. 
We didn't meet any other tourists inside except the two of us.
The hotel restaurant is very good, tasty and warm. Lots of food and drink menu options.
When you enter the hotel from the street it's like a small paradise. Quiet, clean, very warm welcome. The rooms are wonderful, the food excellent.

My husband had stayed here on a previous trip and brought me here on our next stay in Kathmandu. The gardens are lovely! Our room is clean, comfortable and decorated. The tv actually works, which is so rare in Nepal! Breakfast is adequate. Staff is friendly and professional. The rooms that overlook the garden are quieter.
Good

A very good hotel at a very good price 
The rooms are a good size, the bed was very comfortable and the hotel is very clean.
We arrived early and they were very accommodating to us.
You can store luggage securely when you're away trekking.
In such a busy area, you don't hear the outside noise, which is a bonus.

Un havre de paix dans le quartier de Thamel, un jardin plein de recoins plus charmants les uns que les autres. Ne pas rater l'arriere du jardin qui offre des transats a l'abri des regards, sauf celui de Bouddha protecteur.
Les serveurs sont charmants, accueillants et tres arrangeants
Tres bien situe dans Katmandou, personnel sympathique, a recommander pour un court sejour, 2 ou 3 jours.
Good selection of continent breakfast, has free wifi and hot shower. We love the Nepali decorations.
Very good service and friendly environment. A beautiful place and kind people
Semplice hotel nel cuore di Thamel, ma con un giardino interno che permette di stare fuori, protetti dallo smog di Katmandu.

International Guest House is a well priced hotel centrally located in the main tourist district, but on a quieter street. It has a lovely garden courtyard where you can relax and enjoy the nice breakfast buffet that is included with your stay; when we stayed, the citrus trees blooming gave off an incredible scent! The staff are very friendly and attentive. We stayed in three different rooms during our stops in Kathmandu: the "deluxe" rooms are worth the extra 10-15 usd a night as they have air conditioning and are a bit bigger. Like many place in Nepal, hot water is provided by solar heaters, so you may not get a hot shower first thing in the morning. Wait until the afternoon to guarantee hot water!

All and all, we would gladly stay here again!

Das International Guest House in Kathmandu ist ein echtes Juwel im Herzen von Thamel. Das historische Gebaude strahlt einen ganz besonderen Charme aus und bietet eine wunderbare Mischung aus traditioneller Architektur und freundlichen Servie. Besonders beeindruckend ist der grune Innengarten, der eine ruhige Oase der Erholung mitten im lebhaften Trubel von Thamel bildet - ein perfekter Ort, um nach einem Tag voller Erkundungen zur Ruhe zu kommen. Die angeschlossene Backerei ist ein weiteres Highlight: Frische, kostliche Backwaren und leckere Kaffeespezialitaten laden zum Verweilen ein. Die Atmosphare ist warm und einladend, das Personal freundlich und aufmerksam. Ein absolut empfehlenswerter Aufenthalt fur alle, die Authentizitat und Komfort in perfekter Harmonie suchen.

Kind generous and accommodating staff. A wide variety of room options. Excellent location. Quiet enclosed garden.

The grounds are very nice but that's where it ends. The rooms are overpriced and the beds are very uncomfortable - you'll feel springs in your back. They have a Cafe attached that is a chain smokers delight. The smoke fills all the areas - the last thing one needs after breathing yak pancake smoke in the Himalayas
Beautiful typically traditional guesthouse in Thamel with beautiful garden to enjoy !

Emplacement central en plein milieu du quartier de Thamel avec de nombreux magasins et restaurants a proximite.
L'hotel possede un jardin et une cours interieure avec des tables ou vous pourrez passer un moment au calme, a l'abri de l'agitation de la rue.
Les chambres ne sont pas tres grandes mais c'est suffisant. Elles sont dotees d'un bureau. La salle de bain est simple, avec de l'eau chaude ! Ce qui vous fera le plus grand bien si vous revenez d'un trek.
Le petit dejeuner en buffet est assez varie, vous devriez trouver votre bonheur.
Vous pouvez demander a la reception de conserver vos bagages ou de vous commander un taxi, ils sont serviables.

Very friendly and helpful receptionists.
Central location in Thamel. Easy access.

The breakfast menu is every day, the same.
The waitress of the restaurant was very rude and treated us poorly was disappointed with the service and the treatment of the staff
Restaurant authentique dans le centre de thamel et le confort
Very fun cool looking very cool

Unserer Meinung nach das beste Hotel der Stadt, superfreundliches und hilfsbereites Personal, die Zimmer sehr ordentlich, sauber, geraumig und mit dem wichtigen Dingen, wie Steckdosen, WC-Papier, Sitz-Toilette, warmer Dusche, Spiegel, Handtucher, Seife usw. ausgestattet sind. Die Lage in Thamel ist ausgezeichnet und es ist verhaltnismassig ruhig. Erst recht, wenn man ein Zimmer auf den super gepflegten Garten im Innenbereich erwischt. Wir sind praktisch zum 4.Mal hier und jedesmal bestens aufgehoben. Danke an das Team von Jens+Mary.

nice place at the edge of Thamel, quiet with spacious amenities like gardens and patios, as a shop in shop is a little family run cafe with good coffee and homemade cakes and pastries, very close to plenty of outdoor shops and upper level cafes, would stay there again
Great location, friendly staff and clean rooms and toilets. The palce is VERY QUIET and it's right in the center of Thamel. Prices are fine. Breakfast (included) is small but good.

An okay hotel located just on the side of Thamel, a good location for quite area of Kathmandu, however the facilities lack, for the price you pay it is okay, but what was advertised on the website was incorrect when we were at the room, the room was okay had all the basics part from shower products, no AC, just a fan, beds were uncomfortable.
Rooms were good. Atmosphere and place was good. If you love art and old style that is the place to stay

What a great ambiance! It's tucked away from the hustle of Thamel, with bhodi trees, and Buddha statue motifs carved into mahogany wood walls. It feels like you're entering a warm, dark Newari temple. Very Indiana Jones, almost romantic. The dining area opens to a stone courtyard with "artifact"-like vases and stone bhudda statues collecting dust on wooden shelves, connecting to an open cafe with terra-cotta tiled floors. A light jazz is playing there and you can relax w a book, while the monsoon rains drip off the tiled roofs.

Rooms are clean, firm beds, good water pressure and temp, flush toilet w TP. Doors/locks are sturdy. I've only had chicken curry for dinner, but it was excellent and I thought it was well-priced. Breakfast is included and is buffet style w yogurt, fruits, cereals, boiled eggs or omelette, toast, tea and instant coffee.

Front desk staff are service oriented and namaste me every time I walk by. Fast wifi, but the power goes out occasionally (street level problem), and  it takes a minute for wifi to come back up. The only other slight downside is you have to cross a fairly busy street w mopeds and taxis to get into Thamel proper. But you'll be dodging mopeds everywhere in Thamel.

I would 100% stay here again if I came back to Kathmandu.
Great location . Very nice environment

Having enjoyed many stays here over the years the IGH remains my go-to place to stay in Thamel. Recently updated (was overdue) the hotel retains its crown as a peaceful oasis of calm and aesthetic beauty within north Thamel. The gardens and seating areas are most excellent and feature a vast museum collection of Nepali cultural items and, in particular, architectural pieces including many that have been incorporated into the hotel itself. Rooms on five floors provide en suite facilities and are maintained to a high standard on a daily basis. Included buffet style breakfast.. with cooked options available, has been recently updated and extended to provide a high quality western style selection.
The long established staff and facilities reflect a high standard of care for their guests. Prices are mid-range and cater for the more discriminating guests including NGO workers that value the peaceful, maybe less tourist centred, atmosphere.
All credit to the owner and staff for maintaining this excellent establishment.
Le jardin est tres agreable.

Bel edifice mais chambres vetustes.

10th visit. Chill place in Thamel.

Pretty amazing experience we had, their in-house cafe is a bonus, one drawback is Internate Coverage which can be improvised, apart from that they are always accomodative, flexible, friendly
A place of relaxation and quiet in the middle of busy Thamel. I liked it a lot!

Nothing so special, it's good if you wanna use this place only to sleep. Area is enough quite and close to everything. Breakfast is ok. However,  for that price I think you can get something better in Katmandu

The hotel is worthy for its quite central position and the really beautiful and characteristics common area. The rooms, on the other side, are a bit old and the bathroom really needs a renovation. We didn't take the basic room and the space was still barely ok, so my guess is that basic rooms would be really small for a couple. Breakfast was not having big selection but fruit was fresh and omlete quite good so no complains there for the price point. The personel was kind and helpful so this is another plus. So I feel to suggest it for the position and the really amazing common areas (and also the price that was quite a bargain) but if instead you are searching for recently refreshed rooms with amenities, I suggest you to look elsewhere. If you have a bit of adaptation it can be an amazing experience.

We spent 3 nights here and loved so much the environment. From the crowded street you step into a peaceful place with a smiling staff. Clean rooms, hot shower (which is precious ), good food. Perfect!

Rudest Owners and Hotel staff I have ever encountered. I went there to check out the hotel after looking at the good reviews on TripAdvisor. Interacted with the front desk who was very decent and then went on to scout the garden and architecture. I happen to wander into an empty hotel building. Soon after, without any warning, I was greeted with hostility for "walking without permission" and looked at with suspicion. Guards and hotel staff surrounded me and were very rude. I thought talking to the manager/owner would help me sort this out calmly. Neither did he try to assess the situation fairly, nor did he even listen. I wonder if they would have the same reaction to a foreigner or was it me being Nepali that warranted this disrespect? Disheartened by the blatant racism inside my own country, by my own people, at such a decent establishment.
My clients who came for a trek in nepal stayed here for a weeks and they loved the Service , Rooms and Ambience  .
Amazing space in such crowded area with really amazing newari style architecture and elements. They do have collection of bonsai in there garden. The carrot cake is really good in this place.

My favorite hotel in Katmandu, away from the mad city traffic. Peaceful place with a lovely garden & beautiful wooden architecture. Room are comfy and breakfast is nice. Good food too, if you want to eat your dinner there. And the staff are really friendly and helpful.

They are very fast, and I received my package safe and sound. It was a fragile item, particularly my laptop, but I noticed they carried my laptop personally while other items were in the cart. Highly recommended! They were open until 8 PM, which is a plus since Buddha Airlines flights serve until 9 PM. Another great is that I was late, so I chose to leave the package at the counter. None of the other airlines' cargo services agreed keep my package there and dispatch it the next morning, but Buddha Airlines staff were so generous that they agreed to keep my package safely and deliver it the next morning.

Rising majestically from a bustling circular road in Kathmandu, the Boudhanath Stupa is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the most significant center of Tibetan Buddhism outside of Tibet. Its colossal white dome, one of the largest spherical stupas in Nepal, is a powerful symbol of the Buddhist cosmos, a vast mandala that draws pilgrims and tourists into its orbit. The stupa is believed to have been built in the 5th century and has served for centuries as a vital hub for trade and cultural exchange between Nepal and Tibet.
The architecture of the stupa is deeply symbolic. The immense white dome represents the element of water, while the square harmika above it, adorned with the iconic pair of Buddha's all-seeing eyes, symbolizes earth. A nose-like figure between the eyes is the Nepali number one, signifying unity, and above that, 13 golden steps represent the 13 stages a soul must pass through to achieve enlightenment. The pinnacle, a golden spire, represents the element of fire and the ultimate state of Buddhahood. Colorful prayer flags, fluttering from the top of the stupa, carry mantras and prayers on the wind, spreading positive energy and blessings throughout the valley.
The atmosphere at Boudhanath is one of active devotion. From early morning until late evening, a constant stream of devotees, many of them Tibetan refugees who have made this area their home, circumambulate the stupa clockwise, spinning the prayer wheels and reciting mantras. The air is filled with the scent of juniper incense and the soft hum of chants. The area around the stupa has evolved into a vibrant cultural hub, with countless monasteries, guesthouses, cafes, and shops selling Tibetan handicrafts, thangka paintings, and ritual objects. A visit to Boudhanath is not merely a spiritual pilgrimage but a total immersion into the sights, sounds, and traditions of a living and thriving Buddhist culture.

"Boudhanath Stupa Kathmandu ka sabse peaceful aur divine place hai. Huge stupa ke 360deg par walk karte wagt ek alag hi spiritual energy feel hoti hai. Monks ki chanting aur prayer flags ki vibe pura atmosphere ko positive bana dete hai. Yahan ki local cafes se stupa ka view enjoy karna bhi ekdum memorable experience hai. Jo log Kathmandu aate hain unke liye yeh place must-visit hai for peace & spirituality."

"Visiting the Boudha Stupa in Kathmandu was a deeply calming experience. The sheer size of the white dome with the golden spire and the watchful eyes of the Buddha instantly creates a sense of peace. Walking around the kora (circumambulation path) with monks, locals, and pilgrims made me feel connected to something timeless.

The stupa is surrounded by vibrant prayer flags, traditional Tibetan chants, and small monasteries and cafes, making the atmosphere both spiritual and lively. It's not just a religious site, but also a cultural hub where you can feel the strong Tibetan Buddhist influence.

Even if you're not religious, the serenity of the place makes it worth visiting. I'd highly recommend going during early morning or evening, when butter lamps are lit and the stupa glows beautifully. Definitely one of the must-visit landmarks of Nepal."

Reaching the top reveals not just the majestic stupa, but one of the best views of the entire Kathmandu Valley.

Boudha Stupa is one of the most significant cultural and spiritual landmarks in Nepal. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it stands as a symbol of peace, harmony, and Buddhist faith. The massive white dome and gilded spire, adorned with the iconic eyes of Buddha, create an awe-inspiring sight that reflects centuries of tradition and devotion.

The atmosphere around the stupa is serene yet vibrant, with devotees performing kora (circumambulation), spinning prayer wheels, and offering butter lamps. Monasteries surrounding the stupa enhance its spiritual ambiance, while the presence of local shops and traditional eateries add cultural richness to the experience.

A visit to Boudha Stupa provides not only architectural and historical insight but also a deep sense of tranquility. It is truly a destination of both spiritual significance and cultural heritage, making it an essential highlight for visitors to Kathmandu.
